direct solid samples graphite furnace atomic absorption spectroscopy
direct solid sampling graphite furnace atomic absorption spectrometry
direct solid sampling graphite furnace atomic absorption spectroscopy
solid samples graphite furnace atomic absorption spectrometry
solid samples graphite furnace atomic absorption spectroscopy
solid sampling graphite furnace atomic absorption spectrometry

Class.label: quartz tube atomic absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where a solid sample is atomised by placing it in a small quartz tube which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it.

Class.label: flame atomic absorption spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where the sample is  aspirated, aerosolised, and mixed with combustible gases, such as acetylene and air or acetylene and nitrous oxide. The mixture is then ignited and atomised in a flame whose temperature ranges from 2100--2800 \degC. During combustion, atoms of the element of interest in the sample absorb light at characteristic wavelengths.

Class.label: thermospray flame furnace atomic absorption spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: thermospray flame furnace atomic absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where sample is forced through a heated metal capillary tip before atomisation in a flame.

Class.label: flow injection thermospray flame furnace absorption spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where the sample is carried to the spectrometer by flow injection and forced through a heated metal capillary tip before atomisation in a flame furnace.
hasExactSynonym: flow injection thermospray flame furnace absorption spectrometry

Class.label: flow injection atomic absorption spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where flow injection is used to transfer a sample to the spectrometer.

Class.label: flow injection electrothermal atomic absorption spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where flow injection is used to carry a sample to an electrothermal atomiser where it is atomised using a probe which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it.
hasExactSynonym: flow injection electrothermal atomic absorption spectrometry
flow injection electrothermal atomisation atomic absorption spectrometry
flow injection electrothermal atomization atomic absorption spectrometry
flow injection electrothermal atomization atomic absorption spectroscopy

Class.label: flow injection flame atomic absorption spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where flow injection is used to carry a gas phase sample to flame where it is atomised.
hasExactSynonym: flow injection flame atomic absorption spectrometry

Class.label: hydride generation atomic absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry where metal samples such as As, Sb and Se are vaporised by converting them into volatile hydrides.

Class.label: line-source atomic absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic absorption spectrometry using a line source of radiation.

Class.label: atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic spectroscopy where the atoms in the sample are excited and the emission of electromagnetic radiation at characteristic wavelengths is detected.

Class.label: electrothermal atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is atomised using a probe which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it.

Class.label: graphite furnace atomic emission spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is atomised by placing it in a small graphite-coated tube which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it.

Class.label: furnace atomic nonthermal excitation spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is atomised by placing it in a small graphite-coated tube which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it, then excited using a glow discharge (a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas).
hasExactSynonym: furnace atomic non thermal excitation spectrometry

Class.label: flame atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is excited using an N2/oxide--acetylene flame.

Class.label: glow discharge atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a glow discharge (a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas) is used to excite the sample.

Class.label: laser-induced atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a laser pulse is used as the excitation source.

Class.label: laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a high energy laser pulse is used to generate a plasma which acts as the excitation source.

Class.label: femtosecond laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a high energy femtosecond laser pulse is used to generate a plasma which acts as the excitation source.

Class.label: laser-induced shock wave plasma spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a high energy laser pulse is used to generate a plasma which acts as the excitation source. A second laser pulse then illuminates the sample resulting in a reheating of the laser plasma produced by the first pulse, leading to signal enhancement.

Class.label: micro laser-induced breakdown atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a finely focused (<10 m diameter) high energy laser pulse is used to generate a plasma which acts as the excitation source.

Class.label: nanosecond laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a high energy nanosecond laser pulse is used to generate a plasma which acts as the excitation source.

Class.label: plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of atomic emission spectrometry where a plasma is used as the excitation source.

Class.label: capacitively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a plasma generated by a potential difference between two electrodes, one of which is grounded and one of which is live.
hasExactSynonym: capacitively coupled plasma atomic emission spectrometry

Class.label: direct current plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a plasma generated by passing an electrical discharge between two electrodes is used as the excitation source.
hasExactSynonym: direct current plasma atomic emission spectrometry

Class.label: furnace atomisation plasma emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a furnace is used to atomise the sample and a plasma is used as the excitation source.

Class.label: inductively-coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a plasma generated by electromagnetic induction is used as the excitation source.
hasExactSynonym: inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectrometry
inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
inductively coupled plasma optical emission spectrometry
inductively coupled plasma optical emission spectroscopy

Class.label: hydride generation inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Atomic emission spectrometry of metal samples such as As, Sb and Se that are vaporised by converting them into volatile hydrides and excited using a plasma generated by electromagnetic induction.
hasExactSynonym: hydride generation inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectrometry
hydride generation inductively coupled plasma optical emission spectrometry
hydride generation inductively coupled plasma optical emission spectroscopy

Class.label: laser ablation inductively-coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Inductively coupled atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is vaporised by laser ablation.
hasExactSynonym: laser ablation inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectrometry

Class.label: laser microprobe inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Inductively coupled atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is vaporised by laser ablation with a finely focused (<10 m diameter) laser.

Class.label: liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy where the sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography.
hasExactSynonym: liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectrometry
liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma optical emission spectrometry
liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma optical emission spectroscopy

Class.label: nebulisation inductively-coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Inductively-coupled atomic emission spectrometry where the sample mixture is first passed through a nebuliser to form a mist of finely dispersed droplets using compressed air.
hasExactSynonym: nebulisation inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectrometry
nebulization inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectrometry
nebulization inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy

Class.label: ultrasonic nebulisation inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample mixture is first passed through a nebuliser to form a mist of finely dispersed droplets (using high frequency vibrations) and then excited using a plasma generated by electromagnetic inductance.
hasExactSynonym: ultrasonic nebulisation inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectrometry
ultrasonic nebulisation inductively coupled plasma optical emission spectrometry
ultrasonic nebulisation inductively coupled plasma optical emission spectroscopy
ultrasonic nebulization inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectrometry
ultrasonic nebulization inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
ultrasonic nebulization inductively coupled plasma optical emission spectrometry
ultrasonic nebulization inductively coupled plasma optical emission spectroscopy

Class.label: solid phase extraction inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample mixture is first separated by solid phase extraction and then excited using a plasma generated by electromagnetic inductance.

Class.label: flow injection solid phase extraction inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample mixture is first separated by solid phase extraction, carried to the spectrometer by flow injection and then excited using a plasma generated by electromagnetic inductance.

Class.label: metastable transfer emission spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where atoms are excited by energy transfer from metastable N2 species in a nitrogen plasma.

Class.label: microwave induced plasma atomic emission spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Atomic emission spectrometry where a plasma generated by microwave bombardment is used as the excitation source.

Class.label: spark atomic emission spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is excited by an arc or spark between two electrodes.

Class.label: atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Atomic spectroscopy where an atom absorbs then spontaneously emits a photon.

Class.label: cold vapour atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Atomic fluorescence spectroscopy where no vaporisation step is required because the sample is a volatile heavy metal such as mercury, which is a vapour at room temperature.

Class.label: electrothermal atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Atomic fluorescence spectroscopy where the sample is atomised using a probe which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it.

Class.label: flame atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic fluorescence spectroscopy where the sample is atomised using a flame.

Class.label: hydride generation atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic fluorescence spectroscopy of metal samples such as As, Sb and Se which are vaporised by converting them into volatile hydrides.

Class.label: laser-enhanced atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic fluorescence spectroscopy where a laser is used to excite the atoms in the sample.

Class.label: plasma atomic fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic fluorescence spectroscopy where a plasma is used to excite the atoms in the sample.

Class.label: inductively coupled plasma atomic fluorescence spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic fluorescence spectroscopy where a plasma generated by electromagnetic induction is used to excite the atoms in the sample.
hasExactSynonym: inductively coupled plasma atomic fluorescence spectroscopy

Class.label: fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of the fluorescence emitted by molecules excited by ultraviolet light is detected as a function of wavelength or time.

Class.label: fluorescence correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the spontaneous fluorescence intensity fluctuations of a sample are measured and correlated within a very small detection volume. Ultraviolet light is used to stimulate fluorescence.

Class.label: fluorescence cross-correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where spontaneous fluorescence intensity fluctuations of a sample are measured at two distinct wavelengths and correlated within a very small detection volume. Ultra-violet light is used to stimulate fluorescence.

Class.label: fluorescence anisotropy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for measuring the binding interaction between two labelled molecules. The sample is excited with vertically polarised light and the polarization of the fluorescence is measured.

Class.label: spectrophotometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation in the range ultraviolet to near-infrared (0.1--2.5 \mum) resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Class.label: ultraviolet-visible spectrophotometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation in the range ultraviolet to visible (190-800 nm) resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Class.label: differential optical absorption spectrophotometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Ultraviolet-visible spectroscopy where the difference between incident and transmitted radiation is measured for a gaseous sample.

Class.label: reflectance ultraviolet-visible spectrophotometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Ultraviolet--visible spectroscopy where the reflection or scattering of radiation from the sample surface is detected.

Class.label: equimolar spectrophotometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the absorption of radiation in the ultraviolet to near-infrared (0.1-2.5 μm) is used to calculate stability constants by equimolar dilution.

Class.label: vacuum ultraviolet spectrophotometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation in the vacuum ultraviolet region (0.1-200 nm) resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Class.label: X-ray spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the absorption or emission of X-rays is detected.

Class.label: X-ray absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with X-rays and the X-ray absorption coefficient of the sample is measured. When the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron in an atom there is a decrease in the intensity of transmitted X-rays resulting in an absorption edge.

Class.label: X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient around the absorption edge (the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron) are measured as a function of incident X-ray energy.

Class.label: extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient measured 500--1000 eV below the absorption edge (the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron) are determined as a function of incident X-ray energy.

Class.label: quick extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: quick extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectrometry
quick-scanning extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectrometry
quick-scanning extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient measured 500--1000 eV below the absorption edge (the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron) are determined as a function of incident X-ray energy. A monochromator is scanned continuously and rapidly around the absorption edge resulting in measurement times of seconds (normal EXAFS measurements take minutes).

Class.label: reflection extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: reflection extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient measured 500--1000 eV below the absorption edge (the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron) are determined as a function of incident X-ray energy. Measurements are taken under total reflection conditions.

Class.label: surface extended X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient and the Auger emission of the sample are measured 500--1000 eV below the absorption edge (the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron) as a function of incident X-ray energy.

Class.label: total-reflection X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: total-reflection X-ray absorption fine structure spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient around the absorption edge (the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron) are measured as a function of incident X-ray energy. Measurements are taken under total reflection conditions.

Class.label: near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: X-ray absorption near edge structure (XANES) spectroscopy
X-ray absorption near edge structure spectrometry
X-ray absorption near edge structure spectroscopy
near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray absorption spectroscopy where changes in the X-ray absorption coefficient measured within 40 eV of the absorption edge (the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron) are determined as a function of incident X-ray energy.

Class.label: X-ray microprobe spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with a finely focused X-ray beam (<10 m diameter) and the X-ray absorption coefficient of the sample is measured.

Class.label: X-ray emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with X-rays or particles and the energies and intensities of the X-rays emitted due to core-to-core transitions (known as 'X-ray fluorescence') are detected.

Class.label: alpha-particle X-ray spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray emission spectroscopy where the sample is irradiated with alpha-particles and the energies of the backscattered alpha-particles and X-rays emitted due to core-to-core transitions are measured.

Class.label: energy-dispersive X-ray emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray emission spectroscopy where the energy spectrum of the X-rays emitted due to core-to-core transitions is measured using a semiconductor detector.

Class.label: non-resonant X-ray emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with incident X-rays of a wavelength which does not correspond to a specific electronic transition within the atoms of the sample, and the energies and intensities of the emitted X-rays are measured.

Class.label: particle-induced X-ray emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray emission spectroscopy where the X-rays are generated by bombarding the sample with a focused beam of high-energy particles.

Class.label: microbeam particle-induced X-ray emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray emission spectroscopy where the X-rays are generated by bombarding the sample with a finely focused (<10 m diameter) beam of high-energy particles.

Class.label: electron probe X-ray microanalysis
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray emission spectroscopy where the X-rays are generated by bombarding a flat polished sample with a finely focused (<10 \mum diameter) beam of electrons which results in the ionisation of the inner shells of sample atoms. The decay of the ionised states results in the emission of characteristic X-rays.

Class.label: wavelength dispersive X-ray spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray emission spectroscopy where the energy spectrum of the X-rays emitted due to core-to-core transitions is measured using a diffraction grating or crystal.

Class.label: X-ray microemission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with a finely focused (<10 m diameter) X-ray beam and the energies and intensities of the X-rays emitted due to core-to-core transitions (known as 'X-ray fluorescence') are detected.

Class.label: soft X-ray emission spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: valence to core X-ray emission spectrometry
valence to core X-ray emission spectroscopy
valence to core X-ray fluorescence spectrometry
valence to core X-ray fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with low energy X-rays and the energies and intensities of the X-rays emitted due to valence-to-core transitions are detected.

Class.label: ultra soft X-ray emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with ultra-low energy (<1 keV) X-rays and the energies and intensities of the X-rays emitted due to valence-to-core transitions are detected.

Class.label: synchrotron radiation excited X-ray spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with radiation is generated in a synchrotron and the energies and intensities of the emitted X-rays are detected.

Class.label: X-ray reflection spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with X-rays and the energies of reflected X-rays are measured.

Class.label: total reflection X-ray fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with X-rays and the energies of totally reflected X-rays are measured.

Class.label: beta-particle spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the beta-particles spontaneously emitted from radioisotopes are detected.

Class.label: liquid scintillation counting
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the spontaneous emission of a beta-particle produces a flash of light (known as a 'scintillation') which is detected.

Class.label: circular dichroism spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised light by a sample.

Class.label: fluorescence detected circular dichroism spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised luminescence.

Class.label: magnetic circular dichroism spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised photon radiation in the presence of a magnetic field.

Class.label: X-ray magnetic circular dichroism spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised X-ray radiation in the presence of a magnetic field.

Class.label: vibrational circular dichroism spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised infrared radiation during a vibrational transition.

Class.label: electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to a perturbing magnetic field is measured.

Class.label: continuous-wave electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to a perturbing magnetic field is measured as a function of the frequency of a periodic perturbation.
hasExactSynonym: continuous wave electron paramagnetic resonance spectroscopy
continuous wave electron spin resonance spectrometry
continuous wave electron spin resonance spectroscopy

Class.label: pulsed electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to short (ns) pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field is measured.

Class.label: electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the absorption or emission of electrons is detected.

Class.label: appearance potential spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by the appearance of relaxation products (Auger electrons or X-rays) or by a change in the electron beam current.

Class.label: Auger electron appearance potential spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: electron-excited Auger electron appearance potential spectrometry
electron-excited Auger electron appearance potential spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by a sudden increase in secondary electron current.

Class.label: disappearance potential spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by the sudden disappearance of electrons from the beam.

Class.label: electron appearance potential fine structure analysis
hasExactSynonym: electron appearance potential fine structure spectrometry
electron appearance potential fine structure spectroscopy
extended appearance potential fine structure analysis
extended appearance potential fine structure spectrometry
extended appearance potential fine structure spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by a sudden change in the electron beam current. The fine structure close to the threshold is analysed by measuring the change in electron beam current.

Class.label: total current spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is determined by measuring the total electron current incident on the sample target.

Class.label: X-ray appearance potential spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by the sudden appearance of soft X-ray fluorescence.

Class.label: X-ray excited electron appearance potential spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with an electron beam and the energy threshold for excitation is indicated by the sudden appearance of peaks in the photoelectron spectrum.
hasExactSynonym: X-ray excited electron appearance potential spectrometry

Class.label: Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a high energy photon ionises a core electron and an electron from a higher energy level descends to take its place, releasing sufficient energy to eject a second so-called 'Auger' electron and the energy of the Auger electron is detected as a function of incident photon energy.

Class.label: angular dependent Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The energies of these Auger electrons are detected as a function of emission angle.

Class.label: resonant Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The wavelength of the incident photons is scanned over an absorption edge in the sample and the Auger electrons emitted are detected as a function of energy.

Class.label: angle-resolved resonant Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The wavelength of the incident photons is scanned over an absorption edge in the sample and the Auger electrons emitted are detected as a function of emission angle.

Class.label: Auger electron partial yield spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. Only the Auger electrons emitted at a particular photon energy are detected.

Class.label: electron-excited Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where electron bombardment of a sample results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electron and the energies of these Auger electrons are detected as a function of incident electron energy.

Class.label: electron microprobe Auger spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where bombardment of a sample with a finely focused (<10 m diameter) beam of electrons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The energies of these Auger electrons are detected as a function of incident electron energy.

Class.label: ion-excited Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where ion bombardment of a sample results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons, which are detected as a function of incident ion energy.

Class.label: He+-excited Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the bombardment of a sample with He+ ions results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons, which are detected as a function of incident He+ ion energy.

Class.label: proton-induced Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the bombardment of a sample with protons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons, which are detected as a function of incident proton energy.

Class.label: angle-resolved ion-excited Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where ion bombardment of a sample results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons, which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Class.label: scanning Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a high-energy photon beam is scanned over the surface of a sample resulting in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The energies of these Auger electrons are detected as a function of incident photon energy.

Class.label: spin-polarised Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The energies of these Auger electrons are detected as a function of incident photon energy and a magnet is used to align all electron spins parallel to the emitting surface.

Class.label: spin-polarised angle-resolved Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the bombardment of a sample with high-energy photons results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons. The energies of these Auger electrons are detected as a function of emission angle and a magnet is used to align all electron spins parallel to the emitting surface.

Class.label: X-ray excited Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where X-ray bombardment of a sample results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons, which are detected as a function of incident X-ray energy.

Class.label: continuous X-ray-induced Auger electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the bombardment of a sample with a continuous X-ray source (X-rays generated when electrons, or other high energy charged particles such as protons or alpha-particles, lose energy whilst passing through the Coulomb field of a nucleus) results in the ionisation of core electrons and the emission of so-called 'Auger' electrons, which are detected.

Class.label: electron coincidence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where two or more particles (electrons, photons or ions) originating from a single event, such as an ionisation, are detected as a function of energy.

Class.label: Auger-photoelectron coincidence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with X-rays resulting in the emission of photoelectrons and 'Auger' electrons which are detected as a function of energy.

Class.label: electron-electron coincidence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of a pair of electrons which are detected as a function of energy.

Class.label: angle-resolved electron-electron coincidence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of a pair of electrons which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Class.label: electron-electron-ion coincidence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of an ion and a pair of electrons which are detected as a function of energy.

Class.label: angle-resolved electron-electron ion coincidence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of an ion and a pair of electrons which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Class.label: electron-ion coincidence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of an ion and an electron which are detected as a function of energy.

Class.label: metastable-quenched electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with metastable atoms resulting in the emission of two or more particles (electrons, photons or ions) which are detected as a function of energy.

Class.label: resonance-ionisation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with metastable atoms resulting in the emission of an electron (by resonant ionisation) and an Auger electron.

Class.label: surface Penning-ionisation electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with metastable atoms resulting in the emission of an electron (by Penning ionisation) and an Auger electron.

Class.label: photoion-photoelectron coincidence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with high-energy photons resulting in the emission of a photoelectron and its corresponding ion which are detected as a function of energy.

Class.label: electron energy loss spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known, narrow range of kinetic energies (50--200 eV) interacts with a surface and the energy loss (0.005--100 eV) the electrons suffer as a result of the interaction is measured.

Class.label: characteristic energy-loss spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known, narrow range of kinetic energies is reflected by a surface and the number of electrons with a given characteristic energy loss is measured.

Class.label: extended electron energy loss fine structure spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: extended electron energy loss fine structure spectrometry
extended energy loss fine structure spectrometry
extended energy loss fine structure spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known, extended range of kinetic energies is reflected by a surface and the energy loss the electrons suffer upon reflection is measured. Measurements are taken from the absorption edge onset to several hundred eV above it.

Class.label: surface extended electron energy loss fine structure spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known, extended range of kinetic energies is reflected by a surface and the Auger emission is measured. Measurements are taken from the absorption edge onset to several hundred eV above it.

Class.label: high-resolution energy loss spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known, narrow range of kinetic energies is reflected by a surface and the small energy loss (0.02--1 eV) the electrons suffer upon reflection is measured.

Class.label: ionisation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the loss in energy of electrons produced by ionisation is measured.

Class.label: low-energy electron loss spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: low energy electron energy loss spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known, narrow range of low kinetic energies is reflected by a surface and the energy loss the electrons suffer upon reflection is measured.

Class.label: transmission electron energy loss spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known, narrow range of kinetic energies is transmitted through a sample and the energy distribution of the transmitted electrons is measured.

Class.label: vibrational electron energy loss spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a beam of electrons with a known, narrow range of kinetic energies is reflected by a surface and energy loss the electrons suffer (corresponding to vibrational modes in the sample) is measured.

Class.label: field-emission electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of electron spectroscopy where electrons are emitted from a cathode by application of an intense electric field.
hasExactSynonym: field emission energy distribution spectroscopy FEEDS

Class.label: field-emission electron spin-polarization spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of electron spectroscopy where electrons are emitted from a cathode by application of an intense electric field and a magnet is used to align all electron spins parallel to the sample surface.

Class.label: inverse photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons and the photons emitted are detected.

Class.label: bremsstrahlung isochromat spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation.

Class.label: angle-resolved bremsstrahlung isochromat spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation which is detected as a function of emission angle.

Class.label: momentum-resolved bremsstrahlung spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation which is detected as a function of photon momentum.

Class.label: ultraviolet bremsstrahlung isochromat spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation in the ultraviolet region.

Class.label: X-ray bremsstrahlung isochromat spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation in the X-ray region.

Class.label: k-resolved inverse photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with electrons which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation which is detected as a function of the vector k (where k is the difference between the wave vectors of the incident and scattered radiation).

Class.label: spin-polarised inverse photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a magnetised ferromagnetic sample is bombarded with electrons of a specific spin polarisation which decay in unoccupied states emitting bremsstrahlung radiation.

Class.label: metastable de-excitation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where energy transfer from a metastable atom in close proximity to (~5 ) the sample gives rise to a characteristic ejected electron energy spectrum.

Class.label: spin-polarized metastable de-excitation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where energy transfer from a metastable atom in close proximity to (~5 ) the sample gives rise to a characteristic ejected electron energy spectrum. A magnet is used to align all the electron spins parallel to the surface.

Class.label: photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured. The energy of the incident photons is usually greater than the ionisation energy of the sample and the photoelectrons are emitted with the excess in the form of kinetic energy.

Class.label: angle-resolved photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Class.label: depth-selective photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with gamma-rays causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: photoelectron extended fine structure spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons which are detected as a function of energy. The spectrum is recorded over an extended energy range, from the photon absorption edge onset to several hundred eV above it.

Class.label: angle-resolved photoelectron extended fine structure spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: angle-resolved photoelectron extended fine structure spectrometry
angle-resolved photoemission extended fine structure spectrometry
angle-resolved photoemission extended fine structure spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons which are detected as a function of emission angle. The spectrum is recorded over an extended energy range, from the photon absorption edge onset to several hundred eV above it.

Class.label: photoelectron microspectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a finely focused (<10 m) photon beam causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: extreme ultraviolet photoelectron microspectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a finely focused (<10 m) extreme ultraviolet (10--121 nm) photon beam causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: synchrotron radiation photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation (X-ray--ultraviolet) generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: angle-resolved synchotron radiation photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation (X-ray--ultraviolet) generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Class.label: constant-final-state spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation (X-ray--ultraviolet) generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons. The energy distribution of electrons which have been promoted to a specific conduction band is measured.

Class.label: constant-initial-state spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation (X-ray--ultraviolet) generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons. The energy distribution of electrons which have been promoted from a specific valence band is measured.

Class.label: photoelectron yield spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation (X-ray--ultraviolet) generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons. All photoelectrons emitted at a particular photon energy are detected.

Class.label: partial-yield spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation (X-ray--ultraviolet) generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons. All of the photoelectrons emitted within a certain energy interval are detected.

Class.label: resonance-enhanced photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation (X-ray--ultraviolet) generated in a synchrotron causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons. The energy of the incoming photons is adjusted such that it coincides with an electronic transition of the molecule.

Class.label: ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with ultraviolet (10--400 nm) photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.
hasExactSynonym: ultra-violet photoemission spectroscopy ultra-violet photoemission spectrometry

Class.label: angle-resolved ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with ultraviolet (10--400 nm) photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Class.label: vacuum ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with vacuum ultraviolet (10--20 nm) photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: photoelectron spectroscopy of the inner shell
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with X-rays causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: angle-resolved X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with X-rays causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, which are detected as a function of emission angle.

Class.label: high-resolution X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with monochromatic X-rays causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: soft X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with 'soft' (<300 eV) X-rays causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: high-resolution soft X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: high resolution soft X-ray photoelectron spectrometry
high resolution soft X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
high resolution soft X-ray photoemission spectrometry
high resolution soft X-ray photoemission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with monochromatic 'soft' (<300 eV) X-rays causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: valence-shell photoionisation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with photons causing ionisation of the valence shell and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: zero kinetic energy electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured. The energy of the incident photons matches the ionisation energy of the sample so emitted electrons have zero kinetic energy.

Class.label: secondary electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where primary electrons interact with a sample and the electrons emitted as a result of the interaction (secondary electrons) are detected.

Class.label: angle-resolved secondary electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where primary electrons interact with a sample and the electrons emitted as a result of the interaction (secondary electrons) are detected as a function of emission angle.

Class.label: spin-polarised secondary electron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where primary electrons interact with a sample and the electrons emitted as a result of the interaction (secondary electrons) are detected. A magnet is used to align all electron spins parallel to the surface of the sample.

Class.label: gamma-ray spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energies of gamma-rays emitted or absorbed by a sample is measured.

Class.label: particle-induced gamma-ray emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of gamma-ray emission spectroscopy where the gamma-rays are produced by bombarding the sample with a focused beam of ions.

Class.label: gamma-ray scattering spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where gamma-rays are absorbed by a sample resulting in the ejection of an electron and the emission of light which is detected.

Class.label: Mossbauer spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample is detected.

Class.label: depth-selective Mossbauer spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where gamma-rays are absorbed by a sample resulting in the ejection of conversion electrons, the energy distribution of which is measured.

Class.label: nuclear spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of gamma-ray emission spectroscopy where atomic nuclei are excited (by a heavy ion beam or by collision with another nucleus) and their decaying gamma-ray emissions are measured.

Class.label: nuclear activation analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of activation analysis where atomic nuclei are excited (by a heavy ion beam or by collision with another nucleus) and their decaying gamma-ray emissions are measured and compared to reference spectra.

Class.label: impedance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the change in impedance (the resistance of alternating current) of a sample during excitation is measured as a function of frequency.

Class.label: alternating current impedance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the change in impedance (the resistance of alternating current) of a sample during excitation with an alternating-current voltage is measured.

Class.label: electrochemical-induced impedance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the change in impedance (the resistance of alternating current) of an electrochemical cell is measured.

Class.label: laser-induced impedance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the change in impedance (the resistance of alternating current) of a sample during laser excitation is measured.

Class.label: ion spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the absorption of emission of ions is detected.

Class.label: ion-beam spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a focused beam of ions is directed at a sample and the secondary ions emitted are detected.

Class.label: direct recoil spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a focused beam of ions is directed at a sample causes binary collisions with surface molecules which result in molecular decomposition and the emission of atoms.

Class.label: ion microprobe spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectrocsopy where a finely focused (<10 m diameter) beam of ions is directed at a sample and the secondary ions emitted are detected.

Class.label: low-energy radioactive ion-beam spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a focused beam of proton is directed at a uranium sample and the secondary ions emitted are detected.

Class.label: ion mobility spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the velocity of gas phase ions in an electric field is measured.

Class.label: differential mobility spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: high field asymmetric waveform ion mobility spectrometry
high field asymmetric waveform ion mobility spectroscopy
high-field asymmetric waveform ion mobility spectrometry
high-field asymmetric waveform ion mobility spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the velocity of gas phase ions in an electric field is measured. A radio frequency voltage forces the ions to oscillate between two electrodes causing some ions to be transmitted while others collide with the walls of the electrodes.

Class.label: drift tube ion mobility spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the velocity of gas phase ions in an electric field is measured. The ions are gated into a region of constant electric field strength and the ions with highest mobility arrive at the detector first.

Class.label: ion scattering
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure where the sample is bombarded with ions (100--1000 eV) and the energies and positions of the scattered ions are detected.

Class.label: Rutherford backscattering spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with He+ or H+ ions (500--1500 eV) and the energies and positions of any backscattered ions are detected.

Class.label: laser spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more laser beams and the absorption or emission of light by the sample is measured.

Class.label: laser absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more laser beams and the absorption of light by the sample is measured.

Class.label: direct laser absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more laser beams and light absorption is measured.

Class.label: collinear laser spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is in the form of an accelerated beam of particles (atoms or ions) which is superimposed on a resonant laser beam (a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample) and light absorption is measured.

Class.label: collinear fast atom-beam spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is in the form of a high-speed accelerated beam of atoms which is superimposed on a resonant laser beam (a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample) and light absorption is measured.

Class.label: collinear laser ion-beam spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is in the form of an accelerated beam of ions which is superimposed on a resonant laser beam (a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample) and light absorption is measured.

Class.label: collinear fast ion-beam laser spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is in the form of a high-speed accelerated beam of ions which is superimposed on a resonant laser beam (a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample) and light absorption is measured.
hasExactSynonym: collinear fast ion beam laser spectrometry

Class.label: tunable diode laser absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of laser spectroscopy where a diode laser is tuned to a specific absorption line of interest in the sample and the intensity of the transmitted radiation is measured.

Class.label: laser electric resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of laser spectroscopy where a fixed-wavelength infrared  or ultraviolet laser is used to excite the sample which is placed in an electric field. By varying the strength of the applied electric field some vibrational--rotational transitions can be made to coincide with the laser wavelength and the absorption of the laser light is measured.

Class.label: frequency modulation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a laser which is tuned to match an absorption frequency of the molecules in the sample.

Class.label: indirect laser absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of laser spectroscopy where an effect induced by the absorption of laser light is detected.

Class.label: intracavity laser absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is placed inside the laser cavity and an effect induced by the absorption of laser light is detected.

Class.label: cavity enhanced absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is placed inside a highly reflective laser cavity and an effect induced by the absorption of laser light is detected. The laser light is tuned to match the frequency of the cavity bandwidth.

Class.label: optical feedback cavity enhanced absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is placed inside a v-shaped optical cavity and an effect induced by the absorption of laser light is detected. The laser light is allowed to feed back to the laser diode.
hasExactSynonym: optical feedback cavity enhanced absorption spectrometry

Class.label: super continuum cavity enhanced absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is placed inside a highly reflective laser cavity and an effect induced by the absorption of a supercontinuum light source is detected. The light source is tuned to match the frequency of the cavity bandwidth.
hasExactSynonym: super continuum cavity enhanced absorption spectrometry

Class.label: cavity ring-down spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of laser spectroscopy where the sample is placed inside a highly reflective laser cavity and an effect induced by the absorption of laser light is detected. The decay time for light exiting the cavity is determined as a function of pulsed laser wavelength.
hasExactSynonym: cavity ring-down laser absorption spectrometry cavity ringdown spectroscopy

Class.label: concentration modulated absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a pump laser is used to excite a chromophore and the transmitted power of a probe laser is used to determine the state concentration (excited vs. non-excited) of the sample.

Class.label: laser dissociation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a laser and molecules in the sample dissociate following the absorption of one or more high-energy photons.

Class.label: multiphoton dissociation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a laser and molecules in the sample dissociate following the absorption of two or more high-energy photons.

Class.label: resonance enhanced multiphoton dissociation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a resonant laser (a laser which is tuned to match a transition within the sample) and molecules in the sample dissociate following the absorption of two or more high-energy photons.

Class.label: resonance ion dissociation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a sample in the form of ions is illuminated with a resonant laser (a laser which is tuned to match a transition within the sample) and molecules in the sample dissociate following the absorption of one or more high-energy photons.

Class.label: laser induced fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a laser causing molecules in the sample to be electronically excited. The photons emitted as a result of the decay of the molecules back down to the ground state are measured.

Class.label: thermal lens spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy generated by nonradiative thermal relaxation after laser light absorption is measured.

Class.label: visible thermal lens spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy generated by nonradiative thermal relaxation after visible laser light absorption is measured.

Class.label: ultraviolet thermal lens spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy generated by nonradiative thermal relaxation after ultraviolet laser light absorption is measured.

Class.label: laser emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a thermally-excited vapour sample is illuminated with an ultraviolet or visible laser and the photon emission spectrum of the sample is observed.

Class.label: laser micro emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a thermally-excited vapour sample is illuminated with a finely focused (<10 m diameter) ultraviolet or visible laser and the photon emission spectrum of the sample is observed.

Class.label: laser ionisation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a sample is illuminated with a laser and photoexcitation is used to promote an atom or molecule above its ionisation potential to create an ion.

Class.label: resonance ionisation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a sample is illuminated with resonant laser light (using a laser which is tuned to match an electronic transition within the sample) and photoexcitation is used to promote an atom or molecule above its ionisation potential to create an ion.

Class.label: laser-enhanced ionisation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where resonant laser illumination (using a laser which is tuned to match an electronic transition within the sample) is used to ehanced the collisional ionisation of atoms (or molecules) occurring in a flame.

Class.label: laser multiphoton ionisation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a sample is illuminated with a laser and photoexcitation (by the absorption of two or more photons) is used to promote an atom or molecule above its ionisation potential to create an ion.

Class.label: resonance enhanced multiphoton ionisation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a sample is illuminated with resonant laser light (using a laser which is tuned to match an electronic transitions within the sample) and photoexcitation (by the absorption of two or more photons) is used to promote an atom or molecule above its ionisation potential to create an ion.

Class.label: laser microprobe spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more finely focused (<10 m diameter) laser beams and the absorption or emission of light by the sample is measured.

Class.label: resonance-enhanced laser microprobe spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more finely focused (<10 m diameter) resonant laser beams (lasers which have been tuned to match an electronic transition within the sample) and the absorption or emission of light by the sample is measured.

Class.label: optogalvanic spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the current passing through a gas discharge is monitored as a laser light source is tuned through the frequencies of allowed transitions for excited atoms in the discharge.

Class.label: mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectrometry where the sample is converted into gaseous ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: acceleration mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised and the ions are accelerated to very high kinetic energies.

Class.label: chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: low pressure chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
low pressure chemical ionisation mass spectroscopy
low pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry
low pressure chemical ionization mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction (electron or proton transfer) with reagent (N2, O2, H2O) gaseous ions at low pressure. Reagent ions are produced by electron ionisation.

Class.label: atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation mass spectroscopy
atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry
atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction (electron or proton transfer) with reagent (N2, O2, H2O) gaseous ions at atmospheric pressure. Reagent ions are produced by electron ionisation with electrons from a radioactive beta-source or a corona discharge.

Class.label: desorption chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is dissolved in a volatile solvent and dropped onto a heated filament before being ionised by interaction (electron or proton transfer) with reagent (N2, O2, H2O) gaseous ions at low pressure. Reagent ions are produced by electron ionisation.

Class.label: negative ion chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction with reagent gaseous anions at low pressure.
hasExactSynonym: negative ion chemical ionisation mass spectroscopy
negative ion chemical ionization mass spectrometry
negative ion chemical ionization mass spectroscopy

Class.label: positive ion chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction with reagent gaseous cations at low pressure.
hasExactSynonym: positive ion chemical ionisation mass spectroscopy
positive ion chemical ionization mass spectrometry
positive ion chemical ionization mass spectroscopy

Class.label: collision-induced dissociation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised and selected ions are allowed to collide with neutral gas molecules resulting in fragmentation.

Class.label: electron capture negative ionisation mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: electron capture negative ionisation mass spectroscopy
electron capture negative ionization mass spectroscopy
resonant electron capture negative ionisation mass spectrometry
resonant electron capture negative ionisation mass spectroscopy
resonant electron capture negative ionization mass spectrometry
resonant electron capture negative ionization mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction with thermal electrons (electrons with energy 0.1 eV or less).

Class.label: electron ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by electrons (energy 70 eV) which have been emitted from a glowing filament and accelerated through an electric field.

Class.label: furnace atomisation electron ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is atomised using an electrothermal (resistively-heated) furnace and then ionised by electrons (energy 70 eV) which have been emitted from a glowing filament and accelerated through an electric field.
Class.hasExactSynonym: furnace atomization electron ionization mass spectroscopy

Class.label: electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectrometry where the sample is ionised by electrospray ionization. The ions are then characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: cold-spray ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small cold (10-80 C) capillary (at a flow rate of 1-10 L min1).

Class.label: desorption electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by directing charged solvent droplets (which are formed by forcing the solvent through a small heated capillary into an electric field) at the sample surface. The droplets form a thin film on the sample surface, dissolving the analyte of interest.

Class.label: high-resolution electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: high resolution electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
high resolution electrospray ionisation mass spectroscopy
high resolution electrospray ionization mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. When the ions are analysed using their mass-to-charge ratios the exact mass is determined as opposed to the nominal mass (the number of protons and neutrons).

Class.label: ionspray mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing an aqueous solution of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1-10 L min1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Class.label: microelectrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Class.label: nanoelectrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of nL min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Class.label: high-performance liquid chromatography-nanoelectrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before being ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of nL min1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. The ions are then characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: high performance liquid chromatography-nanoelectrospray ionisation mass spectroscopy
high performance liquid chromatography-nanoelectrospray ionization mass spectrometry
high performance liquid chromatography-nanoelectrospray ionization mass spectroscopy

Class.label: secondary electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample ionised by spraying it with a very fine mist of charged droplets which was produced by forcing a solvent through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field.

Class.label: field ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction with a high electric field.

Class.label: field desorption mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is deposited on a solid surface known as an 'emitter' and ionised by interaction with a high electric field.

Class.label: pyrolysis field desorption mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is pyrolysed then deposited on a solid surface known as an 'emitter' and ionised by interaction with a high electric field.

Class.label: high resolution field ionisation mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: high resolution field ionisation mass spectroscopy
high resolution field ionization mass spectrometry
high resolution field ionization mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by interaction with a high electric field. When the ions are analysed using their mass-to-charge ratios the 'exact' mass is determined as opposed to the 'nominal' mass (the number of protons and neutrons).

Class.label: pyrolysis field ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is pyrolysed then ionised by interaction with a high electric field.

Class.label: temperature-resolved pyrolysis field ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is pyrolysed then ionised by interaction with a high electric field. The ions are analysed using their mass-to-charge ratios as a function of temperature during pyrolysis.
hasExactSynonym: temperature programmed pyrolysis field ionisation mass spectrometry
temperature programmed pyrolysis field ionisation mass spectroscopy
temperature programmed pyrolysis field ionization mass spectrometry
temperature programmed pyrolysis field ionization mass spectroscopy
temperature resolved pyrolysis field ionisation mass spectrometry
temperature resolved pyrolysis field ionization mass spectrometry
temperature-programmed pyrolysis field ionisation mass spectrometry
temperature-programmed pyrolysis field ionisation mass spectroscopy
temperature-programmed pyrolysis field ionization mass spectrometry
temperature-programmed pyrolysis field ionization mass spectroscopy
temperature-resolved pyrolysis field ionisation mass spectrometry
temperature-resolved pyrolysis field ionisation mass spectroscopy
temperature-resolved pyrolysis field ionization mass spectrometry
temperature-resolved pyrolysis field ionization mass spectroscopy

Class.label: gas chromatography-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Any method where a sample mixture is first separated by gas chromatography then ionised and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: gas chromatography with mass spectrometric detection

Class.label: high-resolution mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the 'exact' mass of the molecular ions in the sample is determined as opposed to the 'nominal' mass (the number of protons and neutrons).

Class.label: ion mobility spectrometry-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectrometry where the ionic species associated with the peaks in an ion mobility spectrum are identified by a mass spectrometer.

Class.label: ion trap mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric or magnetic field.

Class.label: ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is determined by measuring their cyclotron frequency (the frequency at which they precesses in a fixed magnetic field).

Class.label: Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectroscopy
ion cyclotron resonance Fourier transform mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is determined by measuring their cyclotron frequency (the frequency at which they precesses in a fixed magnetic field) and subjecting it to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: high-resolution Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: high resolution Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry
high resolution Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is determined by measuring their cyclotron frequency (the frequency at which they precesses in a fixed magnetic field). The 'exact' mass of the sample ions is determined as opposed to the 'nominal' mass (the number of protons and neutrons).

Class.label: quadrupole mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes.

Class.label: three-dimensional quadrupole mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by three electrodes.

Class.label: isotope ratio mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the relative abundance of isotopes in a sample is determined.

Class.label: elemental analysis isotope ratio mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: elemental analyser isotope ratio mass spectrometry
elemental analyser isotope ratio mass spectroscopy
elemental analysis isotope ratio mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is first subject to elemental analysis (dropped onto a heated reactor which contains an oxidant---such as copper and chromium oxide---and combusted at 900 C to produce N2, NOx, H2O and CO2 which are reduced in a stream of helium) before the relative abundance of isotopes in the sample is determined.

Class.label: gas chromatography-isotope ratio mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by gas chromatography before being characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance of isotopes.
hasExactSynonym: gas chromatography isotope ratio mass spectrometry
gas chromatography isotope ratio mass spectroscopy

Class.label: liquid chromatography-isotope ratio mass spectrometry
