Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before it is ionised and the relative abundance of isotopes in the sample is determined.
hasExactSynonym: liquid chromatography isotope ratio mass spectrometry
liquid chromatography isotope ratio mass spectroscopy

Class.label: isotope dilution mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the relative abundance of isotopes in a sample is determined by using an isotope dilution standard (the sample labelled with a rare isotope).

Class.label: isotope dilution inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: isotope dilution-inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by a plasma which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The relative abundance of isotopes in the sample is then determined by using an isotope dilution standard (the sample labelled with a rare isotope).

Class.label: high-performance liquid chromatography-isotope dilution inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before being ionised by a plasma which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The ions are then characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and the relative abundance of isotopes in the sample is determined using an isotope dilution standard (the sample labelled with a rare isotope).
hasExactSynonym: high performance liquid chromatography isotope dilution inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
high performance liquid chromatography isotope dilution inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Class.label: isotope dilution inductively coupled plasma quadrupole mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: isotope dilution inductively coupled plasma quadrupole mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by a plasma which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The mass-to-charge ratios of the ions in the sample are then measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes. The relative abundance of isotopes in the sample is determined by using an isotope dilution standard (the sample labelled with a rare isotope).

Class.label: stable isotope ratio mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the relative abundance of non-radioactive isotopes in a sample is determined.

Class.label: laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser.

Class.label: laser microprobe mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is vaporised and ionised using a finely focused (<10 um diameter) high-energy pulsed laser.

Class.label: negative ion laser desorption mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry using negative ionisation where a high-energy pulsed laser is used for sample vaporisation.
hasExactSynonym: negative ion laser desorption mass spectroscopy
negative ion laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
negative ion laser desorption-ionisation mass spectroscopy
negative ion laser desorption-ionization mass spectrometry
negative ion laser desorption-ionization mass spectroscopy

Class.label: positive ion laser desorption mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry using positive ionisation where a high-energy pulsed laser is used for sample vaporisation.
hasExactSynonym: positive ion laser desorption mass spectroscopy
positive ion laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
positive ion laser desorption-ionisation mass spectroscopy
positive ion laser desorption-ionization mass spectrometry
positive ion laser desorption-ionization mass spectroscopy

Class.label: matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample (usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule) is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is held in a matrix (such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid) to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules.

Class.label: matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: matrix assisted laser desorption ionisation time of flight mass spectrometry
matrix assisted laser desorption ionisation time of flight mass spectroscopy
matrix assisted laser desorption ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
matrix assisted laser desorption ionization time of flight mass spectrometry
matrix assisted laser desorption ionization time of flight mass spectroscopy
matrix assisted laser desorption/ionisation time of flight mass spectrometry
matrix assisted laser desorption/ionisation time of flight mass spectroscopy
matrix assisted laser desorption/ionization time of flight mass spectrometry
matrix assisted laser desorption/ionization time of flight mass spectroscopy
matrix-assisted laser desorption ionization (MALDI-TOF) mass spectrometry (MS)
matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
matrix-associated laser desorption/ionization-time of flight mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry where the sample ions are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Class.label: sol-gel-assisted laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample (usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule) is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is held in a sol-gel matrix to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules.

Class.label: surface-enhanced laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample (usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule) is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is mixed with a matrix compound (such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid) and deposited on a surface, with some chemical functionality, to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules.

Class.label: liquid chromatography-matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser, and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance. The sample (usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule) is held in a matrix (such as dihydrobenzoic acid) to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules.
hasExactSynonym: liquid chromatography matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation mass spectrometry
liquid chromatography matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation mass spectroscopy
liquid chromatography matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionization mass spectroscopy

Class.label: liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: photoionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is irradiated with an ultraviolet laser. The sample absorbs one or more photons resulting in ionisation.

Class.label: atmospheric pressure photoionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is irradiated with an ultraviolet laser at atmospheric pressure. The sample absorbs one or more photons resulting in ionisation.

Class.label: multiphoton ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is irradiated with an ultraviolet laser. The sample absorbs two or more photons resulting in ionisation.

Class.label: resonance-enhanced multiphoton ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is irradiated with a resonant laser (a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample). The sample absorbs one or more photons resulting in ionisation.

Class.label: resonance ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is irradiated with a resonant laser (a laser beam with a wavelength that corresponds to an atomic transition in the sample). The sample absorbs two or more photons resulting in ionisation.

Class.label: sonic spray mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where ionisation is achieved using a pneumatic nebuliser which turns the sample solution into a supersonic spray of small droplets. Ions are formed when the solvent evaporates and the statistically unbalanced charge distribution on the droplets leads to a net charge.

Class.label: thermospray mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a pressurised solution of the sample is forced through a heated metal capillary tip. Ions are formed when the solvent evaporates and the statistically unbalanced charge distribution on the droplets leads to a net charge.

Class.label: thermal ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where ionisation is achieved by loading the sample onto a heated filament.

Class.label: particle beam mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a liquid sample passes through a desolvation chamber producing a beam of microscopic solid particles.

Class.label: plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas, such as Ar, containing free electrons).

Class.label: capacitively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Plasma mass spectrometry where the plasma has been generated by a potential difference between two electrodes, one of which is grounded and one of which is live.

Class.label: electron cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Plasma mass spectrometry where the plasma has been generated by superimposing a static magnetic field and a high-frequency electromagnetic field at the electron cyclotron resonance frequency (the frequency at which an electron precesses in a magnetic field).

Class.label: glow-discharge mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Plasma mass spectrometry where the plasma has been generated by passing an electrical discharge between two electrodes under reduced pressure. The ions are then characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Plasma mass spectrometry where the plasma has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Class.label: electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
electrothermal vaporization inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
electrothermal vaporization inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Plasma mass spectrometry where the sample is vaporised by depositing it on a probe which is rapidly heated (to >1000 deg C) by passing a current through it.

Class.label: slurry electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: ETV-ICP-MS where the solid sample is prepared by grinding into a fine powder and suspension in a diluent such as 0.1% HNO3.
hasExactSynonym: slurry electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
slurry electrothermal vaporization inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
slurry electrothermal vaporization inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
slurry sampling electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry

slurry sampling electrothermal vaporization inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
slurry sampling electrothermal vaporization inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Class.label: slurry nebulisation electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a solid sample is ground to a fine powder and suspended in a diluent (such as 0.1% HNO3) before being vaporised by a probe which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it. The vaporised sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.
hasExactSynonym: slurry nebulisation electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
slurry nebulization electrothermal vaporization inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry

Class.label: solid sampling electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a solid sample is vaporised by depositing it on a probe which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it. The vaporised sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.
hasExactSynonym: direct solid sampling electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Class.label: high performance liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before being ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction, and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: high performance liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
high performance liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry

Class.label: high-performance liquid chromatography fluorescence detection-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography with fluorescence detection before being ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction, and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: high performance liquid chromatography fluorescence detection inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
high performance liquid chromatography fluorescence detection inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Class.label: high-performance liquid chromatography photodiode array-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography with photodiode array detection before being ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction, and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: high performance liquid chromatography photodiode array inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
high performance liquid chromatography photodiode array inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Class.label: high-resolution inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: high resolution inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
high resolution inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The 'exact' mass of the sample ions is then determined as opposed to the 'nominal' mass (the number of protons and neutrons).

Class.label: inductively coupled plasma field sector mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: inductively coupled plasma field sector mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The beam of ions is then directed into magnetic field, the orientation of which is perpendicular to the beam. The magnetic field forces the charged particles into different circular trajectories, the radii of which depend on the strength of the magnetic field, the accelerating voltage, and the mass of the ion.

Class.label: inductively coupled plasma three dimensional quadrupole mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: inductively coupled plasma three dimensional quadrupole mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is then measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by three electrodes.

Class.label: inductively coupled plasma time-of-flight mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: inductively coupled plasma time of flight mass spectrometry
inductively coupled plasma time of flight mass spectroscopy
inductively coupled plasma time-of-flight mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The sample ions with different masses are then accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured.

Class.label: laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is vaporised using a laser pulse then ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Class.label: laser ablation inductively coupled plasma time-of-flight mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: laser ablation inductively coupled plasma time of flight mass spectrometry
laser ablation inductively coupled plasma time of flight mass spectroscopy
laser ablation inductively coupled plasma time-of-flight mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is vaporised using a laser pulse then ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. The sample ions with different masses are then accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured.

Class.label: liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction, and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry

Class.label: multiple collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: multi collector-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
multicollector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
multicollector inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
multiple collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction. A series of collectors ised used to detect several ion beams simultaneously.

Class.label: size-exclusion chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by size-exclusion chromatography before being ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction, and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: size-exclusion chromatography inductively coupled mass spectrometry

size-exclusion chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Class.label: size-exclusion chromatography-high-performance liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by size-exclusion and high-performance liquid chromatographies before being ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction, and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: size-exclusion chromatography-high performance liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
size-exclusion chromatography-high performance liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Class.label: solution inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a sample mixture (a solution in dilute HNO3) is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.
hasExactSynonym: solution inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Class.label: solution nebulisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a sample mixture (a solution in dilute HNO3) is passed through a nebuliser to form a mist of finely dispersed droplets before being ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.
hasExactSynonym: solution nebulisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy
solution nebulization inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
solution nebulization inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Class.label: microwave-induced plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by microwave radiation.

Class.label: plasma desorption mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by bombarding the sample (mounted on a thin foil) with a highly energietic fission fragment from 252Cf.

Class.label: secondary ion mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is bombarded with a stream of primary mass-selected particles and the secondary ions ejected from the sample are detected.

Class.label: dynamic secondary ion mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is bombarded with a continuous focused beam of primary mass-selected ions which remove material from the surface of the sample by sputtering. The secondary ions ejected from the sample are then detected.

Class.label: sputtered neutral atom mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is bombarded with a continuous focused beam of primary mass-selected ions which remove material from the surface of the sample by sputtering. The neutral atoms ejected from the sample are ionised and detected.

Class.label: fast-atom bombardment mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample (which is held in a liquid matrix) is bombarded with a stream of primary noble gas atoms and the secondary ions ejected from the sample are detected.

Class.label: mass spectrometry of recoiled ions
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is bombarded with a stream of primary mass-selected particles and the secondary elemental ions (usually H+, D+ or He+) ejected from the sample are detected.

Class.label: time-of-flight secondary ion mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is bombarded with a stream of primary mass-selected particles and the secondary ions ejected from the sample are detected by accelerating them to the same (known) kinetic energy and measuring the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Class.label: secondary electron emission mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a surface is bombarded with sample ions and the secondary electrons emitted are detected.

Class.label: 15N nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 15N nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: sector field mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample ions are directed into magnetic field, the orientation of which is perpendicular to the beam. The magnetic field forces the charged particles into different circular trajectories, the radii of which depend on the strength of the magnetic field, the accelerating voltage, and the mass of the ion.

Class.label: selected ion flow tube mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by introducing it into a tube containing fast flowing He gas and ions such as H3O+, NO+ and O2+.
hasExactSynonym: selected ion flow tube mass spectroscopy

Class.label: proton transfer reaction mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by introducing it into a tube containing fast flowing He gas and H3O+ ions.

Class.label: selective ion monitoring
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the intensities of one or more specific ion beams are recorded rather than the entire mass spectrum.

Class.label: single-ion monitoring
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the intensity of a specific ion beam is recorded rather than the entire mass spectrum.

Class.label: multiple-ion monitoring
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the intensities of multiple specific ion beams are recorded rather than the entire mass spectrum.

Class.label: spark source mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by a vacuum spark discharge, which is generated by a pulsed high (25--100 kV) potential difference between two electrodes.

Class.label: tandem mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps, with some form of fragmentation occurring between each stage.

Class.label: collision-induced dissociation tandem mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: collision induced dissociation tandem mass spectrometry
collision induced dissociation tandem mass spectroscopy
collisionally activated dissociation tandem mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps, where the sample ions are allowed to collide with neutral gas molecules (resulting in fragmentation) between each mass-selection stage.

Class.label: electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps, with some form of fragmentation occurring between each stage. Sample ionisation is achieved by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 uL min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Class.label: high-performance liquid chromatography-electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before being ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of it through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 uL min1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. The ions are then characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance by two mass spectrometers in series.
hasExactSynonym: high performance liquid chromatography electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
high performance liquid chromatography electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectroscopy
high pressure liquid chromatography electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectroscopy
high pressure liquid chromatography electrospray ionization tandem mass spectroscopy

Class.label: tandem quadrupole mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps, with some form of fragmentation occurring between each stage. The mass-to-charge ratios of the sample ions are measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes.

Class.label: time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Class.label: microspectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of chemical imaging spectroscopy where an optical microscope is used to image the sample and locate a small area for spectral analysis.

Class.label: microspectrophotometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where an optical microscope is used to image the sample and locate a small area for spectral analysis with radiation in the ultraviolet to near infrared range.

Class.label: rotational spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy which probes the rotational degrees of freedom of a molecule.

Class.label: microwave spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with radiation in the microwave region (1--1000 mm).

Class.label: Fourier transform microwave spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is irradiated with a single pulse of radiation in the microwave region (1--1000 mm) and the spectrum is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: molecular beam Fourier transform microwave spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: molecular beam Fourier transform microwave spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample (in the form of a molecular beam) is irradiated with a single pulse of radiation in the microwave region (1--1000 mm) and the spectrum is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: laser ablation molecular beam Fourier transform microwave spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: laser ablation molecular beam FT microwave spectroscopy
laser ablation molecular beam Fourier transform microwave (LA-MB-FTMW) spectroscopy
laser ablation molecular beam Fourier transform microwave spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample (in the form of a molecular beam) is vaporised by laser ablation before being irradiated with a single pulse of radiation in the microwave region (1--1000 mm) and the spectrum is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: neutron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a beam of neutrons is used to probe atomic and magnetic dynamics.

Class.label: nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation.

Class.label: one-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them, and the spectrum is obtained by plotting chemical shift vs. frequency.

Class.label: 1H nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 1H nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 11B nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 11B nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 13C nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 13C nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: distortionless enhancement with polarization transfer
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 13C nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.The 13C NMR signals are enhanced by transferring 1H magnetisation to 13C nuclei and the phase of the signals reflects the multiplicity i.e. CH, CH2 or CH3). Separate methyl, methylene and methine spectra may be obtained.

Class.label: 19F nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 19F nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: two-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment in which a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between interacting nuclei.

Class.label: correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei which are J-coupled (usually \leq 3 bonds apart).

Class.label: heteronuclear correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and heteronuclei.

Class.label: heteronuclear multiple bond coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and nuclei which are 2--3 bonds removed.

Class.label: gradient-selected heteronuclear multiple bond coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where pulsed-field gradients are used and a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and nuclei which are 2--3 bonds removed.

Class.label: heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Class.label: heteronuclear single quantum coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Class.label: total correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy which reveal correlations between all nuclei of a spin-system.

Class.label: J-spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear proton--proton) NMR spectroscopy where chemical shift and J-coupling information are separated onto different frequency axes.

Class.label: nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart).

Class.label: heteronuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed, based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart).

Class.label: flip-back nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear two-dimensional NMR spectroscopy incorporating a water flip-back sequence, based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart).

Class.label: rotating frame Overhauser effect spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed, based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement (NOE) effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart). Spin-locking is employed to ensure that correlation between spins, which are close in space but have zero NOE, are seen. This technique is used for molecules whose tumbling regime lies at the border of positive and negative NOE responses.
hasExactSynonym: cross-relaxation appropriate for minimolecules emulated by locked spins

Class.label: steady-state nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed, based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart). In this technique, the saturation of a particular proton resonance (signal) perturbs the intensities of signals from spatially proximate nuclei.

Class.label: insensitive nuclei enhancement by polarisation transfer
Class.IAO_0000115: A heteronuclear NMR experiment in which magnetisation arising from 1H nuclei is transferred to covalently bound heteronuclei, thereby enhancing the NMR signal of the heteronuclei.
hasExactSynonym: insensitive nuclei enhancement by polarization transfer

Class.label: pulsed nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: solid state nuclear magnetic resonance spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the response of nuclei with non-zero spin, in a solid sample, to a perturbing magnetic field is detected. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample and involving magic angle spinning.

Class.label: combined rotation and multiple pulse spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei, which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples, cause significant line broadening in solid state NMR, but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field).The combination of multiple-pulse NMR experiments and magic angle spinning. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.
hasExactSynonym: combined rotation and multiple pulse spectrometry

Class.label: cross-polarisation magic angle spinning
hasExactSynonym: cross polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
cross polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Magic angle spinning spectroscopy where cross polarisation is used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei.

Class.label: high-resolution magic angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: Magic angle spinning spectroscopy using a high resolution magnetic susceptibility matching probe.

Class.label: photoacoustic spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sound emitted when a gaseous sample is exposed to an intense laser beam, which is rapidly interrupted by a rotating slotted disk, is measured.

Class.label: infrared photoacoustic spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sound emitted when a gaseous sample is exposed to an intense infrared laser beam, which is rapidly interrupted by a rotating slotted disk, is measured.

Class.label: Fourier transform infrared photoacoustic spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Infrared photoacoustic spectroscopy where the spectrum is then subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: photothermal spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where light energy absorbed by the sample results in heating and the subsequent change in temperature, pressure or density is measured.

Class.label: scanning tunnelling spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a scanning tunnelling microscope is used to measure the I-V characteristics of the sample.

Class.label: surface plasmon resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the resonant excitation of surface plasmons (usually on a noble metal e.g. Au or Ag surface) by ultraviolet or visible light is measured. The light source is incident on the noble metal surface through a prism, at a range of angles that are above the critical angle where total internal reflection occurs. At a certain angle excitation of the surface plasmons occurs, leading to a minimum in the reflected light. The resonance angle shifts whenever the optical density of the sample in contact with the noble metal undergoes a change, and thus it allows detection of the adsorption or desorption of molecules.

Class.label: electrochemical surface plasmon resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the resonant excitation of surface plasmons on a surface, which is the working electrode in an electrochemical experiment, by ultraviolet or visible light is measured.

Class.label: surface plasmon resonance imaging
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the resonant excitation of surface plasmons (usually on a Au or Ag surface) by ultraviolet or visible light is measured, during which the reflectivity of the sample is measured at a fixed angle or wavelength.

Class.label: terahertz time-domain spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy using short pulses of radiation from the teraherz range (1 millimetre to 100 micrometres).

Class.label: vibrational spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy which probes the vibrational degrees of freedom of a molecule.

Class.label: inelastic electron tunnelling spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a metal-molecule-metal sandwich is formed and electrons tunnel from metal to metal through the molecules. Any additional molecules adsorbed onto the inner layer of the sandwhich can affect the tunneling via the excitation of vibrational states.

Class.label: infrared absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the infrared region (0.78 to 1000 micrometres).

Class.label: infrared evanescent wave spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy using radiation in the infrared region (0.78--1000 \mum) where an evanescent wave is generated using an optical fibre.

Class.label: far-infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation in the far infrared region (15--1000 \mum).

Class.label: infrared multiphoton dissociation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the infrared region (0.78--1000 \mum) with sufficient energy to cause photodissociation by the absorption of two or more photons.

Class.label: resonant infrared multiphoton dissociation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs resonant radiation from the infrared region (0.78--1000 \mum) with sufficient energy to cause photodissociation by the absorption of two or more photons.

Class.label: mid-infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation in the mid infrared region (3--8 \mum).

Class.label: Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs a single pulse of radiation from the infrared region (0.78--1000 \mum) and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: micro infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from a finely focused beam (<10 \mum diameter) of infrared light  (0.78--1000 \mum).

Class.label: near-infrared absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the near infrared region (0.8--2 \mum).

Class.label: Fourier transform near infrared absorbance spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: Fourier transform near infra-red absorbance spectrometry
Fourier transform near infra-red absorption spectrometry
Fourier transform near infrared absorbance spectrometry
Fourier transform near infrared absorbance spectroscopy
Fourier transform near infrared absorption spectrometry
Fourier transform near infrared absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs a single pulse of radiation from the near infrared region (0.8--2 \mum) and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: non-dispersive infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the difference in infrared radiation (0.78--1000 \mum) bsorption of a sample cell against a reference cell is measured.

Class.label: surface enhanced infrared absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the rough metal surface of a sample absorbs radiation in the infrared region (0.78--1000 \mum).

Class.label: transient infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where transient species such as radicals, ions or reactive intermediates are studied using pulses from an infrared laser. The infrared absorbance of the sample before and after an excitation laser pulse is measured.

Class.label: infrared reflectance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the reflection or scattering of infrared radiation (0.78--1000 \mum) by a sample is detected.

Class.label: diffuse reflectance infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the diffuse reflection of infrared radiation by a sample is measured.

Class.label: diffuse reflectance infrared Fourier transform spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: diffuse reflectance infra-red Fourier transform spectrometry
diffuse reflectance infrared Fourier transform spectrometry
diffuse reflectance infrared Fourier transform spectroscopy
diffuse reflectance infrared spectroscopy by Fourier transform
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the diffuse reflection of a single pulse of infrared radiation by a sample is measured, and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: near-infrared reflectance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the reflection or scattering of near infrared radiation (0.8-2 micrometres) by a sample is detected.

Class.label: reflection--absorption infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the absorption and reflection of low incident angle infrared light by the surface molecules of a highly reflective or polished sample is measured.

Class.label: attenuated total reflectance infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where infrared light is introduced into a prism at an angle exceeding the critical angle for internal reflection. This produces an evanescent wave at the reflecting surface (a surface which is transparent to infrared such as thallium bromide) on which the sample is supported, and the distortion of the evanescent wave by the sample is measured.

Class.label: infrared emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is heated and the infrared radiation (0.78--1000 \mum) emitted during cooling is detected.

Class.label: flame infrared emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is heated in a flame and the infrared radiation (0.78--1000 \mum) emitted during cooling is detected.

Class.label: Fourier transform flame infrared emission spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: Fourier transform flame infra-red emission spectrometry
Fourier transform flame infrared emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is heated in a flame and the infrared radiation  (0.78--1000 \mum) emitted during cooling is detected. The spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: Fourier transform infrared emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: IR emission spectroscopy where the spectrum is obtained by a single pulse of (UV) radiation, and is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: mid-infrared emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is heated and the mid infrared radiation (0.78--1000 \mum) emitted during cooling is detected.

Class.label: planar array infrared emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is heated and the infrared radiation (0.78--1000 \mum) emitted during cooling is detected with a two-dimensional focal plane array infrared camera.

Class.label: single-photon infrared emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is heated using ultraviolet excitation (single photon) and the infrared radiation (0.78--1000 \mum) emitted during cooling is detected.

Class.label: Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, usually from a laser in the visible, near infrared, or near ultraviolet range by a sample is detected.

Class.label: chiral Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where vibrational optical activity is measured by means of a small difference in the intensity of Raman scattering from chiral molecules of right- and left-circularly polarised incident light.

Class.label: coherent Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from three lasers (known as pump, probe and Stokes/anti-Stokes) by a sample is detected. Multiphoton excitation is used to produce a signal in which the emitted waves are coherent.

Class.label: coherent Stokes Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light by a sample is detected. An anti-Stokes frequency stimulation beam is used and a Stokes frequency beam is observed. Multiphoton excitation is used to produce a signal in which the emitted waves are coherent.

Class.label: coherent Stokes resonance Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light by a sample is detected. An anti-Stokes frequency stimulation beam is used and a Stokes frequency beam is observed and the difference between the pump and the Stokes beams coincides with the frequency of an electronic transition within the molecule. Multiphoton excitation is used to produce a signal in which the emitted waves are coherent.

Class.label: coherent anti-Stokes Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light by a sample is detected. A Stokes frequency stimulation beam is used and an anti-Stokes frequency beam is observed. Multiphoton excitation is used to produce a signal in which the emitted waves are coherent.

Class.label: coherent anti-Stokes resonance Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light by a sample is detected. A Stokes frequency stimulation beam is used and an anti-Stokes frequency beam is observed and the difference between the pump and the anti-Stokes beams coincides with the frequency of an electronic transition within the molecule. Multiphoton excitation is used to produce a signal in which the emitted waves are coherent.

Class.label: confocal Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light is detected. An aperture is used to discriminate between Raman signal coming from the focused laser spot and Raman signal coming from the out-of-focus region of the sample.

Class.label: confocal Raman microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The collection of spatially resolved Raman spectra of a sample during optical microscopy. An aperture is used to discriminate between Raman signal coming from the laser spot and that coming from the out-of-focus region of the sample.

Class.label: Fourier transform Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of light (produced by a single laser pulse) by a sample is detected and the spectrum is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: hyper Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of light by a (liquid) sample is detected. During scattering, photons from the incident laser (with frequency \omega) are scattered by sample into photons of the second harmonic (photons with frequency 2\omega).

Class.label: polarised Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the polarisation of light which has been subjected to Raman scattering by a sample is determined.

Class.label: resonance Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Raman spectroscopy where the energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light coincides with an electronic transition in the sample.

Class.label: Kerr-gated resonance Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, usually from a laser in the visible, near infrared, or near ultraviolet range, by a sample is detected. The energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light coincides with an electronic transition within the sample, and the laser is combined with a Kerr gate fluorescence rejection system.

Class.label: surface-enhanced resonance Raman spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: surface enhanced resonance Raman scattering spectrometry
surface enhanced resonance Raman scattering spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from a visible laser, by a sample adsorbed onto a metal (Au, Ag or Cu) surface is detected. The energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light coincides with an electronic transition within the sample.

Class.label: ultraviolet resonance Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from an ultraviolet laser, by a sample is detected. The energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light coincides with an electronic transition within the sample.

Class.label: deep ultra-violet resonance Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from a deep ultraviolet (<300 nm) laser, by a sample is detected. The energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light coincides with an electronic transition within the sample.

Class.label: spatially-offset Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from a laser, by a sample is detected. Scattered light is collected from regions laterally offset from the excitation laser spot.

Class.label: stimulated Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from two lasers ('pump' and 'probe') by a sample is detected.

Class.label: femosecond stimulated Raman spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: emtosecond broadband stimulated Raman scattering spectrometry
femtosecond broadband stimulated Raman scattering spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from a femtosecond laser pulse, by a sample is detected. The laser pulse is generated by the mixing of two lasers ('pump' and 'probe').

Class.label: surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from a visible laser, by a sample adsorbed onto a metal (Au, Ag or Cu) surface is detected.

Class.label: tip-enhanced Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from a visible laser (500--650 nm), by metal surfaces, where scattering is enhanced by the optical near-field of a metal-coated scanning probe microscopy tip, is detected.

Class.label: ultra-high vacuum tip-enhanced Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of visible laser light, by metal surfaces, where scattering is enhanced by the optical near field of a scanning tunnelling tip, under ultra-high vacuum is detected.

Class.label: ultraviolet Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from an ultraviolet laser, by a sample is detected.

Class.label: thermal analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: Any measurement technique in which a physical property of the sample is measured as a function of temperature.

Class.label: calorimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters (e.g. enthalpy) during a chemical or biochemical reaction.

Class.label: isothermal titration calorimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters (e.g. enthalpy) at constant temperature during a titration.

Class.label: differential scanning calorimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters (e.g. enthalpy) during a chemical or biochemical reaction of both a sample and a reference, by the known variation (step-wise or linear) of one variable, whilst a second is kept constant.

Class.label: heat-flux differential scanning calorimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters (e.g. enthalpy) during a chemical or biochemical reaction of both a sample and a reference, by the known variation (step-wise or linear) of one variable, whilst a second is kept constant using a heat-flux differential scanning calorimeter.

Class.label: power-compensation differential scanning calorimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters (e.g. enthalpy) during a chemical or biochemical reaction of both a sample and a reference, by the known variation (step-wise or linear) of one variable, whilst a second is kept constant using a power compensation differential scanning calorimeter.

Class.label: differential thermal analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the temperature difference between the sample and a reference material.

Class.label: thermoacoustimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: Thermal analysis where the characteristics of imposed acoustic wave passing through the sample are measured.

Class.label: thermodilatometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of a dimension of the sample under negligible load as a function of temperature.

Class.label: thermogravimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the mass of a sample as a function of temperature.

Class.label: thermomagnetometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the magnetic susceptibility of a sample as a function of temperature.

Class.label: thermoptometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of an optical characteristic of a sample as a function of temperature.

Class.label: thermoluminescence
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the luminescence of a sample as a function of temperature.

Class.label: thermophotometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the total light, or the light of a specific wavelength emitted by a sample as a function of temperature.

Class.label: thermorefractometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the refractive index of a sample as a function of temperature.

Class.label: glass refractive index measurement
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the refractive index of small glass fragments as a function of temperature. The glass fragments are placed in silicone oil and observed as the temperature is raised. At the point where the glass fragment disappear the refractive index of the oil and glass are equal.

Class.label: thermosonimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the sound emitted by a sample as a function of temperature.

Class.label: neutron diffraction
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of cold or thermal neutrons at a sample and recording the resulting diffraction pattern.

Class.label: neutron powder diffraction
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of cold or thermal neutrons at a powdered solid sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted neutrons.

Class.label: X-ray--ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with radiation in the range Xray--ultraviolet, which causes ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being ionised and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance using two mass spectrometers in series.

Class.label: capillary electrophoresis-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Any method where the sample is first separated by capillary electrophoresis, before being analysed by mass spectrometry.

Class.label: capillary electrophoresis-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: capillary electrophoresis inductively coupled plasma-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a sample mixture is first separated by capillary electrophoresis, before being ionised in a plasma which has been generated by electromagnetic induction and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: direct analysis in real time mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: direct analysis in real time mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by a corona discharge within a He atmosphere.

Class.label: electrospray ionisation Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: electrospray ionisation Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 microlitre min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. The mass-to-charge ratio of the ions is then determined by measuring their cyclotron frequency (the frequency at which they precesses in a fixed magnetic field) and subjecting it to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: electrophoresis-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Any method where the sample is first separated by electrophoresis, before being analysed by mass spectrometry.

Class.label: two-dimensional gel electrophoresis-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by two-dimensional gel electrophoresis, before being converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: direct analysis in real time time-of-flight mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: direct analysis in real time time-of-flight mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by a corona discharge within a He atmosphere. Sample ions with different masses are then accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Class.label: ambient ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Any mass spectrometry technique where the sample is ionised at low or ambient temperature.

Class.label: low-temperature plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) generated by an alternating current.

Class.label: laser mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is illuminated with a laser.

Class.label: continuous-wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: continuous wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectrometry
continuous wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Spectra are obtained by scanning a range of radio frequencies.

Class.label: high-performance liquid chromatography nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before the energy states of spin-active nuclei in the sample, placed in a static magnetic field, are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation.
hasExactSynonym: high performance liquid chromatography nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy

Class.label: ultra-performance liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by ultra-performance liquid chromatography before being converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: ultra performance liquid chromatography mass spectrometry

Class.label: high-performance liquid chromatography-nuclear magnetic resonance-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography before the energy states of spin-active nuclei in the sample, placed in a static magnetic field, are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. The sample is then converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: high performance liquid chromatography nuclear magnetic resonance mass spectrometry
high performance liquid chromatography-nuclear magnetic resonance-mass spectrometry

Class.label: extractive electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a neutral sample, in the form of a gas or aerosol flow, is ionised by directing it into a plume of charged droplets, generated by forcing a solution of pure solvent through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1-10 microlitres per minute) into an electric field.

Class.label: Carr-Purcell-Meiboom-Gill pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse sequence which is applied during nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy to measure spin--spin (T2) relaxation times. For the pulse sequence see Rev. Sci. Inst., (1958), 29, pg 688.

Class.label: quadrupolar Carr-Purcell-Meiboom-Gill pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse sequence which is applied during nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy of quadrupolar nuclei, to measure spin--spin (T2) relaxation times. In the solid state, the sequence is used to achieve sensitivity enhancement for nuclei with low gyromagnetic ratios. For the pulse sequence see J. Phys. Chem. A, (1997), 101, pg 8597.
hasExactSynonym: quadrupolar Carr, Purcell,Meiboom, Gill pulse sequence

Class.label: 33S nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 33S nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: ultra-high-field nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static (>900 MHz) magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 77Se nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 77Se nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: high-field nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static (>300 MHz) magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: one-dimensional nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where only one frequency dimension is employed, based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (<=6 angstrom apart).

Class.label: two-dimensional nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed, based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (<=6 angstrom apart).

Class.label: high resolution fast-atom bombardment mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: high resolution fast-atom bombardment mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample (which is held in a liquid matrix) is bombarded with a stream of primary noble gas atoms and the secondary ions ejected from the sample are detected. The 'exact' mass of these secondary is then determined, as opposed to the 'nominal' mass (the number of protons and neutrons).

Class.label: 2H nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 2H nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: selective insensitive nuclei enhancement by polarization transfer
Class.IAO_0000115: A heteronuclear NMR experiment in which magnetisation arising from 1H nuclei is transferred to covalently bound heteronuclei, thereby enhancing the NMR signal of the heteronuclei. Selective pulses, that only excite or 'select' some of the signals in the spectrum are used in this experiment.
hasExactSynonym: selective insensitive nuclei enhancement by polarisation transfer

Class.label: annular dark-field scanning transmission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115:
Microscopy where a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum. The beam of electrons is scattered or diffracted before reaching the specimen, and the image results from a weakening of the beam by its interaction with the sample. An annular aperture is used to select electrons that have passed
through given symmetric zones within the objective lens of the microscope.

Class.label: high-angular annular dark-field scanning transmission electron microscopy
hasExactSynonym: high angle annular dark field scanning transmission electron microscopy
high angular annular dark-field scanning transmission electron microscopy
high-angle annular dark-field scanning transmission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum. The beam of electrons is scattered or diffracted at high angles before reaching the specimen, and the image results from a weakening of the beam by its interaction with the sample. An annular aperture is used to select electrons that have passed through given symmetric zones within the objective lens of the microscope.

Class.label: bright-field scanning transmission electron microscopy
hasExactSynonym: bright field scanning transmission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum. The beam of electrons passes directly through an aperture before reaching the specimen. The image results from a weakening of the direct beam by its interaction with the sample.

Class.label: synchrotron radiation X-ray diffraction
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at the sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate. The X-rays are generated by the acceleration of charged particles through magnetic fields.

Class.label: diffusion-ordered spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of NMR spectroscopy using pulsed-field gradients where the rate of decay of NMR signals in each component of a sample mixture is measured across a series of experiments. The rate of signal decay is proportional to the diffusion coefficient for each component.

Class.label: matrix-assisted laser desorption--ionisation quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: matrix assisted laser desorption ionisation quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometry
matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation quadrupole time-of-flight mass
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample (usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule) is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is held in a matrix (such as dihydrobenzoic acid) to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules. In the first stage the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes (a quadrupole). In the second stage the sample ions are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Class.label: gas chromatography time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by gas chromatography then sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Class.label: electrospray ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets and where sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Class.label: liquid chromatography-electrospray ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: liquid chromatography electrospray ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets and where sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Class.label: reversed-phase liquid chromatography-electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the sample mixture is first separated by reverse-phase liquid chromatography before being ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of it through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 uL min1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. The ions are then characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance by two mass spectrometers in series.
hasExactSynonym: reverse-phase liquid chromatography electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
reversed-phase liquid chromatography electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectroscopy

Class.label: 31P nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 31P nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 51V nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 51V nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: discharge mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by an electrical discharge.

Class.label: dielectric barrier discharge ionisation mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: dielectric barrier discharge ionisation mass spectroscopy
dielectric barrier discharge ionization mass spectrometry
dielectric barrier discharge ionization mass spectroscopy
