Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are both electrophoresis. Separation occurs in one plane, that plane is rotated by 90 deg. and the next separation step is carried out.

Class.label: gel electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium consisting of gel, across which an electric field is applied.

Class.label: agarose gel electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium consisting of agarose gel, across which an electric field is applied.

Class.label: polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of polyacrylamide gel, across which an electric field is applied.

Class.label: capillary electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrophoresis method which takes place in a capillary.

Class.label: isotachophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrophoresis method in a discontinuous buffer system where the analytes migrate according to their electrophoretic mobilities, forming a chain of adjacent zones moving with equal velocity between two solutions, the leading and terminating electrolytes, bracketing the mobility range of the analytes.

Class.label: isoelectric focusing
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrophoresis method for the separation of amphoteric analytes according to their isoelectric points by the application of an electric field along a pH gradient.

Class.label: sodium dodecyl sulfate polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of polyacrylamide gel, across which an electric field is applied, and the electrophoretic mobility of the analytes, usually proteins is altered by their binding to sodium dodecyl sulfate.

Class.label: difference gel electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A two dimensional gel electrophoresis method where protein analytes have been previously labelled with different fluorescent dyes and different analytes are compared.

Class.label: two dimensional gel electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are both gel electrophoresis.

Class.label: sieving electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrophoresis method where the separation medium contains a reticulated system, for example an entangled polymer network, that further separates the analytes according to their size and shape.

Class.label: capillary sieving electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrophoresis method that takes place in a capillary and where the separation medium contains a reticulated system, for example an entangled polymer network, that further separates the analytes according to their size and shape.

Class.label: capillary gel electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method that takes place in a capillary and where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium consisting of gel, across which an electric field is applied.

Class.label: capillary isoelectric focusing
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrophoresis method for the separation of amphoteric analytes according to their isolectric points by the application of an electric field along a pH gradient in a capillary.

Class.label: capillary isotachophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrophoresis method in a capillary containing a discontinuous buffer system where the analytes migrate according to their electrophoretic mobilities, forming a chain of adjacent zones moving with equal velocity between two solutions, the leading and terminating electrolytes, bracketing the mobility range of the analytes.

Class.label: electrokinetic chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method based on a combination of electrophoresis and interactions of the analytes with additives which form a dispersed phase moving at a different velocity.

Class.label: micellar electrokinetic chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Electrokinetic chromatography where the secondary phase is a micellar dispersed phase.

Class.label: microemulsion electrokinetic chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Electrokinetic chromatography where the secondary phase is a microemulsion.

Class.label: capillary electrochromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Electrokinetic chromatography where the movement of the mobile phase through a capillary is achieved by electroosmotic flow. The retention time is determined by a combination of electrophoretic migration and chromatographic retention.

Class.label: capillary affinity electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrophoresis method which takes place in a capillary where the separation medium has specific interactions with the analytes.

Class.label: affinity electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrophoresis method where the separation medium has specific interactions with the analytes.

Class.label: liposome electrokinetic chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Electrokinetic chromatography where the secondary phase has liposomes suspended in it.

Class.label: denaturing gradient gel electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where colloidal particles consisting of polynucleotides move at different speeds according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of a gel that contains a denaturing agent that causes double-stranded DNA to unzip, across which an electric field is applied.

Class.label: temperature gradient gel electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where colloidal particles consisting of polynucleotides move at different speeds according to their charge and frictional forces in a separation medium consisting of a gel, across which an electric field is applied and across which there is a gradient of temperatures that cause double-stranded DNA to unzip.

Class.label: dielectrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where colloidal particles move at different speeds according to their dielectrophoretic mobilities in a separation medium, across which an electric field is applied.

Class.label: free-flow electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrophoresis method where the sample is introduced continuously to the separation chamber and the electric field is applied perpendicular to the hydrodynamic flow resulting in two-dimensional separation of the analytes based on the flow rate and their electrophoretic mobilities.

Class.label: isotachophoretic focusing
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrophoresis method where colloidal particles move at different speeds in a separation medium that has an electrophoretic mobility gradient so that the analytes move and stack in the order of their electrophoretic mobilities.

Class.label: separation method-measurement method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method in which a separation method is coupled to a measurement method in order to perform measurements upon different components of a sample.

Class.label: capillary liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Chromatography which takes place in a separation capillary and where the mobile phase is a liquid.

Class.label: reversed-phase liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Liquid chromatography where the mobile phase is significantly more polar than the stationary phase, for example a microporous silica-based material with chemically bonded alkyl chains.

Class.label: normal-phase liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Liquid chromatography where the stationary phase is more polar than the mobile phase. This is the default for liquid chromatography.

Class.label: magnetic sector mass spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A mass spectrometer that uses a wedge-shaped magnetic field to separate the total ion beam into discrete ion beams according to the mass-to-charge ratio of the ions.

Class.label: magnetic sector
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus consisting of a magnet which is used to separate an ion beam into discrete ion beams according to the mass-to-charge ratio of the ions.

Class.label: electric sector
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which applies an electric field in order to select ions that have the same kinetic energy from an ion beam.

Class.label: double-focusing mass spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A mass spectrometer that applies an electric field in order to select ions that have the same kinetic energy from an ion beam and uses a wedge-shaped magnetic field to separate the total ion beam into discrete ion beams according to the mass-to-charge ratio of the ions.

Class.label: forward-geometry double-focusing mass spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A double-focusing mass spectrometer where the electric sector precedes the magnetic sector.
hasExactSynonym: forward-geometry double-focusing magnetic sector mass spectrometer
forward-geometry double-focussing magnetic sector mass spectrometer

Class.label: reverse-geometry double-focusing mass spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A double-focusing mass spectrometer where the magnetic sector precedes the reverse sector.
hasExactSynonym: reverse-geometry double-focusing magnetic sector mass spectrometer
reverse-geometry double-focussing magnetic sector mass spectrometer

Class.label: Faraday cup
Class.IAO_0000115: An ion detector consisting of a collector electrode connected to a high-ohmic resistor and surrounded by a Faraday cage. The voltage drop across the resistor is a measure of the ion current.

Class.label: ion detector
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that produces an output that depends on the number of ions that it encounters.

Class.label: electron multiplier
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that on contact with a charged particle of sufficient energy emits a greater number electrons.

Class.label: discrete-dynode electron multiplier
Class.IAO_0000115: An electron multiplier that consists of a sequence of discrete electron multiplier electrodes, or dynodes.

Class.label: continuous-dynode electron multiplier
Class.IAO_0000115: An electron multiplier that consists of a single electrode in the form of a horn of plenty. The ions impinge on the wall of the horn at the open end, producing a cascade of electrons which is multiplied on each interaction with the wall and focussed onto a preamplifier.

Class.label: Daly detector
Class.IAO_0000115: An ion detector that consists of an aluminised cathode or Daly knob held at a very large negative potential that attracts ions and produces secondary electrons which impact a scintillator, producing photons that are detected by a photomultiplier.

Class.label: X-ray powder diffractometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which illuminates a powder sample with X-rays, electrons or neutrons and measures the diffraction pattern produced. It typically will contain at least one monochromator to ensure the incident radiation is of a specific energy, a goniometer which allows the geometry of the sample and detector to be precisely specified, and a detector.

Class.label: atomic force microscopy probe
Class.IAO_0000115: A sharp spike mounted on the end of a cantilever which is used to scan the surface of a specimen in atomic force microscopy.

Class.label: incident photon conversion efficiency spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of incident photon-to-current conversion efficiency (IPCE) vs. wavelength obtained from a solar or photovoltaic cell.
hasExactSynonym: incident photon to collected electron (IPCE) spectra
incident photon to collected electron (IPCE) spectrum
incident photon to collected electron spectra
incident photon to current collection efficiency spectrum

Class.label: proton detected separated local field spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment for the measurement of heteronuclear dipolar couplings. 1H--1H interactions are decoupled and proton magnetisation is passed through 13C nuclei present at natural abundance to simplify a dipolarly coupled spectrum.

Class.label: R-type recoupling proton detected separated local field spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A magic-angle spinning NMR experiment to measure dipolar couplings. Dipolar couplings are reintroduced by synchronising rf pulses with the rotation of the rotor. Spectral simplification occurs via the proton detected separated local field protocol where 1H-1H interactions are decoupled and proton magnetisation is passed through 13C nuclei present at natural abundance.
hasExactSynonym: R-type recoupling proton detected local field spectroscopy
proton-deteced separated local field spectroscopy with R-type recoupling

Class.label: far-infrared magnetic resonance spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: laser magnetic resonance (LMR) at far-infrared wavelengths
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy levels of paramagnetic species (such as HCN) are tuned into resonance with a far-infrared laser source in order to investigate rotational transitions.

Class.label: three-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy in which three independent frequency dimensions are employed for the correlation and dispersal of signals (by employing two magnetisation transfer steps). Each signal is described by three frequencies, thus effecting the distribution of signals within a cube.

Class.label: heteronuclear single quantum coherence total correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the proton signals of a 2D TOCSY spectrum are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to the chemical shift of their covalently bound heteronuclei.

Class.label: heteronuclear three-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy in which three independent frequency dimensions are employed for the correlation and dispersal of signals. Each signal is described by three frequencies, arising from a combination of protons and heteronuclei, thus effecting the distribution of signals within a cube.

Class.label: homonuclear three-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy in which three independent frequency dimensions are employed for the correlation and dispersal of signals. Each signal is described by three frequencies, all arising from the same type of nucleus, thus effecting the distribution of signals within a cube.

Class.label: time-lapse microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy in which the same object (e.g., a cell) is imaged at regular time intervals over several hours.

Class.label: elemental analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A process where a sample is analyzed for its elemental and sometimes isotopic composition (the elements present and sometimes their weight percentage).

Class.label: carbon, hydrogen and nitrogen elemental analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of elemental analysis accomplished by combustion of the sample at 1200 deg. C in a stream of unreactive gas and excess oxygen and collection of the products (CO2, H2O and NOx). The masses of these combustion products can be used to calculate the composition of the unknown sample.

Class.label: quartz crystal microbalance
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus used to measure the mass per unit area (1 \mug per cm2) by measuring the change in frequency of a quartz crystal resonator (a quartz crystal sandwiched between a pair of electrodes) as a function of mass change.

Class.label: polarization modulation infrared reflection--adsorption spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: polarization modulation infrared reflection adsorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the differential absorption and reflection of low incident angle p- and s-polarized infrared light by the surface molecules of a highly reflective or polished sample is measured. The ultra-thin layers on metal surfaces interact with the p-polarized component of light, but not with the s-polarized component.

Class.label: 15N solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states 15N nuclei in a solid sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 13C solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states 13C nuclei in a solid sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 125Te nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 125Te nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: osmometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the osmotic strength of a substance which often used to determine its molecular weight.

Class.label: vapour pressure osmometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique used to determine the concentration of osmotically active particles that reduce the vapor pressure of a solution. Vapour pressure osmometry is used to measure the average molecular weight of polymers.

Class.label: time-lapse fluorescence microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce (emit energy as visible light) and the specimen is imaged at regular time intervals over several hours.

Class.label: fluorescence-activated cell sorting
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for separating microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid. The particles are forced individually through a vibrating nozzle, then exposed to a laser beam and the resulting fluorescence and scattered light is detected. Finally the cells are sorted by applying an electrical charge to droplets of the fluid and deflecting it to the left or right using charged electrodes.

Class.label: photoemission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of electron microscopy where the distribution of electrons emitted by a specimen sample following excitation by UV light, synchrotron radiation or X-ray sources is used to produce an image.

Class.label: X-ray photoemission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of electron microscopy where the distribution of electrons emitted by a specimen sample following excitation with an X-ray source is used to produce an image.

Class.label: electron microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of a specimen using a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage of 50--150 kV under vacuum and measuring the interaction of the electrons with the specimen.

Class.label: spectroscopic photoemission and low energy electron microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which combines a low energy electron microscope (LEEM) and an energy filtered x-ray photoemission electron microscope (XPEEM).

Class.label: kinetic spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy used to study processes through in situ observation of the time profile of molecular absorptions.

Class.label: aberration-corrected high-resolution transmission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen is bombarded with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV under vacuum and the phase contrast between transmitted electron waves is used to produce an image. The beam is focused using a set of magnetic lenses which removes spherical aberration (an effect where the electron beam is deflected too strongly, resulting in a blurred image).
hasExactSynonym: aberration corrected high resolution transmission electron microscopy

Class.label: electron spin resonance imaging
Class.IAO_0000115: An imaging method which uses the detection of unpaired spins in a magnetic field gradient so that the resonance condition is sensitive to the position of the spins in the sample.

Class.label: molecular nonthermal excitation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of molecular spectroscopy where the sample is placed in a small graphite-coated tube which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it, then excited using a glow discharge (a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas).

Class.label: furnace ionisation nonthermal excitation spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where the sample is atomised by placing it in a small graphite-coated tube which is rapidly heated by passing a current through it, then ionised and excited using a glow discharge (a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas).

Class.label: fluorescence microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A microscope that uses an excitation source to produce light which is passed through an excitation filter, reflects off the surface of a dichroic mirror onto the specimen which fluoresces, producing light that passes through an emission filter to select only the required wavelengths onto the collector lens.

Class.label: epifluorescence microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A fluorescence microscope where the light source is mounted above (epi) the specimen and the excitation light passes through the microscope objective lens on its way toward the specimen.

Class.label: thermocouple
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that generates electrical current when it experiences a thermal gradient.

Class.label: Wollaston wire
Class.IAO_0000115: A composite wire consisting of a fine platinum core with a silver coating.

Class.label: transmission electron microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of an electron transparent specimen using a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage of 50--150 kV under vacuum. The energies and intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Class.label: field-emission transmission electron microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of an electron transparent specimen using a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam (produced by thermionic emission heating) with an acceleration voltage of 50--150 kV under vacuum. The energies and intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Class.label: synchrotron radiation X-ray emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: X-ray spectroscopy where the sample is bombarded with synchrotron radiation (radiation produced by the movement of charged particles in a magnetic field) and the energies and intensities of the X-rays emitted due to core-to-core transitions (known as 'X-ray fluorescence') are detected.

Class.label: autoradiography
Class.IAO_0000115: The recording of the image of an object through the effect of ionising radiation on a film or emulsion.

Class.label: recorded image
Class.IAO_0000115: A data set consisting of a 2D representation obtained from a sample.

Class.label: autoradiogram
Class.IAO_0000115: An image of an object obtained through the effect of ionising radiation on a film or emulsion.

Class.label: isoelectric focusing polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional separation method where one separation process is isoelectric focusing on a gel and the other separation process is polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis.

Class.label: two-dimensional polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are both polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis.

Class.label: positive electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised to positive ions by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Class.label: positive electrospray ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised to positive ions by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets, and where sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Class.label: positive electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: positive electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps, with some form of fragmentation occurring between each stage. Sample ionisation is achieved by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 uL min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of positively charged droplets.

Class.label: particle-image velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity of fluids by pulsing a planar laser light sheet twice, and recording images of fine particles lying in the light sheet using a video camera or a photograph.

Class.label: microscopic particle-image velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity of fluids by pulsing a planar laser light sheet twice, and recording images of microscopic particles lying in the light sheet using a video camera or a photograph.

Class.label: super-resolution bright-field microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where the specimen is illuminated with light transmitted from a source on the opposite side of the specimen from the objective, and image resolution (which is normally limited by diffraction) is enhanced by processing the images with image restoration algorithms.
hasExactSynonym: super resolution bright field optical microscopy

Class.label: membrane-inlet mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a thin membrane (usually made of a silicone elastomer) provides a selective means introducing low-molecular-weight volatile organic compounds into the ionisation source.

Class.label: solution X-ray diffraction
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at a sample solution and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate.

Class.label: differential pulse voltammogram
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of cell current vs. the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes obtained from a differential-pulse voltammetry experiment (i.e. where the potential is varied using pulses of increasing amplitude and the current is sampled before and after each voltage pulse).

Class.label: ion amperometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of cell current, whilst the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is controlled, associated with the ion transfer across the interface between two immiscible electrolyte solutions (ITIES).

Class.label: nuclear magnetic resonance diffusometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of NMR spectroscopy used to measure diffusion coefficients.

Class.label: pulsed field-gradient spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular resonances. Additionally, attenuation of signals occurs related to molecular diffusion allowing this technique to be used to determine self-diffusion coefficients.

Class.label: modulus addition using spatially separated echo spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment used to measure self-diffusion coefficients via signal attenuation which occurs due to diffusion during the application of pulsed field gradients. This experiment also corrects for the effects of imperfect pulsed field gradients.

Class.label: pulsed gradient non-linear spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment used to measure small diffusion coefficients via the attenuation of signals occurring due to molecular diffusion during the application of pulsed field gradients.

Class.label: dynamic force spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of (adhesion or rupture) force vs. loading rate obtained from an atomic force microscopy experiment.

Class.label: dynamic force spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The use of an atomic force microscope to measure rupture or fusion force as a function of loading rate.

Class.label: force spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where an atomic force microscope is used to measure the force experienced by a sample, usually by taking force--distance curves.

Class.label: ultraviolet--visible--near infrared spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of absorbance vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the amount of radiation absorbed by a sample as a function of the wavelength of incident radiation in the ultraviolet to near-infrared (190--2000 nm) range.

Class.label: confocal microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: An optical microscope that works by scanning one or more focussed beams of light across the specimen.

Class.label: laser-scanning confocal microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: An optical microscope that works by scanning a laser across the specimen.

Class.label: tandem-scanning microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: An optical microscope that works by using a spinning Nipkow disc, a wheel pierced by a spiral of pinholes, to illuminate small areas of the sample.

Class.label: adsorption chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Chromatography in which separation is based mainly on differences between the adsorption affinities of the sample components for the surface of an active solid.

Class.label: displacement chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Chromatography where the mobile phase contains a compound (the displacer) more strongly retained than the components of the sample under examination. The sample is fed into the system as a finite slug.

Class.label: glow discharge ion source
Class.IAO_0000115: An ion source that produces ions by continuous sputtering of the sample by a glow discharge plasma, which is produced by passing a current of several hundred volts through a low pressiure gas, usually argon.

Class.label: laser ablation
Class.IAO_0000115: A sample preparation method where material is removed from a specimen by illuminating it with a laser beam.

Class.label: sample preparation method-measurement method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method in which a sample preparation method is coupled to a measurement method.

Class.label: viscometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the viscosity of fluids by observing the relative motion of the fluid and an object. Viscometry is used to measure the molecular weight of polymers.

Class.label: capillary viscometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The determination of the viscosity of a fluid by measuring the time a defined volume of fluid requires to flow through a capillary tube of a specific length and width.

Class.label: in situ X-ray diffraction
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by detecting the positions and intensities of X-rays, that have been generated within a structural domain, as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate.

Class.label: in situ synchrotron XRD
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by detecting the positions and intensities of X-rays, that have been generated within a synchrotron, as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate.

Class.label: scanning probe X-ray diffraction
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by scanning a finely focused (<10 \mum2) beam of X-rays over the sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate.

Class.label: differential confocal microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where visible light coming from the specimen (which is placed approximately half a confocal parameter from the focal plane along the optical axis of the microscope) is collected and guided through a pinhole before it is detected. The pinhole allows only light from the focal point to pass to the detector, reducing background interference.

Class.label: 207Pb nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 207Pb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 207Pb magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 207Pb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods between them. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei, which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples, cause significant line broadening in solid-state NMR, but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field).

Class.label: 1H magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 1H nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods between them. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei, which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples, cause significant line broadening in solid-state NMR, but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field).

Class.label: 93Nb solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states 93Nb nuclei in a solid sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 93Nb nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 93Rb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 1H--13C heteronuclear single quantum coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 13C nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Class.label: 1H--15N heteronuclear single quantum coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 15N nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Class.label: 1H--13C heteronuclear multiple bond coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and 13C nuclei which are 2--3 bonds removed.

Class.label: 1H--15N heteronuclear multiple bond coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and 15N nuclei which are 2--3 bonds removed.

Class.label: 1H--1H correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons which are J-coupled (usually \leq 3 bonds apart).

Class.label: 1H--1H nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between protons that are spatially proximate within a molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart).

Class.label: small-angle X-ray diffraction
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at the sample and detecting the positions and intensities of the diffracted X-rays as a pattern of spots on a photographic plate. The incident X-ray beam strikes the sample at a small angle (0--10 deg.).

Class.label: small-angle X-ray diffraction data
Class.IAO_0000115: Data which is obtained from an X-ray diffraction experiment where the X-rays are incident on the sample at small angles (0--10 degrees).

Class.label: 29Si magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 29Si nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods between them. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei, which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples, cause significant line broadening in solid-state NMR, but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field).

Class.label: 29Si nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 29Si nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: silicon-29 magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum where the nuclei of interest are silicon-29 nuclei and in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field).

Class.label: single pulse--pulsed laser polymerization--near-infrared technique
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for measuring the time-resolved concentration of monomers during polymerisation reactions. The polymerisation is initiated by a single pulse of laser radiation and the monomer concentration is monitored by measuring absorbance in the near-infrared (0.8--2 \mum) region.

Class.label: single pulse-pulsed laser polymerization-electron spin resonance
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for measuring the time-resolved concentration of radicals during polymerisation reactions. The polymerisation is initiated by a single pulse of laser radiation and the radical concentration is monitored by measuring response of the unpaired electrons to short (ns) pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field.
hasExactSynonym: single pulse-pulsed laser polymerization-electron paramagnetic resonance
single pulse-pulsed laser polymerization-electron spin resonance

Class.label: pulsed laser polymerisation-size exclusion chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for measuring the propagation rate coefficient during polymerisation reactions. The polymerisation is initiated by laser irradiation and the chain length distribution is subsequently determined by size-exclusion chromatography.
hasExactSynonym: pulsed laser polymerisation size exclusion chromatography

Class.label: Raman circular dichroism spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The observation of circular dichroism (the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised light) in the Raman spectra of chiral molecules.

Class.label: reflectance circular dichroism spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy based on the differential reflectance of left- and right-handed circularly polarised light by a sample.

Class.label: pulsed laser polymerisation-size exclusion chromatography-nuclear magnetic resonance
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for measuring the propagation rate coefficient during polymerisation reactions. The polymerisation is initiated by laser irradiation and the chain length distribution is subsequently determined by size-exclusion chromatography and the composition of the copolymer products is determined by NMR.
hasExactSynonym: pulsed laser polymerisation size exclusion chromatography nuclear magnetic resonance
pulsed laser polymerisation-size exclusion chromatography-nuclear magnetic resonance
pulsed laser polymerisation-size-exclusion chromatography-nuclear magnetic resonance

Class.label: tensiometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the surface tension of a liquid.

Class.label: pendant-drop tensiometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of surface tension by determining the distortion of drop by gravity, which elongates or flattens otherwise spherical drops.

Class.label: sessile-drop tensiometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of surface tension by determining the shape of a droplet of liquid (with known surface energy) and the contact angle it makes with the surface of interest.

Class.label: dynamic-surface tensiometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the surface tension of a non-static liquid.

Class.label: sorption-desorption measurement
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining surface area by measuring the amount of an inert gaseous or liquid substance (the 'sorbent', usually H2 or N2) which adsorbs onto the surface of interest (the 'sorbate'), and the subsequent amount that desorbs at a constant temperature. Regression analysis is then applied to the data, resulting in an isotherm.

Class.label: sorption measurement
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining surface area by measuring the amount of an inert gaseous or liquid substance (the 'sorbent', usually H2 or N2) which adsorbs onto the surface of interest (the 'sorbate'). Regression analysis is then applied to the data, resulting in an isotherm.

Class.label: nitrogen sorption measurement
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining surface area by measuring the amount of N2 that adsorbs onto the surface of interest (the 'sorbate'). Regression analysis is then applied to the data, resulting in an isotherm.

Class.label: surface-enhanced Raman spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of intensity vs. Raman shift (cm-1) obtained by measuring the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a sample adsorbed onto a highly scattering surface (e.g. Ag, Au or Cu).

Class.label: two-dimensional nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional spectrum which plots the resonance frequency of homonuclear nuclei approximately 6 \AA apart which are correlated by the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect. The resonance frequencies are plotted with intensities proportional to the populations of nuclei.

Class.label: 1H two-dimensional nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional spectrum which plots the resonance frequency of protons approximately 6 \AA apart which are correlated by the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect. The resonance frequencies are plotted with intensities proportional to the populations of nuclei.

Class.label: 13C--13C nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between 13C nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart).

Class.label: transmission electron microscopy selected area electron diffraction
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of high energy (10--200 keV) electrons at the sample within a transmission electron microscope and recording the resulting diffraction pattern produced by any electrons transmitted through the sample.

Class.label: 27Al nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 27Al nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 27Al magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 27Al nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods between them. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei, which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples, cause significant line broadening in solid-state NMR, but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field).

Class.label: para-hydrogen induced polarisation enhanced nuclear magnetic resonance  spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: para-hydrogen induced polarization enhanced NMR spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of protons derived from para-hydrogen (dihydrogen with an antisymmetric nuclear spin arrangement) placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them. The non-Boltzmann spin population generated by para-hydrogen-derived protons gives rise to signal enhancement in the spectra, facilitating the detection of species present at low concentration.

Class.label: only para-hydrogen spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment where pulsed field gradients are used to filter thermal signals from NMR spectra whilst leaving those derived from para-hydrogen-derived protons intact.

Class.label: 1H only para-hydrogen spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment where pulsed field gradients are used to filter thermal signals from 1H NMR spectra whilst leaving those derived from para-hydrogen-derived protons intact.

Class.label: only para-hydrogen spectroscopy correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei which are J-coupled (usually <= 3 bonds apart). Thermal signals in the resulting spectra are then removed, whilst keeping the signals from para-hydrogen-derived protons intact.

Class.label: 1H-1H only para-hydrogen spectroscopy correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei which are J-coupled (usually <= 3 bonds apart). Thermal signals in the resulting 1H spectra are then removed, whilst keeping the signals from para-hydrogen-derived protons intact.

Class.label: laser light scattering
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of scattered visible light. Light (from a laser source) is scattered by the electrons surrounding the atomic nuclei in the sample.

Class.label: matrix assisted laser desorption-ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of relative abundance (%) vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment where the mass-to-charge ratio is determined from the time they take to reach a detector. The sample (usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule) is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser whilst being held in a matrix (such as dihydrobenzoic acid) to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules.
hasExactSynonym: matrix assisted laser desorption-ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrum

Class.label: gas-phase electrophoretic mobility molecular analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where singly-charged complexes move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in air under the influence of an electric field.

Class.label: electrospray ionisation gas-phase electrophoretic mobility molecular analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where singly-charged complexes move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in air under the influence of an electric field. The sample is ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1-10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Class.label: nano electrospray ionisation gas-phase electrophoretic mobility molecular analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where singly-charged complexes move at different speeds according to their electrophoretic mobilities in air under the influence of an electric field. The sample is ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of nL min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Class.label: gas-phase electrophoretic mobility molecular analysis spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of electrophoretic mobility diameter vs. particle count generated by separating singly-charged complexes in air under the influence of an electric field.

Class.label: electrospray ionisation gas-phase electrophoretic mobility molecular analysis spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of electrophoretic mobility diameter vs. particle count generated by separating singly-charged complexes in air under the influence of an electric field. The complexes are charged by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1-10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Class.label: 17O nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy that probes oxygen-17 nuclei.

Class.label: 17O magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy that probes oxygen-17 nuclei.

Class.label: 51V magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy that probes vanadium-51 nuclei.

Class.label: 7Li nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy that probes 7Li nuclei.

Class.label: 14N magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 14N nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods between them. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei, which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples, cause significant line broadening in solid-state NMR, but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field).

Class.label: 14N nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 14N nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: Hadamard-encoded nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment in which multiple frequencies in an NMR spectrum are excited simultaneously over a broad frequency rnage using polychromatic pulses.

Class.label: Hadamard-encoded total correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between all nuclei of a spin-system. All of the resonances in the spin system are excited by selecting only one line for excitation and the final spectrum consists of a series of 1D sub-spectra, each representing one spin system.

Class.label: two-dimensional total correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and which reveal correlations between all nuclei of a spin-system.

Class.label: one-dimensional total correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy which reveal correlations between all nuclei of a spin-system.  An individual 1H resonance is selected and inverted to yield a spectrum of all hydrogens directly or indirectly scalar coupled to it.

Class.label: 13C--13C total correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and which reveal correlations between all 13C nuclei of a spin-system.

Class.label: electrochemiluminescence detection
Class.IAO_0000115: The detection of luminescence emitted by electrochemically-generated intermediates during an electrochemical reaction.

Class.label: multiple-quantum excitation in combination with magic angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment used for half-integer quadrupolar nuclei, involving transitions between non-consecutive energy levels during the excitation of the spin system by the first rf pulse.
hasExactSynonym: multiple-quantum excitation in combination with magic-angle spinning

Class.label: satellite transition magic angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment where the selective excitation of central and satellite transitions during magic angle spinning is used for recording high-resolution NMR spectra of quadrupolar nuclei in solids. Central transitions are detected first, followed by satellite transitions.

Class.label: satellite transition magic angle spinning with self-compensation for the magic angle misset
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment where the selective excitation of satellite transitions during magic angle spinning is used for recording high-resolution NMR spectra of quadrupolar nuclei in solids. In conventional magic angle spinning the spinning angle must be very accurate, but this technique can self-compensate  magic-angle errors of up to (+/- 1.0 deg.).

Class.label: triple-quantum excitation in combination with magic angle spinning
hasExactSynonym: triple-quantum excitation in combination with magic-angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment used for 3/2-spin quadrupolar nuclei, involving transitions between non-consecutive energy levels during the excitation of the spin system by the first rf pulse.

Class.label: central transition magic angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment where the selective excitation of central transitions during magic angle spinning is used for recording high-resolution NMR spectra of quadrupolar nuclei in solids.

Class.label: five-quantum excitation in combination with magic angle spinning
hasExactSynonym: five-quantum excitation in combination with magic-angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment used for 5/2-spin quadrupolar nuclei, involving transitions between non-consecutive energy levels during the excitation of the spin system by the first rf pulse.

Class.label: inverse satellite transition magic angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment where the selective excitation of central and satellite transitions during magic angle spinning is used for recording high-resolution NMR spectra of quadrupolar nuclei in solids. Satellite transitions are detected first, followed by central transitions.

Class.label: 87Rb nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 87Rb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: anion-exchange chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Column chromatography where anions are retained by positively charged functional groups in the stationary phase.

Class.label: cation-exchange chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Column chromatography where cations are retained by negatively charged functional groups in the stationary phase.

Class.label: titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached.

Class.label: acid--base titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample (an acid or base) by adding measured increments of a titrant (a base or acid) until the endpoint, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached.

Class.label: acidimetric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample (a base) by adding measured increments of a titrant (an acid) until the endpoint, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached.

Class.label: alkalimetric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample (a base) by adding measured increments of a titrant (an acid) until the endpoint, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached.

Class.label: magnetic resonance method
Class.IAO_0000115: Any technique which detects the response of spins to a perturbing magnetic field.

Class.label: optically detected magnetic resonance
Class.IAO_0000115: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by optical means (i.e. the polarisation or the intensity of light emitted or absorbed by the sample depends on the population distribution in the spin levels). Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Class.label: zero-field optically detected magnetic resonance
Class.IAO_0000115: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels at zero applied magnetic field are detected by optical means (i.e. the polarisation or the intensity of light emitted or absorbed by the sample depends on the population distribution in the spin levels). Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Class.label: absorption detected magnetic resonance
Class.IAO_0000115: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by light absorption. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Class.label: delayed emission detected magnetic resonance
Class.IAO_0000115: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by delayed light emission. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Class.label: delayed fluorescence detected magnetic resonance
Class.IAO_0000115: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by delayed fluorescence. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Class.label: fluorescence detected magnetic resonance
Class.IAO_0000115: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by fluorescence. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Class.label: phosphorescence detected magnetic resonance
Class.IAO_0000115: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by phosphorescence. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Class.label: reaction yield detected magnetic resonance
Class.IAO_0000115: A double resonance technique in which transitions between spin sublevels are detected by means of reaction yield. Usually these are sublevels of a triplet and the transitions are induced by microwaves.

Class.label: activation analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A kind of elemental or isotopic analysis based on the measurement of characteristic radiation from nuclides formed directly or indirectly by activation of the test portion.

Class.label: absolute activation analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A kind of activation analysis in which the elemental concentrations in the material are calculated from known nuclear constants, irradiation and measurement parameters, rather than by comparing with known standards.

Class.label: analytical solution calorimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the enthalpy change during chemical reaction in order to determine quantitative values of a reactant or catalyst. In general, at least one reactant is a liquid or solution.

Class.label: batch injection calorimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the enthalpy change during a chemical reaction in order to measure the amount of the imiting reagent.

Class.label: calorimetric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration performed in a calorimeter which produces a plot of heat change vs. volume of titrant.

Class.label: catalymetric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration involves a catalyst, and the end-point is detected by the sudden increase or decrease in the rate of a reaction.

Class.label: chelatometric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample (metal cation) by adding measured increments of a titrant (a chelating agent) until the end-point, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached.

Class.label: catalysed chemiluminescence detection
Class.IAO_0000115: The detection of luminescence resulting from a thermal electron-transfer reaction.

Class.label: continuous-flow calorimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A term used to describe methods wherein a reagent is continuously fed into a flowing analyte stream and the temperature difference is measured before and after a reactor (mixing chamber). Alternatively, the temperature may be measured in a differential manner between a reference and a reactor chamber. The analyte concentration is directly proportional to the measured temperature difference.

Class.label: constant-current chronopotentiometric stripping
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrochemical technique where the analyte of interest is electroplated onto the working electrode before being removed or 'stripped'. During removal the time-dependence of the potential difference between the indicator and reference electrodes is measured under conditions where the current passed is constant and sufficiently small to maintain thermodynamic equilibrium.

Class.label: spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus used to measure a spectrum.

Class.label: Raman spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that consists of a laser, a beam splitter, an interferometer and a detector and is used to measure Raman spectra.

Class.label: confocal Raman microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a laser beam (<10 \mum diameter), a monochromator and a detector coupled to an optical microscope, which is used to measure Raman spectra. An aperture is used to discriminate between Raman signal coming from the laser spot and that coming from the out-of-focus region of the sample.

Class.label: inversion recovery total correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional NMR experiment which shows correlations between all the nuclei of a spin system and also allows determination of T1 relaxation rates.

Class.label: inversion recovery
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment which measures spin-lattice (T1) relaxation rates by acquiring spectra at different delay times following inversion of the spin-state populations.

Class.label: differential scanning fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of the  fluorescence emitted by molecules excited using ultraviolet light is detected as it changes upon interaction of the molecule with its environment.

Class.label: elastic recoil detection analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for measuring elemental concentration depth profiles in thin films by directing an ion beam at the sample and detecting recoiled atoms.

Class.label: heavy-ion elastic recoil detection analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for measuring elemental concentration depth profiles in thin films by directing a heavy-ion (such as iodine-127) beam at the sample and detecting the recoiled atoms.
hasExactSynonym: heavy ion elastic recoil detection analysis

Class.label: carrier extraction by linearly increasing voltage method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for measuring charge carrier mobilities and conductivities by applying two sequentional triangular-shaped voltage pulses and measuring the resulting current.
hasExactSynonym: carrier extraction by linearly increasing voltage
charge-carrier extraction in a linearly increasing voltage

Class.label: photoinduced carrier extraction in a linearly increasing voltage
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for measuring charge carrier mobilities and conductivities by applying a short (ns) laser pulse to generate charge carriers. These charge carriers are then detected by applying a linearly increasing voltage and measuring the resulting current.
hasExactSynonym: photoinduced charge-carrier extraction in a linearly increasing voltage

Class.label: time-of-flight method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for measuring charge transport by sandwhiching the sample between two parallel electrodes, one of which has to be semitransparent. A short light pulse is applied to the sample giving rise to charge carriers, which traverse through the sample generating a current which is then measured.

Class.label: carrier extraction using pulsed voltage method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for measuring charge carrier mobilities and conductivities by applying two sequentional square-shaped voltage pulses and measuring the resulting current.

Class.label: charge transport measurement method
Class.IAO_0000115: Any technique for measuring charge transport.

Class.label: field-effect transistor method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining charge transport by incorporating the sample (as a thin film) into an FET. An electric field is applied to the sample (by means of the gate electrode) and the change in conductance between the source and drain electrodes is measured.

Class.label: space-charge-limited current method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for measuring density-of-state (DOS) distributions by injecting a nonequilibrium density of charges and measuring the resulting current.

Class.label: fast-atom bombardment mass spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of relative abundance (%) vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment where the ions are generated from the sample (which is held in a liquid matrix) by bombarding it with a stream of primary noble gas atoms.

Class.label: magneto-optical rotatory dispersion
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of magneto-optical activity by placing the sample in a strong magnetic field and observing a beam of plane-polarized light which is directed along the magnetic field axis.

Class.label: 183W nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 183W nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: ultraviolet spectrophotometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the ultraviolet region (190--400 nm) resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Class.label: ultraviolet spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of absorbance vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the amount of radiation absorbed by a sample as a function of the wavelength of incident radiation from the ultraviolet region (190--400 nm) range.

Class.label: electroluminescence detection
Class.IAO_0000115: The detection of luminescence emitted from a sample as a result of the application of an electric current or a strong electric field.

Class.label: sonoluminescence detection
Class.IAO_0000115: The detection of short bursts of light emitted from a liquid sample excited by sound.

Class.label: photoluminescence detection
Class.IAO_0000115: The detection of luminescence emitted from a sample as a result of irradiation with light. Photoluminescence includes both fluorescence and phosphorescence.

Class.label: electroluminescence spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of intensity against wavelength obtained by measuring the intensity of radiation emitted by a sample through electroluminescence (emission of light as a result of the application of a current or an electric field) against wavelength.

Class.label: reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Liquid chromatography where the inlet pressure is relatively high and the mobile phase is significantly more polar than the stationary phase (which consists of very small particles), for example a microporous silica-based material with chemically bonded alkyl chains.
hasExactSynonym: reverse phase  high performance liquid chromatography

Class.label: pyrolysis gas chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: The chemical degradation of a sample by thermal energy where the volatile pyrolysates are then separated by column chromatography where the mobile phase is a gas.

Class.label: pyrolysis gas chromatography-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first chemically degraded by heating then separated by gas chromatography then ionised and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: gas chromatography-infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any method where a sample mixture is first separated by column chromatography where the mobile phase is a gas, then the absorption of radiation from the infrared region by the sample is measured.

Class.label: pyrolysis gas chromatography-infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any method where a sample mixture is first chemically degraded by heating then separated by column chromatography where the mobile phase is a gas, then the absorption of radiation from the infrared region by the sample is measured.

Class.label: pyrolysis infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is first chemically degraded by heating then its absorption of radiation from the infrared region (0.78--1000 \mum) is measured.

Class.label: pyrolysis mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectrometry where the sample is chemically degraded by thermal energy then converted into gaseous ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: synchrotron small angle X-ray scattering
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of X-rays (generated in a synchrotron) scattered by a sample at low angles (0--10 deg.).

Class.label: desorption atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where ionisation is achieved using a corona discharge which directs a liquid spray (composed of an inert, high velocity gas and solvent ions) onto the sample surface.

Class.label: short-column chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A chromatography method where the stationary bed is within a tube (of less than the standard length of 25 cm). The particles of the solid stationary phase or support coated with a liquid stationary phase may fill the whole inside volume of the tube (packed column) or be concentrated on or along the inside tube wall leaving an open, unrestricted path for the mobile phase in the middle part of the tube (open-tubular column).

Class.label: continuous-wave electron spin resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of intensity vs. magnetic field strength obtained by measuring the absorption of radiation due to spin-state transitions of unpaired electrons against the magnetic field strength.
hasExactSynonym: continuous wave electron paramagnetic resonance spectrum

Class.label: hyperfine sublevel correlation spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of intensity vs. magnetic field strength obtained by measuring the absorption of radiation due to spin-state transitions of unpaired electrons against a perturbing magnetic field, in the presence of fixed-frequency microwave radiation. A two-dimensional spectrum which plots the resonance frequency of electrons in the same magnetic environment, obtained from spectroscopy ased on the electron spin-echo envelope modulation (ESEEM) effect, where a sequence of four microwave pulses is applied to the sample and the stimulated spin-echo produced is measured.

Class.label: electron spin-echo envelope modulation
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of pulsed EPR spectroscopy which is used to observe the electron spin echo in a paramagnetic system as a function of the time that separates the pulses causing the echo. This technique is a powerful probe of the radial distribution of magnetic nuclear spins in the environment of the electron spins producing the echo.

Class.label: electron spin-echo envelope modulation spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of intensity vs. magnetic field strength obtained by measuring the absorption of radiation due to electron spin-echo envelope modulation against the resonant frequency of the unpaired electrons.

Class.label: electrospray-ionisation quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution of the sample through a small heated capillary into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets (or by collision with solvent ions produced by the same process). In the first stage the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes (a quadrupole). In the second stage the sample ions are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Class.label: electrospray-ionisation quadrupole time-of-flight tandem mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry involving multiple mass-selection steps, with some form of fragmentation occurring between each stage. The sample is ionised by forcing a solution of the sample through a small heated capillary into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets (or by collision with solvent ions produced by the same process). In the first stage the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes (a quadrupole). In the second stage the sample ions are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.

Class.label: size-exclusion chromatography-high performance liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of column chromatography where a sample mixture is first separated according to molecular size, then subjected to chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid, the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high
hasExactSynonym: size exclusion chromatography high performance liquid chromatography

Class.label: reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography before being ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction, and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: reversed phase high performance liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
reversed phase high pressure liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
reversed-phase high performance liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
reversed-phase high pressure liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry

Class.label: capillary high-performance liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid, the stationary phase consists of very small particles held in a tube of diameter less than a millimetre, and the inlet pressure is relatively high.

Class.label: nanoflow high-performance liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid, the stationary phase consists of very small particles,  the inlet pressure is relatively high and the flow rate is nL min-1.

Class.label: reversed-phase nanoflow high-performance liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid and is significantly more polar than the stationary phase, which consists of very small particles, the inlet pressure is relatively high and the flow rate is nL min-1.
hasExactSynonym: reversed phase nano high performance liquid chromatography
reversed phase nano high pressure liquid chromatography
reversed phase nanoflow high performance liquid chromatography
reversed phase nanoflow high pressure liquid chromatography

Class.label: nanoflow high-performance liquid chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by high-performance liquid chromatography (flow rate nL min-1) before being ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction, and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: nanoflow high performance liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
nanoflow high pressure liquid chromatography inductively coupled mass spectroscopy

Class.label: nanoflow high-performance liquid chromatography-electrospray ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
