The components in a high-boiling-point sample mixture are vaporised by the application of heat at low pressure and then cooled by the action of cold water in a condenser. The vacuum is replaced by an inert gas once the distillation is complete.

Class.label: molecular distillation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. The components in a high-boiling-point sample mixture are vaporised by the application of heat at low pressure (< 0.01 Torr) and then cooled by the action of cold water in a condenser.

Class.label: short-path distillation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture under reduced pressure. As the sample mixture to be purified is heated, its vapours rise a short distance into a vertical condenser where they are cooled by water. This technique is used for compounds which are unstable at high temperatures because it allows a lower boiling temperature to be used.

Class.label: droplet dispensing
Class.IAO_0000115: The controlled dropwise release of a liquid.

Class.label: acoustic droplet dispensing
Class.IAO_0000115: The dropwise release of a liquid using a focused acoustic beam to eject a controlled droplet from an open pool of liquid. When the acoustic beam strikes the liquid surface, the pressure causes the fluid to rise up and a droplet breaks off.

Class.label: dielectrophoretic droplet dispensing
Class.IAO_0000115: The dispensing of droplets from an electrode surface after an applied voltage has been removed. Periodic bumps along the length of the electrodes promote droplet formation by establishing an initial, static perturbation.

Class.label: inertial droplet dispensing
Class.IAO_0000115: The dispensing of droplets by applying a pattern of piezoelectric acceleration and deceleration to the droplets such that inertial force can overcome adhesion force, resulting in droplet detachment from the device.

Class.label: electrohydrodynamic droplet dispensing
Class.IAO_0000115: The dispensing of droplets between two electrodes by applying an electric field.

Class.label: sample drying
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of removing a solvent from a substance.

Class.label: dielectric drying
Class.IAO_0000115: The removal of solvent from a sample by the application of radio frequency (3 Hz to 300 GHz) or microwave (1--1000 mm) radiation.

Class.label: direct drying
Class.IAO_0000115: The removal of solvent from a sample by the application of heated air.

Class.label: drum drying
Class.IAO_0000115: The removal of solvent from a sample by applying it as a thin layer to the surface of a heated drum.

Class.label: freeze drying
Class.IAO_0000115: The removal of solvent from a sample without passing through the liquid--gas boundary. The sample is frozen at liquid nitrogen temperature (-80 deg. C) then the surrounding pressure is reduced to allow the water in the sample to sublime.

Class.label: oven drying
Class.IAO_0000115: The removal of solvent from a sample by heating in an oven.

Class.label: spray drying
Class.IAO_0000115: The removal of water from a liquid sample by pumping it through an atomiser (to produce a spray of fine droplets) then passing a hot gas (e.g. air or N2) through it.

Class.label: supercritical drying
Class.IAO_0000115: The removal of solvent from a sample without passing through the liquid--gas boundary, by immersion in a supercritical fluid and de-pressurisation.

Class.label: vacuum drying
Class.IAO_0000115: The removal of water from a sample by placing it under reduced pressure. This allows water to evaporate from (heat-sensitive) samples at a lower temperature.

Class.label: etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of chemically removing a thin layer from a sample surface, usually to leave behind a pattern.

Class.label: dry etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface by sputtering or dissolving using reactive ions or a vapour-phase etchant

Class.label: plasma etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface using short pulses of a plasma (a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals).

Class.label: deep reactive-ion etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of creating deep holes and trenches in a sample surface using short pulses of a plasma (a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals) alternating with the deposition of a chemically inert passivation layer.

Class.label: advanced silicon etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of creating deep holes and trenches in a silicon surface using short pulses of a plasma (a partially ionised gas---usually SF6---containing free electrons and radicals) alternating with the deposition of a chemically inert passivation layer (e.g. C4F8).

Class.label: cryogenic deep reactive-ion etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of creating deep holes and trenches in a sample surface (cooled to -110 deg. C) using short pulses of a plasma (a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals) alternating with the deposition of a chemically inert passivation layer.

Class.label: electrolytic etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of removing the unprotected areas of a surface by placing it inside an electrochemical etching solution in the presence of an electric current.

Class.label: Galvanic etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of removing the unprotected areas of a silicon surface by placing it inside an electrochemical etching solution (KOH, HF or TMAH) in the presence of an electric current. When the silicon substrate is in contact with a noble metal (Au or Cr) a Galvanic cell is formed and the silicon is oxidized.

Class.label: ion beam patterning
Class.IAO_0000115: A patterning process which involves using a focused Ga+ beam to cut trenches into substrates.

Class.label: photo etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of generating a pattern in a photosensitive sample by irradiating it with UV light. After exposure, the plate is 'developed' by washing away the unexposed resist.

Class.label: sputter etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface by bombarding it with energetic ions.

Class.label: electronic sputter etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface by bombarding it with high-energy or highly charged heavy ions.

Class.label: potential sputter etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface by bombarding it with high-energy or highly charged heavy ions. When the multiply charged ions recombine on the sample surface their potential energy is liberated, accelerating the process.

Class.label: wet etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of using strong acids/alkalis to cut into the unprotected parts of a surface (e.g. metal or silicon) to create a pattern.

Class.label: anisotropic wet etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of using strong acids/alkalis to remove a thin layer of the unprotected parts of a sample surface (e.g. metal or silicon) to create a pattern. Anisotropic etching occurs when different etch rates are observed in different directions in the sample (e.g. for different crystal faces).

Class.label: evaporation
Class.IAO_0000115: The physical process by which a liquid substance is converted to a gas or vapour. This may occur at or below the normal boiling point of the liquid (the temperature at which a liquid boils at 1 atmosphere pressure) and the process is endothermic.

Class.label: centrifugal evaporation
Class.IAO_0000115: The evaporation of solvent from a sample by placing it a centrifuge and spinning it rapidly.

Class.label: rotary evaporation
Class.IAO_0000115: The removal of solvent from a sample by applying heat and lowering the pressure above the sample whilst rotating it at 10--300 rpm.

Class.label: extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The transfer of a solute from a liquid phase to another immiscible or partially-miscible liquid phase in contact with it.

Class.label: coextraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The transfer of two solutes from a liquid phase to a (low-polarity) organic liquid phase in contact with it. The solutes form mixed-species aggregates in the organic phase.

Class.label: headspace extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a solid or liquid matrix to the vapour phase by heating.

Class.label: dynamic headspace extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a solid or liquid matrix to the vapour phase by heating, and removing analytes from the headspace in a carrier gas.

Class.label: multiple headspace extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a solid or liquid matrix to the vapour phase by heating. Once the concentration of the analyte in the headspace is in equilibrium with the concentration in the sample matrix, the headspace is removed. The process is repeated multiple times, allowing the new equilibrium to form at each stage.

Class.label: static headspace extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a solid or liquid matrix to the vapour phase by heating. Once the concentration of the analyte in the headspace is in equilibrium with the concentration in the sample matrix, the headspace is removed.

Class.label: liquid-solid extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by passing the liquid sample through a stationary phase (e.g. silica particles).

Class.label: normal-phase solid-phase extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by passing the (polar) liquid sample through a (non-polar) stationary phase.

Class.label: reversed-phase solid-phase extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by passing the (non-polar) liquid sample through a (polar) stationary phase.

Class.label: solid-phase micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by passing the liquid sample through a small fibre containing a stationary phase bonded to a silica needle (<10 \mum diameter).

Class.label: capillary micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by passing the liquid sample through a small fused-silica capillary.

Class.label: sol--gel capillary micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by passing the liquid sample through a small sol--gel-coated fused-silica capillary.

Class.label: headspace solid-phase micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by exposing a small fibre containing a stationary phase bonded to a silica needle (<10 \mum diameter) to the headspace above the liquid sample.

Class.label: micro-extraction in a packed syringe
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by passing the liquid sample through a stationary phase (1 mg) packed into a microlitre syringe.

Class.label: stir-bar solid-phase extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a liquid to a solid phase by attaching a stationary phase to a stir bar which moves throughout the liquid sample.

Class.label: magnetic bead extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for extracting biological molecules from a biological sample by functionalising a magnetic bead (0.001--200 \mum diameter) with a molecule specific to the target molecule (e.g. complementary DNA or a specific antibody) and placing it in the sample solution. The bead is removed from the solution using a magnetized source.

Class.label: membrane extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The transfer of a solute from one phase (the 'donor' or 'feed' phase) to another (the 'acceptor' or 'strip' phase) across a nonporous membrane.

Class.label: membrane extraction with a sorbent interface
hasExactSynonym: membrane extraction with trapping on a sorbent interface
Class.IAO_0000115: The transfer of a solute from one phase (the 'donor' or 'feed' phase) to another (the 'acceptor' or 'strip' phase) across a non-porous non-polar polymer membrane. The membrane first extracts the analytes from their matrix, and these are subsequently trapped on a polymeric trap with a porous sorbent using a carrier gas stream.

Class.label: polymeric membrane extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The transfer of a solute from one phase (the 'donor' or 'feed' phase) to another (the 'acceptor' or 'strip' phase) across a nonporous sillicon rubber membrane.

Class.label: supported liquid membrane extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The transfer of a solute from one phase (the 'donor' or 'feed' phase) to another (the 'acceptor' or 'strip' phase) across a non-porous liquid membrane.

Class.label: sequentional extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: An analytical process that sequentially chemically leaches metals from soils, sludges or sediments.

Class.label: solvent extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from any matrix to an appropriate liquid phase.

Class.label: gas--liquid extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: A flotation process in which the material of interest, adsorbed on the surface of gas bubbles in a liquid, is collected on an upper layer of immiscible liquid.

Class.label: liquid--liquid extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a dissolved substance from one liquid phase to another (immiscible or partially miscible) liquid phase in contact with it.

Class.label: cloud-point extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a non-ionic surfactant from one liquid phase to another by heating. As the temperature of the solution rises, the surfactant molecules form micelles, if the temperature increases above the cloud point (CPT) the micelles become dehydrated and aggregate. This leads to macroscopic phase separation of the solution into a surfactant-rich phase and a solvent phase.

Class.label: liquid-phase micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a microlitre amount of a substance from an aqueous phase to an organic phase (or vice versa).

Class.label: single-drop micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a dissolved substance from one liquid phase to another (immiscible or partially miscible) liquid phase in contact with it. A microdrop of organic solvent (8 \muL), is suspended from the end of Teflon rod immersed in a stirred aqueous solution of the sample. The sample solution is stirred until equilibrium is reached, after which, the drop is retracted into the Teflon rod.

Class.label: pressurised-fluid extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a dissolved substance from one liquid phase to another (immiscible or partially miscible) liquid phase in contact with it using solvents at elevated temperature (50--200 deg. C) and pressure (7--20 MPa).

Class.label: microporous membrane liquid--liquid extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The transfer of a solute from one phase (the 'donor' or 'feed' phase) to another (organic) phase (the 'acceptor' or 'strip' phase) across a porous hydrophobic membrane the pores of which are filled with the same acceptor phase.

Class.label: shake-flask extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from any matrix to an appropriate liquid phase, during which the sample and solvent are kept in contact in a mechanical shaker.

Class.label: solid--liquid extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring the soluble components of a solid to the liquid phase using a solvent.

Class.label: microwave-assisted extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring the organic components of a solid to an organic liquid phase. The process is accelerated by directing radiation in the microwave region (1--1000 mm) at the sample.

Class.label: Soxhlet extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring the partially soluble components of a solid to the liquid phase using a Soxhlet extractor. The solid is placed in a filter paper thimble which is then placed into the main chamber of the Soxhlet extractor. The solvent (heated to reflux) travels into the main chamber and the partially soluble components are slowly tranferred to the solvent.

Class.label: supercritical fluid extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from any matrix to a liquid phase using a supercritical fluid.

Class.label: ultrasound extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from any matrix to an appropriate liquid phase, assisted by sound waves (>20 KHz in frequency) that propagate through the liquid media.

Class.label: substoichiometric extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from any matrix to another where the amount of reagent used is lower than that dictated by stoichiometry.

Class.label: extrusion
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile by forcing or drawing a material through a die.

Class.label: cold extrusion
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile by forcing or drawing a material through a die at room temperature.

Class.label: hot extrusion
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile by forcing or drawing a material through a die at elevated temperatures (up to 2000 deg. C).

Class.label: hydrostatic extrusion
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile by forcing or drawing a material through a die in the presence of a pressurised fluid.

Class.label: warm extrusion
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile by forcing or drawing a material through a die at a temperature that is above room temperature, but below the recrystallisation temperature of the material (400--900 deg. C).

Class.label: spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to create polymer fibers using a spinneret (a multi-pored device similar to a shower head) to form multiple continuous filaments.

Class.label: dry spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to create polymer fibers. Polymer dissolved in a solvent is forced through a spinneret (a multi-pored device similar to a shower head) and the solvent is removed from the polymer fibres by evaporation.

Class.label: electrospinning
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to created very fine (\mum or nm scale) fibres from a liquid. A high voltage is applied to a droplet of the liquid sample which is drawn out into fibres and cooled in air.

Class.label: gel spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to create polymer fibers. Polymer in a gel state is forced through a spinneret (a multi-pored device similar to a shower head). The fibres are then air dried and cooled in a liquid bath.

Class.label: melt spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to create polymer fibers. Molten polymer is forced through a spinneret (a multi-pored device similar to a shower head) and cooled to form multiple continuous filaments.

Class.label: wet spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to create polymer fibers. Polymer dissolved in a solvent is forced through a spinneret (a multi-pored device similar to a shower head) into a chemical bath which causes the polymer to precipitate as it emerges.

Class.label: fermentation
Class.IAO_0000115: The process in which cells (microorganisms, plant or animal cells) are cultured in a bioreactor in a liquid or solid medium to convert organic substances into biomass (growth) or into products.

Class.label: fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of dividing up a sample mixture into smaller quantities according to their physical (e.g. size, solubility) or chemical (e.g. bonding, reactivity) properties.

Class.label: field-flow fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: Any separation technique based on the application of a field perpendicular to a flow stream in a narrow channel.

Class.label: electrical field-flow fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel and applying an electric field perpendicular to the channel. A carrier liquid is passed through the channel and the particles are separated on the basis of electrophoretic mobility.

Class.label: cyclic electrical field-flow field fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel and applying an alternating electric field perpendicular to the channel. A carrier liquid is passed through the channel and the particles are separated on the basis of electrophoretic mobility.

Class.label: flow field-flow fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel and applying a carrier liquid flow perpendicular to the channel. A carrier liquid is then passed through the channel and the particles elute in order of decreasing diffusion coefficient.

Class.label: gravitational field-flow fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for separating small particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel such that the Earth's gravitational field is perpendicular to the channel. A carrier liquid is then passed through the channel and the particles are separated on the basis of particle size.

Class.label: potential barrier field-flow fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel, such that the Earth's gravitational field is perpendicular to the channel, and varying the ionic strength of the solution or Hamaker constant/surface potential of the particles.

Class.label: magnetic field-flow fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel and applying a magnetic electric field perpendicular to the channel. A carrier liquid is passed through the channel and the particles are separated on the basis of magnetic susceptibility.

Class.label: sedimentation field-flow fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for separating particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel within a centrifuge such that the centripetal force is applied perpendicular to the flow stream (driving the particles towards the walls of the channel). A carrier liquid is then passed through the channel removing the smallest particles first.

Class.label: steric field-flow fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for separating large (= channel width) particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel. Normally particles migrate towards the walls of the channel but large particles are unable to approach the walls and when a carrier liquid is passed through the channel, these particles are removed first.

Class.label: thermal field-flow fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique for separating polymer particles from solution by placing the sample in a narrow channel and heating one end, whilst cooling the other. The polymer particles migrate towards the cooler plate and are then removed with a carrier liquid.

Class.label: foam fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method of separation in which a component of the bulk liquid is preferentially adsorbed at the liquid--vapour interface and is removed by foaming.

Class.label: freeze distillation
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of enriching a solution by partially freezing it and removing frozen material that contains less of the dissolved material than the remaining solution.

Class.label: plasma protein fractionation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for separating proteins from plasma by changing the conditions (e.g. temperature or acidity) of the plasma, causing precipitation of the proteins, which can then be removed by centrifugation.

Class.label: Cohn process
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for separating proteins from plasma by changing the conditions of the plasma by simultaneous cooling and addition of alcohol. This causes precipitation of the proteins, which can then be removed by centrifugation.

Class.label: filtration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of segregation of phases; the separation of suspended solids from a liquid or gas, usually by forcing a carrier gas or liquid through a porous medium.

Class.label: micro-filtration
Class.IAO_0000115: A pressure-driven membrane-based separation process in which particles and dissolved macromolecules larger than 0.1 micrometre are rejected.

Class.label: nano-filtration
Class.IAO_0000115: A pressure-driven membrane-based separation process in which particles and dissolved macromolecules larger 200 Da are rejected.

Class.label: reverse osmosis
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation process which involves using pressure to force a solution through a membrane, retaining the solute on one side and allowing the pure solvent to pass to the other side. (This is the reverse of the normal osmosis process, which is the natural movement of solvent from an area of low solute concentration, through a membrane, to an area of high solute concentration.)

Class.label: suction filtration
Class.IAO_0000115: The separation of a solid phase from a liquid phase by passing the sample through a porous medium under pressure.

Class.label: ultra-filtration
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation process whereby a solution containing a solute of molecular size significantly greater than that of the solvent molecule is removed from the solvent by the application of hydraulic pressure which forces only the solvent to flow through a suitable membrane, usually having a pore size in the range 0.001--0.1 \mum.

Class.label: gelation
Class.IAO_0000115: The formation of a gel or solidification of a gelatin solution caused by a change in conditions (such as temperature or pH).

Class.label: electrochemical gelation
Class.IAO_0000115: The formation of a gel from a solution by electrochemical oxidation.

Class.label: light-induced gelation
Class.IAO_0000115: The formation of a gel from a solution by irradiation with light from the visible region (400--800 nm).

Class.label: pH-induced gelation
Class.IAO_0000115: The formation of a gel from a solution by altering the pH of the solution.

Class.label: sound-induced gelation
Class.IAO_0000115: The formation of a gel from a solution by the application of ultrasound (sound waves >20 kHz frequency).

Class.label: thermal gelation
Class.IAO_0000115: The formation of a gel from a solution by heating.

Class.label: grinding
Class.IAO_0000115: The mechanical reduction of the particle size of a solid sample by attribution (friction), impact or cutting.

Class.label: liquid-assisted grinding
Class.IAO_0000115: The mechanical reduction of the particle size of a solid sample by attribution (friction), impact or cutting in the presence of a small amount of solvent.

Class.label: ball milling
Class.IAO_0000115: The mechanical reduction of the particle size of a solid sample by grinding with one or more inert balls (ceramic, flint, or stainless steel, 2--8 mm diameter) rotating around a horizontal axis.

Class.label: high-speed ball milling
Class.IAO_0000115: The mechanical reduction of the particle size of a solid sample by grinding with one or more inert balls (ceramic, flint or stainless steel, 2--8 mm diameter) rotating at high speed around a horizontal axis. A high-speed agitator is used to increase the speed of the balls.

Class.label: high-energy ball milling
Class.IAO_0000115: The mechanical reduction of the particle size of a solid sample by grinding with one or more inert balls (ceramic, flint or stainless steel, 2--8 mm diameter) rotating at high speed (up to 650 rpm) around a horizontal axis. A high-speed agitator is used to increase the speed of the balls which are held in vacuum or in an inert gas (e.g. Ar).

Class.label: wet grinding
Class.IAO_0000115: The mechanical reduction of the particle size of a solid sample by attribution (friction), impact or cutting in the presence of a small amount of liquid (which is not a solvent for the solid).

Class.label: ionisation method
Class.IAO_0000115: The physical process of converting an atom or molecule into an ion by removing electrons.

Class.label: electrospray ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where the sample is either forced through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets, or solvent droplets subjected to the same process are directed at the sample.

Class.label: desorption electrospray ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where charged solvent droplets which are formed by forcing the solvent through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field are directed at the sample surface. The droplets form a thin film on the sample surface, dissolving the analyte of interest.

Class.label: laser desorption electrospray ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where neutral molecules are desorbed from the sample (usually biological) using a nitrogen laser and then ionised by collision with charged solvent droplets which are formed by forcing the solvent through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field.

Class.label: matrix-assisted laser desorption electrospray ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where neutral molecules are desorbed from the sample (usually biological and held in an organic acid matrix) using a nitrogen laser and then ionised by collision with charged solvent droplets which are formed by forcing the solvent through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field.

Class.label: extraction electrospray ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where a neutral sample, in the form of a gas or aerosol flow, is ionised by directing it into a plume of charged droplets, generated by forcing a solution of pure solvent through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 \muL min-1) into an electric field.

Class.label: laser ablation electrospray ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where the sample is vaporised using a high-energy pulsed laser and then ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of it through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Class.label: plasma ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: Any ionisation method when the sample is ionised in a plasma---a partially ionised gas (such as Ar) containing free electrons.

Class.label: plasma-assisted desorption ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) is directed onto the sample surface causing desorption of sample molecules from the surface and subsequent ionisation.

Class.label: glow discharge ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method when the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by passing an electrical discharge under reduced pressure between two electrodes.

Class.label: atmospheric pressure glow discharge ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method when the sample is ionised, at atmospheric pressure, in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by passing an electrical discharge between two electrodes.

Class.label: chemical ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where the sample is ionised by interaction (electron or proton transfer) with reagent (N2, O2, H2O) gaseous ions at low pressure. Reagent ions are produced by electron ionisation.

Class.label: desorption atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method in which a corona discharge is used to direct a liquid spray (composed of an inert, high velocity gas and solvent ions) onto the sample surface.

Class.label: dielectric barrier discharge ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method when the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by passing an alternating voltage across a dielectric layer between two electrodes.

Class.label: direct analysis in real time
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where the sample is ionised by a corona discharge within a He atmosphere.

Class.label: isostatic pressing
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of pressing a powder under a gas or liquid so that pressure is transmitted equally in all directions.

Class.label: hot isostatic pressing
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of pressing a powder under a gas or liquid at elevated temperatures so that pressure is transmitted equally in all directions.

Class.label: labelling
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of attaching a label onto a substance. Labels are molecular entities that facilitate the detection (through fluorescence, radioactivity, etc.) of the species to which they are attached.

Class.label: fluorescent labelling
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of covalently attaching a chemically-reactive derivative of a fluorophore to another molecule, such as a protein or nucleic acid.

Class.label: isotopic labelling
Class.IAO_0000115: The substitution of an atom or an ion (present in the form of its stable isotope) by an isotope of the same element.

Class.label: deuterium labelling
Class.IAO_0000115: The substitution of one or more hydrogen atoms in a molecule with deuterium atoms.

Class.label: radioactive labelling
Class.IAO_0000115: The substitution of an atom or an ion (present in the form of its stable isotope) by a radioactive isotope of the same element.

Class.label: phosphorescent labelling
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of covalently attaching a phosphorescent molecule to another molecule, such as a protein or nucleic acid.

Class.label: leaching
Class.IAO_0000115: The dissolution of material from a solid phase into a liquid in which it is not wholly soluble.

Class.label: sample melting
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of heating a substance to cause the solid--liquid phase change.

Class.label: skull melting
Class.IAO_0000115: The melting of a material within a frozen shell of the same substance. This technique is used for materials which are very corrosive when molten e.g. cubic zirconia.

Class.label: induction skull melting
Class.IAO_0000115: The melting of a material by high-frequency induction within a frozen shell of the same substance. This technique is used for materials which are very corrosive when molten e.g. cubic zirconia.

Class.label: mixing
Class.IAO_0000115: The combining of components, particles or layers into a more homogeneous state. The mixing may be achieved manually or mechanically by shifting the material with stirrers or pumps or by revolving or shaking the container. The process must not permit segregation of particles of different size or properties. Homogeneity may be considered to have been achieved in a practical sense when the sampling error of the processed portion is negligible compared to the total error of the measurement system.

Class.label: Ostwald ripening
Class.IAO_0000115: The growth of larger crystals from those of smaller size, which have a higher solubility than the larger ones.

Class.label: photodegradation
Class.IAO_0000115: The photochemical transformation of a molecule into lower molecular weight fragments, usually in an oxidation process.

Class.label: precipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The sedimentation of a solid material (a 'precipitate') from a liquid solution in which the material is present in amounts greater than its solubility in the liquid.

Class.label: affinity precipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The selective sedimentation of a solid material (a 'precipitate') from a liquid sample containing a ligand and a target protein. The precipitate evolves after the application of a suitable stimulus (e.g. Ca2+ or Ba2+).

Class.label: co-precipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The simultaneous precipitation of a normally soluble component with a macro-component from the same solution by the formation of mixed crystals, by adsorption, occlusion or mechanical entrapment.

Class.label: immunoprecipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The sedimentation of a solid material (a 'precipitate'), consisting of an antigen--specific antibody complex, from solution.

Class.label: individual protein immunoprecipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The sedimentation of a solid material (a 'precipitate'), consisting of a specific protein--antibody complex, from a solution containing many different proteins.

Class.label: protein complex immunoprecipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The sedimentation of a solid material (a 'precipitate') consisting of a protein--specific antibody complex (where the protein is attached to a arger protein complex) from solution.

Class.label: chromatin immunoprecipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The sedimentation of a solid material (a 'precipitate') consisting of a protein--specific antibody complex (where the protein is attached to a protein--DNA complex) from solution. This method is used to determine the location of DNA binding sites on the genome for particular proteins of interest.

Class.label: ribonucleic acid immunoprecipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The sedimentation of a solid material (a 'precipitate') consisting of a protein--specific antibody complex (where the protein is part of a protein--RNA complex) from solution. This method is used to determine the location of RNA binding sites for particular proteins of interest.

Class.label: postprecipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The subsequent precipitation of a chemically different species upon the surface of an initial precipitate usually, but not necessarily, including a common ion.

Class.label: reprecipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The planned repetition of a precipitation to remove impurities from a precipitate or improve its stoichiometry.

Class.label: radiolysis
Class.IAO_0000115: The cleavage of one or more bonds resulting from exposure to high-energy radiation.

Class.label: autoradiolysis
Class.IAO_0000115: The cleavage of one or more bonds in a radioactive material resulting directly or indirectly from its own radioactive decay.

Class.label: pulse radiolysis
Class.IAO_0000115: The cleavage of one or more bonds resulting from exposure to a beam of highly accelerated (10 MeV) electrons. Pulse radiolysis is a method of initiating reactions which occur on a timescale faster than 100 \mus.

Class.label: sintering
Class.IAO_0000115: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample below its melting point until its particles adhere to each other.

Class.label: liquid-state sintering
Class.IAO_0000115: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample (consisting of a powder and a liquid) below the melting point of the solid until its particles adhere to each other.

Class.label: solid-state sintering
Class.IAO_0000115: The fusing together of small particles by heating a powder sample below its melting point until its particles adhere to each other.

Class.label: pressureless sintering
Class.IAO_0000115: The fusing together of small particles by heating the powder sample below its melting point (without applied pressure) until its particles adhere to each other.

Class.label: selective laser sintering
Class.IAO_0000115: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample below its melting point, using a high-energy laser, until its particles adhere to each other.

Class.label: spark plasma sintering
Class.IAO_0000115: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample below its melting point, using a direct current, until its particles adhere to each other.

Class.label: sonication
Class.IAO_0000115: The irradiation of a liquid sample with sound (20 Hz-20 kHz) waves resulting in agitation. Sound waves propagate into the liquid media result in alternating high-pressure (compression) and low-pressure (rarefaction) cycles. During rarefaction, high-intensity sonic waves create small vacuum bubbles or voids in the liquid, which then collapse violently (cavitation) during compression, creating very high local temperatures.

Class.label: ultrasonication
Class.IAO_0000115: The irradiation of a liquid sample with ultrasonic (>20 kHz) waves resulting in agitation. Sound waves propagate into the liquid media result in alternating high-pressure (compression) and low-pressure (rarefaction) cycles. During rarefaction, high-intensity sonic waves create small vacuum bubbles or voids in the liquid, which then collapse violently (cavitation) during compression, creating very high local temperatures.

Class.label: detection method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method used to indicate the presence of a substance within a sample.

Class.label: argon ionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method where metastable Ar atoms are used to ionise the sample, which is held in a carrier gas. The resulting electrons are focused toward a collector electrode and the current is measured.

Class.label: atomic emission detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to individual elements. The sample is atomised and excited by an excitation source and the characteristic radiation emitted by the atoms in the sample is then detected using a photodiode array.

Class.label: catalytic combustion detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to compounds containing C--H bonds. An electric current is passed through a tiny coil of platinum wire embedded in a catalytic ceramic bead (heated to 500 deg. C by the coil). A flow of air carries the sample to the bed and when a hydrogen or a hydrocarbon molecule impacts the hot coil, it combusts on the surface raising the temperature and resistance of the platinum wire. The resistance change is then measured.

Class.label: electrochemical detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to compounds which can be either reduced or oxidised. A liquid containing the sample passes directly over the working electrode, which is set to the specific potential required for oxidation or reduction. The current produced is then measured.

Class.label: pulsed electrochemical detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to compounds which can be either reduced or oxidised. A liquid containing the sample passes directly over the working electrode, which is subject to a periodic potential. The current produced is then measured.

Class.label: electrolytic conductivity detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to compounds containing Br or Cl. The pyrolysed sample is dissolved in water, forming aqueous solutions of HBr or HCl. The change in electrical conductivity of the solution is then measured.

Class.label: dry electrolytic conductivity detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to compounds containing Br or Cl. A carrier gas flow containing the sample is heated in a ceramic chamber to 1000 deg. C, forming gaseous Cl and Br ions. The change in electrical conductivity of the gas-phase current is then measured.

Class.label: electron capture detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to electronegative compounds (e.g. halogenated compounds). A beta-particle emitter (e.g. 63Ni) is used to produce an electron beam, which is passed between two electrodes. As the sample is passed through the e-beam, organic functional groups interact with the electrons, interrupting the current.

Class.label: evaporative light scattering detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method where a liquid containing the sample is atomised in a gas, forming small droplets which are allowed to evaporate leaving the sample as fine particles. The suspended particles pass through a light beam and the scattered light transmitted by the particles is sensed by a photomultiplier. The response is proportional to the mass of the molecules in the sample.

Class.label: flame ionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method which is sensitive to compounds containing C--H bonds. A flow of carrier gas containing the sample is mixed with H2 and air and ignited. Any positively-charged radicals resulting from this process are collected at a cathode, allowing the current to be measured.

Class.label: flame photometric detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to sulfur- and phosphorus-containing compounds. A flow of carrier gas containing the sample is mixed with oxygen or air and ignited. Any chemiluminescence due to these compounds is then detected.

Class.label: fluorescence detection for separation methods
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method which is sensitive to naturally fluorescent or tagged compounds. As the sample passes through a small cell it is excited by ultraviolet light and any fluorescence is detected.

Class.label: laser-induced fluorescence detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method which is sensitive to naturally fluorescent or tagged compounds. As the sample passes through a small cell it is excited by a focused ultraviolet laser and any fluorescence is detected.

Class.label: helium ionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method where metastable helium ions (generated by irradiation with beta-particles from a radioactive source) ionise the molecules in the sample (held in He carrier gas). The resulting electrons are focused toward a collector electrode and the current is measured.

Class.label: helium discharge ionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method where metastable helium ions (generated by an electric arc) ionise the molecules in the sample (held in He carrier gas). The resulting electrons are focused toward a collector electrode and the current is measured.

Class.label: pulsed discharge helium ionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to small gas molecules (e.g. O2, N2, CO2). A low-power, pulsed DC discharge is used to ionise the sample (which is held in He carrier gas). The resulting electrons are focused toward a collector electrode and the current is measured.

Class.label: nitrogen--phosphorus detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to compounds containing N and P. A flow of carrier gas containing the sample is mixed with H2 and air in the presence of a small, heated bead of an alkali salt such as Rb2SO4. Any positively-charged radicals resulting from this process are collected at a cathode allowing the current to be measured.

Class.label: paired emitter--detector diode detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is based on light emitting diodes (LEDs). One LED functions as a light source and the other LED is reverse biased to function as a light detector. Light from the source LED is passed through the sample and the intensity received by the detector LED is measured.

Class.label: photodiode array detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to organic compounds. As the sample passes through a cell it is illuminated with light in the region 190--1100 nm and any absorption is detected by a photodiode array.

Class.label: photoionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to volatile organic compounds. A carrier gas (e.g. methane) containing the sample is bombarded with high-energy (UV) photons, resulting in ionisation. The current generated by these gaseous ions is then measured.

Class.label: refractive index detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method based on the change in refractive index of a solution. Light is passed through a hollow prism and focused on a photocell. When a liquid containing the sample is allowed to flow through the prism, the light diverges from its original path and the change in intensity and angle of the transmitted light is measured.

Class.label: thermal conductivity detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to inorganic gases. A hot (450 deg. C) filament is used to heat a carrier gas containing the sample and the difference in thermal conductivity caused by the presence of the sample is measured.

Class.label: thermal energy analyser detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to molecules containing NO and NO2 groups. The sample is pyrolysed (at 275 deg. C) producing radicals, which react with ozone under low pressure to produce chemiluminescence.

Class.label: ultraviolet detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method which is sensitive to unsaturated organic compounds. As the sample passes through a cell it is illuminated with light in the region 190-350nm and any absorption is detected.

Class.label: phosphate buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution in which the pH is maintained by phosphoric acid-phosphate anion or phosphate-hydrogen phosphate equilibria.

Class.label: separation method-detection method
Class.IAO_0000115: An experiment in which a separation method is coupled to a detection method in order to detect one or more different components of a sample.

Class.label: gas chromatography-flame ionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: Flame ionisation detection that is sensitive to compounds containing C-H bonds. The eluent is mixed with H2 and air and ignited. Any positively-charged radicals resulting from this process are collected at a cathode allowing the current to be measured.

Class.label: gas chromatography-nitrogen-phosphorus detection
Class.IAO_0000115: Nitrogen-phosphorus detection where the input is from a gas chromatography separation.

Class.label: liquid chromatography-photodiode array detection
Class.IAO_0000115: Photodiode array detection where input is the mobile phase from a liquid chromatography separation.

Class.label: gas chromatography-thermal energy analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A gas chromatography method that is sensitive to compounds containing NO and NO2 groups. The eluent is pyrolysed (at 275 deg C) producing radicals, which react with ozone under low pressure to produce chemiluminescence.

Class.label: gas chromatography-thermal conductivity detection
Class.IAO_0000115: Thermal conductivity detection where the sample is the eluent from a gas chromatography separation.

Class.label: gas chromatography-flame photometric detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A gas chromatography method that is sensitive to sulfur- and phosphorus-containing compounds. The eluent is mixed with oxygen or air and ignited. Any chemiluminescence due to these compounds is then detected.

Class.label: liquid chromatography-fluorescence detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A liquid chromatography method that is sensitive to naturally fluorescent or tagged compounds. As the mobile phase passes through a small cell it is excited by ultraviolet light and any fluorescence is detected.

Class.label: liquid chromatography-refractive index detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A liquid chromatography method where detection is based on the change in refractive index of a solution. Light passes through a hollow prism and is focused on a photocell. When the mobile phase is allowed to flow through the prism, the light diverges from its original path and the change in intensity and angle of the transmitted light is measured.

Class.label: liquid chromatography-evaporative light scattering detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A liquid chromatography method where the mobile phase is atomised in a gas, forming small droplets which are allowed to evaporate leaving the sample as fine particles. The suspended particles pass through a light beam and the scattered light transmitted by the particles is sensed by a photomultiplier. The response is proportional to the mass of the molecules in the sample.
hasExactSynonym: liquid chromatography evaporative light scattering detection

Class.label: liquid chromatography-electrochemical detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A liquid chromatography method that is sensitive to compounds which can be either reduced or oxidised. The mobile phase passes directly over the working electrode, which is set to the specific potential required for oxidation or reduction. The current produced is then measured.

Class.label: gas chromatography-pulsed discharge helium ionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A gas chromatography method that is sensitive to small gas molecules (e.g. O2, N2, CO2). A low-power, pulsed DC discharge is used to ionise the eluent (which is held in He carrier gas). The resulting electrons are focused toward a collector electrode and the current is measured.
hasExactSynonym: gas chromatography pulse-discharge helium ionisation detection
gas chromatography pulse-discharge helium ionization detection
gas chromatography pulsed discharge helium ionisation detection
gas chromatography pulsed discharge helium ionization detection

Class.label: acetate buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution in which the pH is maintained by an acetic acid-acetate equilibrium.

Class.label: Tris-borate-EDTA buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A borate buffer solution prepared from Tris, boric acid, and EDTA.

Class.label: Tris--acetate--EDTA buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: An acetate buffer solution prepared from Tris, acetic acid, and EDTA.

Class.label: phosphate-buffered saline solution
Class.IAO_0000115: A phosphate buffer, prepared from sodium phosphate, potassium phosphate and sodium chloride, where the pH is maintained by a phosphate--phosphoric acid equilibrium.

Class.label: Good's buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an acid--base equilibrium involving one of Good's buffer substances (CHEBI:39011).

Class.label: ACES buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an N-(2-acetamido)-2-aminoethanesulfonic acid--2-[(2-amino-2-oxoethyl)ammonio]ethanesulfonate anion equilibrium.

Class.label: Tris buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer where the pH is maintained by a Tris--HTris equilibrium. Tris = tris(hydroxymethyl)aminomethane.

Class.label: Tris-HCl buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution in which the pH is maintained by Tris [tris(hydroxymethyl)aminomethane] and HCl solution.

Class.label: ADA buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an equilibrium involving 2,2'-[(2-amino-2-oxoethyl)imino]diacetic acid.

Class.label: BES buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an equilibrium involving 2-[bis(2-hydroxyethyl)amino]ethanesulfonic acid

Class.label: bicine buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an equilibrium involving N,N-bis(2-hydroxyethyl)glycine.

Class.label: HEPES buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an equilibrium involving 2-[4-(2-hydroxyethyl)piperazin-1-yl]ethanesulfonic acid.

Class.label: MES buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an equilibrium involving 2-(N-morpholino)ethanesulfonic acid.

Class.label: MOPS buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by an equilibrium involving 3-(N-morpholino)propanesulfonic acid.

Class.label: PIPES buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by a 2,2'-piperazine-1,4-diylbisethanesulfonic acid--2,2'-piperazine-1,4-diylbisethanesulfonate equilibrium.

Class.label: TES buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by a N-tris(hydroxymethyl)methyl-2-aminoethanesulfonic acid--N-tris(hydroxymethyl)methyl-2-ammonioethanesulfonate equilibrium.

Class.label: tricine buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by a N-tris(hydroxymethyl)methylglycine--N-tris(hydroxymethyl)methylammonioacetate equilibrium.

Class.label: tin-119 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for tin-119 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Class.label: transmission Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, usually from a laser, by a sample is detected. The light is collected from the non-illuminated side of the sample.

Class.label: optical tweezers Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, usually from a laser, by a sample (e.g. a biological cell) constrained using optical tweezers is detected.

Class.label: trapping method
Class.IAO_0000115: Any method used to trap a sample for further analysis.

Class.label: laser trapping
Class.IAO_0000115: The trapping of microscopic particles by a focused laser beam. The beam is focused through a microscope objective, producing a strong electric field gradient at its narrowest point, which attracts dielectric particles.

Class.label: deep-level transient spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities, grain boundaries, interfaces, etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the capacitance  produced by applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at different temperatures, spectra are generated which exhibit a peak for each 'deep level' (each energy level near the center of the band gap). The height of the peak is proportional to the defect density and the emission rate and temperature dependence are characteristic for each type of defect.

Class.label: Laplace deep-level transient spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities, grain boundaries, interfaces, etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the average capacitance produced by applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at a fixed temperatures, spectra are generated which exhibit a peak for each 'deep level' (each energy level near the center of the band gap). The height of the peak is proportional to the defect density and the emission rate is characteristic for each type of defect.
hasExactSynonym: Laplace transform deep level transient spectroscopy

Class.label: constant-capacitance deep-level transient spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities, grain boundaries, interfaces, etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By holding the capacitance constant and monitoring the carrier emission produced when applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at different temperatures, spectra are generated which exhibit a peak for each 'deep level' (each energy level near the center of the band gap). The height of the peak is proportional to the defect density and the emission rate and temperature dependence are characteristic for each type of defect.
hasExactSynonym: constant capacitance deep level transient spectroscopy

Class.label: current deep-level transient spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities, grain boundaries, interfaces, etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the current produced when applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at different temperatures, spectra are generated which exhibit a peak for each 'deep level' (each energy level near the center of the band gap). The height of the peak is proportional to the defect density and the emission rate and temperature dependence are characteristic for each type of defect.

Class.label: isothermal capactiance transient spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities, grain boundaries, interfaces, etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the capacitance produced by applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at constant different temperatures, spectra are generated that exhibit peaks, the height of which are proportional to the height of which are proportional to time constant for the emission rate.

Class.label: normalised isothermal capacitance transient spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities, grain boundaries, interfaces, etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the normalised capacitance produced by applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at constant different temperatures, spectra are generated that exhibit peaks, the height of which are proportional to time constant for the emission rate.

Class.label: differential isothermal capacitance transient spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities, grain boundaries, interfaces, etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the differential of the capacitance produced by applying a voltage pulse to the semiconductor junction at constant different temperatures, spectra are generated that exhibit peaks, the height of which are proportional to the height of which are proportional to time constant for the emission rate.

Class.label: photoinduced current transient spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities, grain boundaries, interfaces, etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the current produced by applying an optical pulse to the semiconductor junction at different temperatures, spectra are generated which exhibit peaks, the height of which are proportional to the defect density, and the emission rate and temperature dependence are characteristic for each type of defect.

Class.label: microwave-detected photoinduced current transient spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the extent of intrinsic and process-induced defects in the  crystalline layers within  semiconductor devices. Defects arising from impurities, grain boundaries, interfaces, etc. result in the creation of traps that capture free electrons and holes. By monitoring the current produced by applying a microwave pulse to the semiconductor junction at different temperatures, spectra are generated which exhibit peaks, the height of which are proportional to the defect density, and the emission rate and temperature dependence are characteristic for each type of defect.
hasExactSynonym: microwave detected photoinduced current transient spectroscopy

Class.label: 23Na triple-quantum excitation in combination with magic angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment used for 23Na nuclei, involving transitions between non-consecutive energy levels during the excitation of the spin system by the first rf pulse.

Class.label: 27Al triple-quantum excitation in combination with magic angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment used for 27Al nuclei, involving transitions between non-consecutive energy levels during the excitation of the spin system by the first rf pulse.

Class.label: 45Sc triple-quantum excitation in combination with magic angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment used for 45Sc nuclei, involving transitions between non-consecutive energy levels during the excitation of the spin system by the first rf pulse.

Class.label: 45Sc nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 45Sc nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: capillary force lithography
Class.IAO_0000115: A process for shaping pliable thermoplastic polymers. An elastomeric mould is placed on a polymer that has been spin-coated onto a substrate. The system is then heated above the glass transition temperature of the polymer. Capillary force allows the polymer melt to fill up the void space between the polymer and the mould. After cooling to ambient temperature, the mould is removed, generating the negative replica of the mould pattern.

Class.label: pervaporation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for the separation of liquid mixtures based on diffusion rate and membrane affinity. The sample mixture is placed in contact with one side of a non-porous polymeric membrane while a vacuum is applied to the other side. The components in the liquid stream permeate through the membrane, evaporate, and are then condensed.

Class.label: rotating-field mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry that uses sinusoidal radio frequency fields (in the x- and y- direction, differing in phase by 90 deg.) during ion detection. The ions of a particular mass travel in a helix and impact an ion detector,  generating a pattern consisting of a set of concentric circles.

Class.label: RapidFire(R) mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry, developed by BioTrove, which uses microfluidics to aspirate an aliquot of sample directly from a quenched assay plate and performs a solid-phase extraction on the sample before ionisation.

Class.label: laser sintering
Class.IAO_0000115: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample with a laser (e.g. a CO2 laser) below its melting point until its particles adhere to each other.

Class.label: argon plasma sintering
Class.IAO_0000115: The fusing together of small particles by heating the sample with an Ar plasma (a partially ionised gas containing free electrons) until the particles adhere to each other.

Class.label: normal-phase high-performance liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid,  the stationary phase consists of very small particles, and the inlet pressure is relatively high. In normal-phase HPLC, the stationary phase is more polar than the mobile phase.

Class.label: membrane extraction with a sorbent interface-gas chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where the sample is first transferred from one phase (the 'donor' or 'feed' phase) to another (the 'acceptor' or 'strip' phase) across a non-porous non-polar polymer membrane. The membrane extracts the analytes from their matrix, and these are subsequently trapped on a polymeric trap with a porous sorbent using a carrier gas stream. In the second step, the mixture in the carrier gas stream is further separated by gas chromatography.
hasExactSynonym: membrane extraction with sorbent interface gas chromatography
membrane extraction with sorbent interface-gas chromatography

Class.label: low-temperature electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: low temperature electrothermal vaporisation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
low temperature electrothermal vaporization inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
low-temperature electrothermal vaporization inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a solid sample is vaporised by depositing it on a probe which is rapidly heated (to <1000 deg. C) by passing a current through it. The vaporised sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Class.label: sample transformation method-detection method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method consisting of a sample transformation method coupled to a detection method.

Class.label: sample transformation method-measurement method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method consisting of a sample transformation method coupled to a measurement method.

Class.label: supercritical fluid extraction-Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy where the sample is initially transferred from a matrix to a liquid phase using a supercritical fluid.
hasExactSynonym: supercritical fluid extraction-Fourier transform infrared absorption spectroscopy

Class.label: continuous-wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of the absorption of radio frequency radiation vs. frequency for spin-active nuclei.
hasExactSynonym: continuous wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectra
continuous wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum

Class.label: 1H continuous-wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of the absorption of radio frequency radiation vs. frequency for hydrogen-1 nuclei.

Class.label: 1H continuous-wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: 1H continuous wave nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 1H nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Spectra are obtained by scanning a range of radio frequencies.

Class.label: reflection--absorption Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: Fourier transform infrared reflection absorption spectrometry
Fourier transform infrared reflection absorption spectroscopy
reflection absorption Fourier transform infra-red spectrometry
reflection absorption Fourier transform infrared spectrometry
reflection absorption Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the absorption and reflection of low-incident-angle infrared light by the surface molecules of a highly reflective or polished sample is measured. The  sample absorbs a single pulse of radiation and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: electrochemical quartz crystal microgravimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method used to determine the ratio of the mass, deposited at the electrode surface during an electrochemical reaction, to the total charge passed through the electrode (the 'current efficiency'). The electrode surface is deposited on a piezoelectric quartz crystal, and the change in resonance frequency of the crystal is measured.

Class.label: electron micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage under vacuum, and detecting the transmitted, secondary, backscattered and diffracted electrons, and characteristic X-rays emitted.

Class.label: scanning electron micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by scanning a finely-focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam across the specimen under vacuum.

Class.label: transmission electron micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the transmitted electrons.

Class.label: ultraviolet--visible spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that consists of: a light source; a holder for the sample; a diffraction grating or monochromator to separate the different wavelengths of light; a detector, and is used to measure spectra in the range ultraviolet to visible (190--800 nm).

Class.label: ultraviolet spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that consists of: a light source; a holder for the sample; a diffraction grating or monochromator to separate the different wavelengths of light; a detector, and is used to measure spectra in the ultraviolet range (190--400 nm).

Class.label: diffuse reflectance ultraviolet--visible spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of reflectance (%) vs. wavenumber obtained by measuring the amount of ultraviolet to visible (190--800 nm) radiation reflected from an uneven surface at a number of angles by the sample.

Class.label: nuclear magnetic resonance method
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique or procedure applied in nuclear magnetic resonance experiments.

Class.label: nuclear magnetic resonance spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus used to conduct NMR experiments consisting of a magnet housing a sample space surrounded by two coils which act to transmit radio frequency radiation to the sample and to detect the response of the sample.

Class.label: first derivative nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of the change in intensity of absorption vs. the change in frequency as a function of the frequency of radiation applied, for spin-active nuclei.

Class.label: energy dispersive X-ray spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an electron source, a grating and a semiconductor detector, which is used to measure the X-ray emissions of a sample as a function of wavelength. The X-rays emerging from the sample pass through a slit then the grating disperses them by diffraction according to their wavelength. Finally, X-ray energy is converted to voltage pulses or 'counts' by the detector.

Class.label: synchrotron
Class.IAO_0000115: A large-scale particle accelerator in which a magnetic field is used to create the particle orbits. Synchrotrons produce X-ray, vacuum ultraviolet and broadband infrared radiation.

Class.label: pole figure measurement
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining crystal orientation, using X-ray diffraction, which involves systematically rotating the sample about well defined angles until all possible lattice planes are reflected, and measuring the reflection intensity as a function of angle. The results are plotted as a pole figure.

Class.label: synchrotron X-ray scattering
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of X-rays scattered by a sample. X-Rays are generated in a synchrotron.

Class.label: infrared microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an optical microscope coupled to a reflecting magnifying mirror system, which is used to collect spatially resolved infrared spectra of the surface of a specimen.

Class.label: Raman microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a laser beam (<10 \mum diameter), a monochromator and a detector coupled to an optical microscope, which is used to measure Raman spectra.

Class.label: electrochemical quartz crystal microbalance
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus consisting of  a quartz crystal resonator,  which is used to measure the current efficiency (mass-to-charge ratio) during an electrochemical reaction, by measuring the change in resonance frequency of the crystal.

Class.label: Fourier transform photoacoustic spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: The Fourier transform of a plot of intensity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the sound emitted when a gaseous sample is exposed to an intense laser beam, which is rapidly interrupted by a rotating slotted disk.

Class.label: synchrotron infrared microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The collection of spatially resolved infrared spectra of a sample during optical microscopy. The infrared spectra are obtained by single pulse of infrared radiation, produced in a synchrotron, and are subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: vibrational microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of chemical imaging spectroscopy where an optical microscope is used to image the sample and locate a small area for spectral analysis that probes the vibrational degrees of freedom of a molecule.

Class.label: synchrotron Fourier transform infrared spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of absorbance or emission vs. wavelength/wavenumber/frequency obtained through a Fourier transform of the times series of the absorption or emission of a sample that has been excited by an infrared-frequency pulse generated in a synchrotron.

Class.label: synchrotron Fourier transform infrared microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The collection of spatially resolved infrared spectra of a sample during optical microscopy. The infrared spectra are obtained by single pulse of infrared radiation, produced in a synchrotron, and are subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: synchrotron Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: synchrotron Fourier transform infra-red absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs a single pulse of radiation from the infrared region (0.78--1000 \mum), produced in a synchrotron, and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: infrared spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus consisting of an infrared laser, a beam splitter and a detector (a CCD), which is used to measure spectra in the infrared range.

Class.label: Fourier transform infrared spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus consisting of an infrared laser, an interferometer and a detector, which is used to measure spectra in the infrared range. The spectrometer measures the amount of infrared radiation not absorbed by the sample, and the application of a Fourier transform converts the resulting time domain digital signal into a frequency domain digital signal.

Class.label: micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: A magnified image obtained using a microscope to view a small object (or specimen).

Class.label: optical micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by illuminating the specimen with visible light, and using a system of magnifying lenses.

Class.label: electrophoretic light scattering
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the electrophoretic mobility and zeta-potential of a sample of colloidal particles in solution by illuminating the sample with a light source (usually a laser) and measuring the time dependent fluctuations in the frequency of the scattered light caused by an oscillating electric field.

Class.label: Kerr effect spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the refractive index change of the sample induced by two polarized laser beams (pump and probe) under the influence of an electric field (the 'optical Kerr effect') is measured.

Class.label: Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where two polarized laser beams (pump and probe) with a frequency difference close to a Raman-mode frequency in the sample induce a refractive index change in the sample. By scanning the frequency difference of the two beams and recording simultaneously the polarization change of the probe beam, the Raman spectral structure of the sample can be obtained.

Class.label: magneto optical Kerr effect spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the refractive index change of laser light reflected by a magnetized sample (the 'magneto-optic Kerr effect') is measured.

Class.label: optically-heterodyned Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: optically heterodyned Raman induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
optically heterodyned Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
