Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where two polarized laser beams (pump and probe) with a frequency difference close to a Raman-mode frequency in the sample induce a refractive index change in the sample. By scanning the frequency difference of the two beams and recording simultaneously the polarization change of the probe beam, the Raman spectral structure of the sample can be obtained. The polarizing filters are rotated slightly, giving rise to a heterodyne at the detector, improving the signal-to-noise ratio compared to Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy.

Class.label: confocal infrared microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The collection of spatially resolved infrared spectra of a sample during optical microscopy. An aperture is used to discriminate between infrared signal coming from the laser spot and that coming from the out-of-focus region of the sample.

Class.label: liquid chromatography mass spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of relative abundance (%) vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment of a sample mixture separated by liquid chromatography.

Class.label: femtosecond Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: femtosecond Raman induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where femtosecond pulses of two polarized laser beams (pump and probe) with a frequency difference close to a Raman-mode frequency in the sample induce a refractive index change in the sample. By scanning the frequency difference of the two beams and recording simultaneously the polarization change of the probe beam, the Raman spectral structure of the sample can be obtained.Information is obtained regarding ultrafast solvent dynamics by measuring the time response of a transient birefringence that is induced in the sample by a polarized femtosecond optical pulse.

Class.label: nanoflow liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by nanoflow liquid chromatography (flow rate of nL min-1) before being converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance, by two mass spectrometers in series.
hasExactSynonym: nano liquid chromatography tandem mass spectroscopy
nanoflow liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry

Class.label: two-dimensional liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid, an initial separation proceeds in a primary column (commonly ion-exchange), and parts of the eluent from this column are directed into a secondary column (commonly reverse phase).

Class.label: two-dimensional liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: two-dimensional liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated sequentially using two different liquid chromatography columns (commonly, ion-exchange followed by reversed-phase) before being analysed by two mass spectrometers in series.

Class.label: time-resolved optical Kerr effect spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where time response of a transient birefringence induced in the sample by two polarized laser beams (pump and probe) under the influence of an electric field (the 'optical Kerr effect') is measured.
hasExactSynonym: time resolved optical Kerr effect spectroscopy

Class.label: optically-heterodyned Kerr effect spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: optically heterodyne detected optical Kerr effect spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the refractive index change of the sample induced by two polarized laser beams (pump and probe) under the influence of an electric field (the 'optical Kerr effect') is measured. The polarizing filters are rotated slightly, giving rise to a heterodyne at the detector, improving the signal-to-noise ratio compared to optical Kerr effect spectroscopy.

Class.label: femtosecond optically-heterodyned Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where femtosecond pulses of two polarized laser beams (pump and probe) with a frequency difference close to a Raman-mode frequency in the sample induce a refractive index change in the sample. By scanning the frequency difference of the two beams and recording simultaneously the polarization change of the probe beam, the Raman spectral structure of the sample can be obtained. The polarizing filters are rotated slightly, giving rise to a heterodyne at the detector, improving the signal-to-noise ratio compared to Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy.
hasExactSynonym: femtosecond optical heterodyne-detected Raman-induced Kerr-effect spectroscopy
femtosecond optically heterodyned Raman induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
femtosecond optically heterodyned Raman-induced Kerr effect spectroscopy
femtosecond optically heterodyned Raman-induced Kerr-effect spectroscopy

Class.label: nuclear magnetic resonance pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A series of short (microsecond) bursts (pulses) of rf radiation separated by delays (of defined duration) designed to interact with, and manipulate the magnetic moments of spin-active nuclei during NMR spectroscopy.

Class.label: radio frequency pulse
Class.IAO_0000115: A short (microsecond) period of radio frequency wavelength radiation.

Class.label: bilinear rotation decoupling pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse cluster (a spin echo on 1H with inversion of 13C in the centre) used to achieve selective inversion of 12C-bound protons, thus achieving the removal of signals due to 12C-bound nuclei. For the pulse sequence see Chem. Phys. Lett., (1982), 93, pg 504

Class.label: decoupling pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR pulse sequence that decouples nuclei i.e. removes the effects of (usually) J-coupling (line splitting) from the spectrum.

Class.label: composite pulse decoupling sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR pulse sequence, employing composite pulses, which decouples nuclei i.e. removes the effects of (usually) J-coupling (line splitting) from the spectrum.

Class.label: decoupling in the presence of scalar interactions
Class.IAO_0000115: A sequence of composite pulses designed to remove signal splitting due to heteronuclear J-couplings in multinuclear liquid NMR experiments. Also used to allow transfer of magnetisation between nuclei (by making the spins precess with at the same chemical shift and thus enjoy strong coupling---isotropic mixing). For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson., (1988), 77, pg 274.

Class.label: globally optimized alternating phase rectangular pulse
Class.IAO_0000115: A sequence of composite pulses designed to remove signal splitting due to heteronuclear J-couplings in multinuclear liquid NMR experiments. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson., (1985), 64, pg 547.

Class.label: Malcolm Levitt pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A sequence of composite pulses designed to remove signal splitting due to heteronuclear J-couplings in multinuclear liquid NMR experiments. Also used to allow transfer of magnetisation between nuclei (by making the spins precess with at the same chemical shift and thus enjoy strong coupling---isotropic mixing). For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson., (1981), 43, pg 502.

Class.label: phase alternated rotation of magnetisation
Class.IAO_0000115: A sequence of composite pulses designed to remove signal splitting due to heteronuclear J-couplings in multinuclear liquid NMR experiments.

Class.label: spin decoupling employing ultra-broadband-inversion sequences generated via simulated annealing
Class.IAO_0000115: A sequence of composite pulses designed to remove signal splitting due to heteronuclear J-couplings in multinuclear liquid NMR experiments. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson. A, (1994), 106, pg 241.

Class.label: wideband alternating-phase low-power technique for zero residual splitting
Class.IAO_0000115: A sequence of composite pulses designed to remove signal splitting due to heteronuclear J-couplings in multinuclear liquid NMR experiments. Also used to allow transfer of magnetisation between nuclei (by making the spins precess with at the same chemical shift and thus enjoy strong coupling---isotropic mixing). J. Magn. Reson., (1983), 52, pg 335.

Class.label: magic angle spinning decoupling pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR pulse sequence, used in magic angle spinning, that decouples nuclei i.e. removes the effects of (usually) J-coupling (line splitting) from the spectrum.

Class.label: Burum, Linder, Ernst windowless pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A sequence of pulses used in magic angle spinning NMR to remove the effect of homonuclear dipolar couplings. A train/sequence of pulses is used to cyclically manipulate the signal whilst stroboscopic sampling ensures the effects of coupling are unobserved. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson., (1981), 44, pg 173.

Class.label: decoupling using mind-boggling optimisation pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A sequence of pulses used in magic angle spinning NMR to remove the effect of homonuclear dipolar couplings. For the pulse sequence see Chem. Phys. Lett., (2004), 398, pg 532.

Class.label: magic sandwich high-order truncation pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A sequence of pulses used in magic angle spinning NMR to remove the effect of homonuclear dipolar couplings. For the pulse sequence see J. Chem. Phys., (1997), 125, pg 291.

Class.label: two pulse phase modulation pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A continuous sequence of pulses used in magic angle spinning NMR to remove the effects of heteronuclear dipolar coupling. For the pulse sequence see J. Chem. Phys., (1996), 103, pg 6951.

Class.label: Waugh, Huber, Haeberlin pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse sequence used in magic angle spinning NMR to remove the effects of homonuclear dipolar coupling. For the pulse sequence see Phys. Rev. Lett., (1968), 20, pg 180.

Class.label: Mansfield, Rhim, Elleman, Vaughn pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse sequence used in magic angle spinning NMR to remove the effects of homonuclear dipolar coupling. For the pulse sequence see J. Chem. Phys., (1973), 59, pg 3740.

Class.label: delays alternating with nutation for tailored excitation
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse sequence used to selectively excite a frequency range by applying a series of very short pulses to manipulate, or nutate, the magnetisation vectors of the desired spins, interspersed with delays which cause the off-resonance magnetisation to receive a different phase. For the pulse see J. Magn. Reson., (1978), 29, pg 433.

Class.label: double pulsed field gradient spin echo pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR pulse sequence in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a doubled spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular resonances. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson. A, (1995), 112, pg 275.
hasExactSynonym: double pulsed field gradient spin echo
double pulsed field gradient spin-echo pulse sequence

Class.label: double quantum transitions for finding unresolved lines
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse sequence used to selectively resolve the signals from two coupled nuclei, see J. Am. Chem. Soc., (1982), 104, pg 4286.

Class.label: flip flop spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A sequence of composite pulses designed to allow isotropic mixing of magnetisation between nuclei. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn.Reson., (1988), 77, pg 274.

Class.label: heteronuclear Hartmann Hahn pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR pulse sequence used to transfer magnetisation between protons and covalently bound (spin active) heteronuclei via isotropic mixing of their magnetisation. Used to e.g. enhance the NMR signal of heteronuclei or to correlate chemical shifts of protons with heteronuclei. For the pulse sequence see J. Magn. Reson., (1991), 91, pg 444.

Class.label: solvent suppression pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR pulse sequence that is used to suppress or remove the solvent signal.

Class.label: jump and return pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse cluster used for solvent suppression consisting of two rf pulses separated by a delay with conditions set such that the solvent signal alone is rendered unobservable by the second pulse. For the pulse sequence see J. Am. Chem. Soc., (1982), 104, pg 7310.

Class.label: water elimination Fourier transform
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse cluster used to suppress solvent (water) signals exploiting the differing relaxation properties of solvent and sample. Resonances are inverted and the subsequent recovery period is chosen such that the solvent signal is at a null point when the signal is detected. For the pulse sequence see J. Chem. Phys., (1972), 56, pg 3182.

Class.label: water suppression through gradient tailored excitation
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse cluster used for solvent (water) suppression. The solvent resonances are selectively excited and pulsed field gradients used to destroy the signal. For the pulse sequence see J. Biomol. NMR, (1992), 2, pg 661.

Class.label: spin echo pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse cluster used in NMR experiments which manipulates signals such that, at the end of the sequence, the effects of chemical shift differences have been compensated/removed. Used most simply to compensate for inhomogeneities in the magnetic field but delays in the sequence also permit various possible manipulations of the magnetisation. For the pulse sequence see Phys. Rev., (1950), 80, pg 580.

Class.label: total suppression of sidebands pulse sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A pulse sequence used in magic angle spinning NMR experiments to remove additional signals resulting from spinning the sample too slowly to obtain a response composed solely of isotropic chemical shifts.

Class.label: shaped radio frequency pulse
Class.IAO_0000115: A selective or shaped pulse, which is designed to excite only a specific region of a spectrum.

Class.label: chirped pulse
Class.IAO_0000115: An adiabatic shaped pulse. The resonance frequency is swept through a defined rf range during application of the pulse. Allows excitation of a broader range of frequencies than the size of the rf field. For the pulse see J. Magn. Reson., Ser. A, (1993), 102, pg 293.

Class.label: wideband, uniform rate and smooth truncation pulse
Class.IAO_0000115: An adiabatic shaped pulse incorporating a linear sweep through a frequency range used for selective inversion of spin state populations over wide ranges. For the pulse see J. Magn. Reson., Ser. A, (1995), 115, pg 273.
hasExactSynonym: wideband, uniform rate and smooth truncation

Class.label: accordion spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A dimensionality reduction technique used in multidimensional NMR experiments. A nD NMR experiment is represented in n-1 dimensions by concerted, simultaneous interrogation of two spectral dimensions.

Class.label: constant time method
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique used in 2D NMR whereby the chemical shift frequency modulation of the FIDs necessary to interrogate the second dimension is achieved by moving the position of a rf pulse within a fixed time period on subsequent repeats of the experiment.

Class.label: multiple quantum filter
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR technique used to edit the NMR response from a sample by selecting particular spin systems of interest according to the number of nuclei present within them. Usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase (direction of application) of the pulses in an experiment and of the receiver.

Class.label: double quantum filter
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR technique used to edit the NMR response from a sample by selecting only two-spin coupled systems, usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase (direction of application) of the pulses in an experiment and of the receiver.

Class.label: single quantum filter
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR technique used to edit the NMR response from a sample by selecting only uncoupled spins (singlets), usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase (direction of application) of the pulses in an experiment and of the receiver.

Class.label: triple quantum filter
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR technique used to edit the NMR response from a sample by selecting only three-spin coupled systems, usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase (direction of application) of the pulses in an experiment and of the receiver

Class.label: phase cycle
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique used in FT NMR experiments whereby the sense of application (or phase) of the rf pulses is altered on repeating the experiment such that addition of the resulting signals results in increased intensity for the signals of interest, elimination of artefacts and more effective noise reduction.

Class.label: cyclically ordered phase sequence
Class.IAO_0000115: A phase cycle technique used in FT NMR experiments whereby the sense of application (or phase) of the rf pulses is altered on repeating the experiment such that addition of the resulting signals results in increased intensity for the signals of interest and more effective noise reduction. For the technique see Progr. NMR Spectr., (1978), 12, pg 41.

Class.label: exorcycle
Class.IAO_0000115: A phase cycle technique used in FT NMR experiments whereby the sense of application (or phase) of the rf pulses is altered on repeating the experiment to eliminate spectral artefacts. Exorcyle takes its name from the fact that it is used to remove 'phantom' and 'ghost' peaks. For the technique see J. Magn. Reson., (1977), 27, pg 511.

Class.label: presaturation
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR technique whereby particular resonances are saturated (their spin-state populations are equalised). Commonly used to suppress solvent signals.

Class.label: pulsed field gradient
Class.IAO_0000115: A tool employed in NMR experiments; spatially inhomogeneous magnetic fields applied with a defined gradient. Used to either select a particular signal or to render unwanted signals undetectable.

Class.label: states acquisition
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique used in multidimensional NMR experiments to achieve frequency discrimination of the signals in the additional dimensions.

Class.label: states--time proportional phase incrementation
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique used in multidimensional NMR experiments to achieve frequency discrimination of the signals in the additional dimensions.

Class.label: time proportional phase incrementation
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique used in multidimensional NMR experiments to achieve frequency discrimination of the signals in the additional dimensions.

Class.label: variable angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique used in solid-state NMR experiments to achieve the controlled reintroduction of dipolar couplings by varying the angle at which the sample is spun relative to the applied magnetic field.

Class.label: X-filter
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique used in NMR of isotopically enriched samples (usually 13C/15N) to select for, or to remove signals of protons bound to a particular isotope.

Class.label: X half filter
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique used in 2D NMR of isotopically enriched samples (usually 13C/15N) to remove signals of protons which are not bound to a particular isotope from one of the two domains of the experiment. For the technique see J. Magn. Reson., (1986), 70, pg 500.

Class.label: ZZ-filter
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique used in NMR experiments to remove unwanted signals from the spectrum by destroying the magnetisation giving rise to these signals using a pulsed filed gradient whilst the magnetisation of interest is maintained in a state which is unaffected by the pulsed field gradient (ZZ-state).

Class.label: chemical map
Class.IAO_0000115: A data set derived from microspectroscopy consisting of a three-dimensional image where two axes describe the x and y spatial dimensions and the third dimension represents spectral wavelength. The image is obtained by stacking one image per spectral wavelength sequentially.

Class.label: Fourier transform infrared map
Class.IAO_0000115: A data set derived from FTIR microscopy consisting of a three-dimensional image where two axes describe the x and y spatial dimensions and the third dimension represents the infrared wavelength. The image is obtained by stacking one image per infrared wavelength sequentially.

Class.label: infrared map
Class.IAO_0000115: A data set derived from infrared microscopy consisting of a three-dimensional image where two axes describe the x and y spatial dimensions and the third dimension represents the infrared wavelength. The image is obtained by stacking one image per infrared wavelength sequentially.

Class.label: thermography
Class.IAO_0000115: An imaging method that uses infrared (900-14 000 nm) radiation and allows variation in temperature to be observed (typically brighter areas in the image represent higher temperatures).

Class.label: fluorescence micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by illuminating the specimen with (usually) ultraviolet light, and collecting the light emitted by chromophores in the specimen (fluorescence) using a system of magnifying lenses.

Class.label: dynamic force microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. The tip oscillates, intermittently touching or tapping the surface. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen, line by line, and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Class.label: lateral force microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen, line by line, and recording the frictional force experienced by the tip as a function of position (the 'twist' of the tip). A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Class.label: non-contact mode atomic force microscopy
hasExactSynonym: dynamic force microscopy in attractive regime
dynamic scanning force microscopy in attractive regime
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. The tip oscillates in the 'attractive' force region, i.e. avoiding sample contact. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen, line by line, and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Class.label: supercritical-fluid extraction-supercritical-fluid chromatography-gas chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental method where the sample is first transferred to the liquid phase using a supercritical fluid, then subjected to column chromatography where the supercritical fluid acts as the mobile phase, and finally depressurised, collected and subjected to gas chromatography.
hasExactSynonym: supercritical fluid extraction supercritical fluid chromatography gas chromatography
supercritical-fluid extraction supercritical-fluid chromatography gas chromatography

Class.label: supercritical-fluid extraction-gas chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental method where the sample is first transferred to the liquid phase using a supercritical fluid, then depressurised, collected and subjected to gas chromatography.

Class.label: supercritical-fluid extraction-supercritical-fluid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental method where the sample is first transferred to the liquid phase using a supercritical fluid, then subjected to column chromatography where the supercritical fluid acts as the mobile phase.
hasExactSynonym: supercritical fluid extraction supercritical fluid chromatography

Class.label: supercritical-fluid extraction-supercritical-fluid chromatography-liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental method where the sample is first transferred to the liquid phase using a supercritical fluid, then subjected to column chromatography where the supercritical fluid acts as the mobile phase, and finally depressurised, collected and subjected to liquid  chromatography.
hasExactSynonym: supercritical fluid extraction supercritical fluid chromatography liquid chromatography
supercritical-fluid extraction supercritical-fluid chromatography liquid chromatography

Class.label: rapid expansion of supercritical solutions
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique where a solid sample is dissolved in a supercritical fluid and this mixture is then expanded using a restrictor, causing the solid to precipitate.

Class.label: supercritical fluid method
Class.IAO_0000115: Any material processing method that uses a supercritical fluid.

Class.label: supercritical antisolvent technique
Class.IAO_0000115: A solid sample is dissolved in a common (organic or inorganic) solvent then injected into a supercritical fluid (held under pressure) resulting in a large decrease in solution density. This effect leads to the reduction in solubility of the solid and precipitation.

Class.label: particles from gas-saturated solutions
Class.IAO_0000115: A solid sample is heated above its melting point and combining the molten material with a supercritical fluid. The solution is then expanded through a nozzle, causing the precipitation of the solid as a fine powder.

Class.label: rapid-scan infrared absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the infrared region (0.78--1000 \mum). Spectra are collected at a rate of approx. 0.05 s per spectrum.

Class.label: ultra-rapid-scan infrared absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the infrared region  (0.78--1000 \mum). Spectra are collected at a rate of approx. 0.001 s per spectrum.
hasExactSynonym: ultra rapid scan infrared absorption spectroscopy

Class.label: focal-plane array
Class.IAO_0000115: A sensing device, consisting of an array of light-sensing pixels at the focal plane of a lens, that is sensitive to infrared radiation. The device operates by converting infrared photons to an electrical signal, and using it to construct an image of the sample.

Class.label: structure data
Class.IAO_0000115: Data obtained from a structure determination method.

Class.label: small-angle X-ray scattering data
Class.IAO_0000115: Data which is obtained from an X-ray scattering experiment where the X-rays are scattered by the sample at low angles (0--10 deg.).

Class.label: aluminium-27 magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum where the nuclei of interest are aluminium-27 nuclei and in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field).

Class.label: cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field) and cross polarisation has been used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei.
hasExactSynonym: cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectra
cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectra
cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum

Class.label: phosphorus-31 cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
hasExactSynonym: phosphorus-31 cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectra
phosphorus-31 cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectra
phosphorus-31 cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum in which the nuclei of interest are phosphorus-31 nuclei, line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field), and cross polarisation has been used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei.

Class.label: carbon-13 cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
hasExactSynonym: carbon-13 cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectra
carbon-13 cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectra
carbon-13 cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum in which the nuclei of interest are carbon-13 nuclei, line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field), and cross polarisation has been used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei.

Class.label: 13C cross-polarisation magic angle spinning
hasExactSynonym: 13C cross polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
13C cross polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
13C cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
13C cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei, which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples, cause significant line broadening in solid state NMR, but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field). Cross polarisation is used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei such as 13C nuclei.

Class.label: time-resolved fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the time decay of the fluorescence of molecules excited using ultraviolet light is detected.

Class.label: time-resolved fluorescence anisotropy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for measuring the binding interaction between two labelled molecules. The sample is excited with vertically polarised light and the decay time and polarization of the fluorescence is measured.

Class.label: single-molecule fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the fluorescence of a single molecule excited by ultraviolet light is detected as a function of wavelength.

Class.label: fluorescence decay curve
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of fluorescence intensity vs. time.

Class.label: fluorescence anisotropy decay curve
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of fluorescence anisotropy (the difference in polarisation between incident and fluorescent light) vs. time.

Class.label: cathodoluminescence detection
Class.IAO_0000115: The detection of luminescence emitted from a sample as a result of the impact of high-energy electrons.

Class.label: shear force microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. The tip oscillates parallel to the surface. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen, line by line, and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.
hasExactSynonym: shear force modulation mode atomic force microscopy

Class.label: diffusing wave spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining molecular motion by measuring the time it takes for a particle in a highly-scattering suspension (e.g. a colloid) to move a distance comparable to the wavelength of light.

Class.label: total internal reflection microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of optical microscopy which is used to monitor Brownian fluctuations in the separation between a single microscopic sphere and a flat plate in aqueous media. The sphere is levitated above the plate by colloidal forces such as double-layer or steric repulsion. Changes in elevation as small as 1 nm can be detected by measuring the light scattered by a single sphere when illuminated by an evanescent wave.

Class.label: electronic circular dichroism spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised visible or near-ultraviolet radiation (200--400 nm). The optical activity of the sample is monitored using electronic transitions.

Class.label: electronic circular dichroism spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of ellipticity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised visible or near-ultraviolet radiation as a function of wavelength. ECD spectra can also be derived computationally.

Class.label: one-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for spin-active nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Class.label: three-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A three-dimensional plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for spin-active nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field. Signals are defined in terms of three frequencies; by the chemical shift of a particular nucleus in one dimension and, in the other two, by the chemical shifts of correlated nuclei.

Class.label: directed self-assembly
Class.IAO_0000115: A synthesis method in which the components of the sample spontaneously (and reversibly) associate by non-covalent interactions, taking the form of an existing lithographically templated structure or pattern.

Class.label: automated thermal desorption-gas chromatography mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first adsorbed onto packed tubes (e.g. Tenax) then each tube is automatically moved into a desorption oven and heated (100--280 deg. C for 5--20 min) to promote thermal desorption of the mixture into the headspace of the tube. The headspace is sampled and used for gas chromatography and the eluent is then ionised and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: automated thermal desorption gas chromatography mass spectrometry

Class.label: pulse-discharge detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method where a DC voltage pulse is passed through a carrier gas (e.g. helium) and the current generated by this ionisation is measured.

Class.label: pulse-discharge photoionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method where a DC voltage pulse is passed through a carrier gas generating high-energy (13.5--17.5 eV) photons which photoionise the elements in the sample mixture, and the current generated by this ionisation is measured.

Class.label: argon pulse-discharge photoionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method where a DC voltage pulse is passed through argon gas generating high-energy (13.5--17.5 eV) photons which photoionise the elements in the sample mixture, and the current generated by this ionisation is measured.

Class.label: krypton pulse-discharge photoionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method where a DC voltage pulse is passed through krypton gas generating high-energy (13.5--17.5 eV) photons which photoionise the elements in the sample mixture, and the current generated by this ionisation is measured.

Class.label: helium pulse-discharge photoionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method where a DC voltage pulse is passed through helium gas generating high-energy (13.5--17.5 eV) photons which photoionise the elements in the sample mixture, and the current generated by this ionisation is measured.

Class.label: gas chromatography-pulse-discharge photoionisation detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method where a DC voltage pulse is passed through a carrier gas generating high-energy (13.5--17.5 eV) photons which photoionise the elements a sample obtained by gas chromatography, and the current generated by this ionisation is measured.
hasExactSynonym: gas chromatography pulse discharge photoionisation detection
gas chromatography pulse discharge photoionization detection

Class.label: collision-induced dissociation
Class.IAO_0000115: A fragmentation method where the sample is ionised, and selected ions are allowed to collide with neutral gas molecules, resulting in fragmentation.

Class.label: stimulated Raman gain spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from two lasers ('pump' and 'probe') by a sample is detected. In stimulated Raman gain spectroscopy the probe laser has a lower frequency than the pump laser.

Class.label: stimulated Raman loss spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from two lasers ('pump' and 'probe') by a sample is detected. In stimulated Raman gain spectroscopy the pump laser has a lower frequency than the probe laser.

Class.label: photoacoustic Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light by a sample is detected. Two lasers ('pump and 'probe') are mixed and focused on the sample cell. When the frequency difference between the lasers corresponds to a Raman transition, an acoustic signal (a sound wave produced by an increase in pressure) is generated and detected by a sensitive microphone.

Class.label: ionisation-detected stimulated Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from two lasers ('pump' and 'probe') by a sample is detected. The molecules in the sample are ionised using an ultraviolet laser in order to improve the signal-to-noise ratio of the spectrum.

Class.label: higher-order Raman spectral excitation spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: higher order Raman spectral excitation studies
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from a two-colour laser, by a sample is detected.

Class.label: three-dimensional diffusion-ordered spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the signals of a 2D NMR experiment are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to diffusion coefficient.

Class.label: gas antisolvent technique
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique where a solid sample is first partially dissolved in a organic solvent in a vessel. The solution is then pressurised with a dense gas or supercritical fluid resulting in precipitation of the solid as a fine powder.

Class.label: solution-enhanced dispersion by supercritical fluids
Class.IAO_0000115: A solid sample is dissolved in a common (organic or inorganic) solvent mixed with a supercritical fluid and sprayed into an autoclave (using a nozzle with two or three coaxial channels) resulting in precipitation.
hasExactSynonym: solution enhanced dispersion by supercritical fluids

Class.label: precipitation with compressed antisolvent
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique where a solid sample is dissolved in a common (organic or inorganic) solvent then sprayed into a vessel pressurised with a dense gas (e.g. supercritical CO2) This results in a large decrease in solution density and precipitation.

Class.label: aerosol solvent extraction system
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique where a solid sample is dissolved in a common (organic or inorganic) solvent, mixed with a supercritical fluid and sprayed into an autoclave. This leads to the reduction in solubility of the solid and precipitation.

Class.label: supercritical antisolvent precipitation with enhanced mass transfer
Class.IAO_0000115: A solid sample is dissolved in a common (organic or inorganic) solvent then sprayed into a supercritical fluid (held under pressure) resulting in a large decrease in solution density. This effect leads to the reduction in solubility of the solid and precipitation. A surface vibrating at an ultrasonic frequency is used to atomise the solution jet into microdroplets during spraying, increasing turbulence and mixing (resulting in higher mass transfer and smaller particles).
hasExactSynonym: supercritical anti-solvent precipitation with enhanced mass transfer
supercritical anti-solvent with enhanced mass transfer
supercritical antisolvent with enhanced mass transfer

Class.label: diffusion-ordered spectroscopy-total correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the signals of a 2D TOCSY spectrum are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to diffusion coefficient.

Class.label: diffusion-ordered spectroscopy-correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the signals of a 2D COSY spectrum are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to diffusion coefficient.

Class.label: heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence-diffusion-ordered spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: diffusion-ordered spectroscopy- heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the signals of a 2D HMQC spectrum are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to diffusion coefficient.

Class.label: two-dimensional J-spectroscopy-diffusion-ordered spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of three-dimensional NMR experiment in which the signals of a 2D J-spectrum are dispersed along a third frequency axis according to diffusion coefficient.

Class.label: 29Si solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 29Si nuclei in a solid sample placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: silicon-29 solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
hasExactSynonym: silicon-29 solid-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectra
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for silicon-29 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Class.label: confocal micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by illuminating the specimen with visible light, and passing the light through pinhole before it reaches a system of magnifying lenses. The pinhole allows only light from the focal point to pass to the detector, reducing background interference.

Class.label: flow cytometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a flow cell, a laser and a detector, which detects the fluorescence and light scattering of individual particles (e.g. cells).

Class.label: field-emission scanning electron micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by scanning a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam, produced by thermionic emission heating (field emission), across the specimen under vacuum.

Class.label: visible spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of absorbance vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the amount of radiation absorbed by a sample as a function of the wavelength of incident radiation from the visible region (380--800 nm) range.

Class.label: holographic laser trapping
Class.IAO_0000115: The trapping of microscopic particles by a focused laser beam. The beam is focused through a microscope objective, producing a strong electric field gradient at its narrowest point, which attracts dielectric particles. In holographic laser trapping, computer-generated holograms are used to split single laser beams into multiple beams, creating three-dimensional configurations.

Class.label: laser transient absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where transient species such as radicals, ions or reactive intermediates are studied using laser pulses. The absorbance of the sample before and after an excitation laser pulse is measured.

Class.label: ultra-fast laser spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with one or more laser beams and the absorption or emission of light by the sample is measured in the following fs--ns timescale is measured.

Class.label: time-correlated single photon counting
Class.IAO_0000115: A method that is used to measure the relaxation rate of molecules in fluorescent samples. A laser pulse excites the molecule, and the time taken for it to emit a single photon is measured.

Class.label: enzyme-dependent fluorescence recovery after photobleaching
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the distribution of enzyme activity in a sample by photobleaching a specific fluorescent metabolite during microscopy, and monitoring its enzymatically-driven recovery.
hasExactSynonym: enzyme dependent fluorescence recovery after photobleaching

Class.label: 111Cd nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 111Cd nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 57Fe nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 57Fe nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 17O electron nuclear double resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a microwave frequency pulse is used to saturate the electron resonance transitions in the 17O nuclei of a sample, and a radio frequency pulse is used excite a nuclear transition.

Class.label: 57Fe electron nuclear double resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a microwave frequency pulse is used to saturate the electron resonance transitions in the 57Fe nuclei of a sample, and a radio frequency pulse is used excite a nuclear transition.

Class.label: 95Mo electron nuclear double resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a microwave frequency pulse is used to saturate the electron resonance transitions in the 95Mo nuclei of a sample, and a radio frequency pulse is used excite a nuclear transition.

Class.label: 1H electron nuclear double resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where a microwave frequency pulse is used to saturate the electron resonance transitions in the 1H nuclei of a sample, and a radio frequency pulse is used excite a nuclear transition.

Class.label: 3He nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 3He nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 6Li nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 6Li nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 9Be nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 9Be nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 89Y nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 89Y nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 63Cu nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 63Cu nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 39K nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 39K nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 139La nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 139La nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 127I nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 127I nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 121Sb nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 121Sb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 123Sb nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 123Sb nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 95Mo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 95Mo nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 113Cd nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 113Cd nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 14N electron spin-echo envelope modulation
hasExactSynonym: nitrogen-14 electron spin echo envelope modulation
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of pulsed EPR spectroscopy which is used to observe the electron spin echo in 14N nuclei as a function of the time that separates the pulses causing the echo. This technique is a powerful probe of the radial distribution of magnetic nuclear spins in the environment of the electron spins producing the echo.

Class.label: two-pulse electron spin-echo envelope modulation
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of pulsed EPR spectroscopy which is used to observe the electron spin echo in a paramagnetic system as a function of the time that separates the two pulses causing the echo. This technique is a powerful probe of the radial distribution of magnetic nuclear spins in the environment of the electron spins producing the echo.
hasExactSynonym: two pulse electron spin echo envelope modulation

Class.label: three-pulse electron spin-echo envelope modulation
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of pulsed EPR spectroscopy which is used to observe the electron spin echo in a paramagnetic system as a function of the time that separates the three pulses causing the echo. This technique is a powerful probe of the radial distribution of magnetic nuclear spins in the environment of the electron spins producing the echo.
hasExactSynonym: three pulse electron spin echo envelope modulation

Class.label: non-resonance Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, usually from a laser in the visible, near infrared, or near ultraviolet range by a sample is detected. The energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light does not coincide with an electronic transition in the sample.

Class.label: supercritical carbon dioxide drying
Class.IAO_0000115: The removal of solvent from a sample without passing through the liquid--gas boundary, by immersion in supercritical CO2 and de-pressurisation.

Class.label: aerosol method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for the synthesis of solid particles from an aerosol. The desired solid particles are suspended in a liquid, which is heated to 275--330 deg. C under pressure and passed through an orifice so that an aerosol forms. The particles in the aerosol are polymerised by partial evaporation of the solvent.

Class.label: ethanol extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from any matrix into ethanol.

Class.label: co-assembly
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of two individual components of a sample associating to form a new pattern or structure.

Class.label: holographic optical tweezers
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a laser, a beam splitter, an optical microscope, a condenser and a CCD camera, that is used to manipulate microscopic particles. The beam splitter is used to create multiple laser beams that interfere forming multiple optical traps.

Class.label: adsorption-desorption isotherm
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of relative pressure vs. volume adsorbed obtained by measuring the amount of an inert gasesous or liquid substance (the 'sorbent', usually H2 or N2) which adsorbs onto the surface of interest (the 'sorbate'), and the subsequent amount that desorbs at a constant temperature.

Class.label: nitrogen adsorption-desorption isotherm
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of relative pressure vs. volume adsorbed obtained by measuring the amount of N2 gas that adsorbs onto the surface of interest (the 'sorbate'), and the subsequent amount that desorbs at a constant temperature.

Class.label: profilometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that measures surface profiles by dragging a (diamond) stylus across the sample surface. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the stylus and surface during scanning.

Class.label: atomic mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectrometry where the sample is atomised and converted into gaseous ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: molecular mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectrometry where the sample is converted into gaseous molecular ions, which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: multi-dimensional high-performance liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid, the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high. An initial separation proceeds in a primary column and parts of the eluent from this column are directed into one or more secondary columns.

Class.label: strong-cation-exchange reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid, the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high. An initial separation proceeds in a primary ion-exchange column (the particles of which shows no loss or gain of charge with varying pH) and parts of the eluent from this column are directed into a secondary column where the stationary phase is significantly less polar than the mobile phase.
hasExactSynonym: strong cation exchange  reverse phase  high performance liquid chromatography
strong-cation-exchange reversed phase high-performance liquid chromatography
strong-cation-exchange reversed-phase high pressure liquid chromatography

Class.label: multi-dimensional separation method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method that results in the separation of two or more components along two physical axes.

Class.label: strong-cation-exchange reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the sample is first subjected to two-dimensional high-performance liquid chromatography (passed through two columns in sequence ---a primary ion-exchange column where the particles show no loss or gain of charge with varying pH, and a secondary column where the stationary phase is significantly less polar than the mobile phase). The eluent is then subjected to mass spectrometry where it is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Class.label: multi-dimensional chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A multi-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are all chromatography.

Class.label: two-dimensional separation method-detection method
Class.IAO_0000115: An experiment in which a two-dimensional separation method is coupled to a detection method in order to detect one or more different components of a sample.

Class.label: two-dimensional column chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of chromatography where an initial separation proceeds in a primary column and parts of the eluent from this column are directed into a secondary column.

Class.label: two-dimensional chromatography-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method in which a two-dimensional chromatography method is coupled to mass spectrometry.

Class.label: multi-dimensional electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A multi-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are all electrophoresis.

Class.label: tandem dual-column high-performance liquid chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the sample is first subjected to column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid, the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high. The sample passes through two columns (anion and cation exchange) in series. The eluent is then subjected to mass spectrometry where it is ionised in a plasma which has been generated by electromagnetic induction.

Class.label: two-dimensional liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method in which a two-dimensional chromatography method , where the mobile phase is a liquid, is coupled to mass spectrometry,

Class.label: two-dimensional high-performance liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method in which a two-dimensional chromatography method , where the mobile phase is a liquid and the inlet pressure is relatively high, is coupled to mass spectrometry,

Class.label: strong-cation-exchange reversed-phase high-performance liquid chromatography atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the sample is first subjected to two-dimensional high-performance liquid chromatography (passed through two columns in sequence ---a primary ion-exchange column where the particles show no loss or gain of charge with varying pH, and a secondary column where the stationary phase is significantly less polar than the mobile phase). The eluent is then subjected to mass spectrometry where it is ionised by interaction (electron or proton transfer) with reagent (N2, O2, H2O) gaseous ions at atmospheric pressure. The sample is analysed by two mass spectrometers in series.

Class.label: analytical centrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. During centrifugation the sample can be monitored in real time through an optical detection system or using ultraviolet light absorption.

Class.label: sequential centrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where the components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. The sample is centrifuged in a number of separate, sequential steps.

Class.label: low-speed centrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where the components of a sample  are separated on the basis of their density in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. Samples are spun at <5000 rpm.

Class.label: high-speed centrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. Samples are spun at >5000 rpm.

Class.label: preparative centrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample is purified by removing impurities on the basis of their density in a centrifuge.

Class.label: differential centrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where the components of a cell are separated on the basis of their density in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. The sample is centrifuged in a number of separate, sequential steps; each time the pellet is removed and the speed increased.

Class.label: ultracentrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density in an ultracentrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. Samples are spun at speeds of up to 150,000 rpm.

Class.label: density-gradient centrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density, in a dense medium or density gradient, in a centrifuge, according to the centrifugal force they experience.

Class.label: isopycnic centrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density, in a density gradient of e.g. CsCl in a centrifuge, according to buoyant density. The species in the sample move through the gradient until they reach a point where their density and that of the gradient are identical.

Class.label: rate-zonal centrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the components of a sample are separated on the basis of their density, in a density gradient of e.g. CsCl in a centrifuge, according to mass. The species in the sample move through the gradient until they reach a point where their density and that of the gradient are identical.

Class.label: homogenisation
Class.IAO_0000115: The intensive mixing of mutually insoluble phases (sometimes with addition of surfactants) to obtain a soluble suspension or emulsion.

Class.label: triple quadrupole mass spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that consists of an ion source, a mass-to-charge analyser, a detector and a vacuum system and is used to measure mass spectra. The detector is a linear sequence of three quadrupole mass-to-charge analysers, which hold the ions in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes.

Class.label: atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where the sample is ionised by interaction (electron or proton transfer) with reagent (N2, O2, H2O) gaseous ions at atmospheric pressure.

Class.label: ion-exchange high-performance liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid, the stationary phase consists of very small particles, the inlet pressure is relatively high and the separation is caused by differences in ion-exchange affinity.
hasExactSynonym: ion exchange high performance liquid chromatography

Class.label: tandem dual-column high-performance liquid chromatography atmospheric pressure chemical ionisation tandem mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the sample is first subjected to column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid, the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high. The sample passes through two columns (anion and cation exchange) in series. The eluent is then subjected to mass spectrometry where it is ionised by interaction (electron or proton transfer) with reagent (N2, O2, H2O) gaseous ions at atmospheric pressure, and then analysed by two mass spectrometers in series.

Class.label: nuclear magnetic resonance titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration is monitored by observing the changes in sucessive NMR spectra, taken after each addition of titrant.

Class.label: polarised neutron reflectometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by directing polarised neutrons onto an extremely flat surface and measuring the intensity of the reflected neutrons as a function of angle and neutron wavelength.

Class.label: magnetic contrast neutron reflectometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by directing two beams of polarised neutrons (one spin 'up' and one spin 'down') onto the sample, which contains a ferromagnetic reference layer, and measuring the intensity of the reflected neutrons in the presence of an applied magnetic field.

Class.label: 129Xe Mossbauer spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 129Xe nuclei is detected.

Class.label: 127I Mossbauer spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 127I nuclei is detected.

Class.label: 57Fe Mossbauer spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 57Fe nuclei is detected.

Class.label: 119Sn Mossbauer spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 119Sn nuclei is detected.

Class.label: 121Sb Mossbauer spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 121Sb nuclei is detected.

Class.label: 125Te Mossbauer spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 125Te nuclei is detected.

Class.label: 151Eu Mossbauer spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 151Eu nuclei is detected.

Class.label: 129I Mossbauer spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 129I nuclei is detected.

Class.label: 197Au Mossbauer spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of a gamma-rays beam transmitted through a solid sample containing 197Au nuclei is detected.

Class.label: two-dimensional separation method-measurement method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method in which a two-dimensional separation method is coupled to a measurement method.

Class.label: optical density measurement
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the light transmitted through a sample for a given wavelength.

Class.label: ultrasonic velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity of a sample by measuring the Doppler shift experienced by ultrasound radiation.

Class.label: microwave velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity of a sample by measuring the Doppler shift experienced by microwave radiation. This is the method used by police to measure the speed of a vehicle using a radar gun.

Class.label: optical velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the velocity of a moving object or medium using light.

Class.label: laser Doppler velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity or zeta-potential of a sample by measuring the Doppler shift experienced by light. A laser beam is directed at a series of fine particles in the medium of interest, and the reflected (or Doppler-shifted) beam then produces an interference pattern with a reference beam.

Class.label: ultrasonic speckle velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for measuring the velocity of a sample by detecting and analysing successive ultrasonic speckle signals that result from the interference of backscattered echoes of successive incident pulses of ultrasonic radiation (36 MHz).

Class.label: time-resolved ultrasonic speckle velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for measuring the velocity of a sample by detecting and analysing successive ultrasonic speckle signals that result from the interference of backscattered echoes of successive incident pulses of ultrasonic radiation (36 MHz) as a function of time.

Class.label: nuclear magnetic resonance velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the velocity of a moving object or medium using an NMR signal.

Class.label: spin tagging velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity of a fluid by tagging (presaturating the magnetisation in) a particular group of spins and tracking them in a fluid flow using NMR spectroscopy.
hasExactSynonym: spin tagging nuclear magnetic resonance velocimetry

Class.label: phase-contrast velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity of fluids by using magnetic field gradients to encode velocity information into the phase of an NMR signal.

Class.label: flow-compensated phase-contrast velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity of fluids by using magnetic field gradients to encode velocity information into the phase of the NMR signal. All other contributions to the magnetic gradient phase are set to zero; the only velocity contribution to the phase is due to the flow of the sample ('flow compensation').
hasExactSynonym: flow-compensated phase contrast nuclear magnetic resonance velocimetry

Class.label: laser-induced thermal-acoustic velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity of a sample flow using two coherent intersecting pulsed laser beams to create a density grating in the sample and a third, continuous, laser beam to detect the Doppler shift in the signal.

Class.label: multiple-modulation multiple-echo velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity of fluids by encoding it into an NMR signal. The NMR signal is produced using multiple spin echoes from several radio frequency pulses in the presence of a constant magnetic field gradient.

Class.label: pulsed-field gradient velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity of fluids by using a pulsed-field gradient spin echo sequence to encode the velocity into an NMR signal. Both flow and Brownian motion components of the velocity are measured.
hasExactSynonym: pulsed gradient spin echo NMR velocimetry
pulsed gradient spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance velocimetry

Class.label: laser-induced thermal-acoustic velocimetry with heterodyne detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the velocity of a sample flow using two coherent intersecting pulsed laser beams to create a density grating in the sample and a third, continuous, laser beam to detect the Doppler shift in the signal. Heterodyne signal detection (non-linear mixing with radiation of a reference frequency) is employed to recover the Doppler shift.

Class.label: high-temperature ultrasonic velocimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for detemining the velocity of metallic or semiconductor melts (at ~1000 deg. C) by measuring the Doppler shift experienced by ultrasound radiation.

Class.label: four-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any type of nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy in which four independent frequency dimensions are employed for the correlation and dispersal of signals (by employing three magnetisation transfer steps). Each signal is described by four frequencies, thus effecting the distribution of signals within an axis of cubes.

Class.label: two-dimensional heteronuclear single quantum coherence-nuclear Overhauser effect spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: two-dimensional heteronuclear single quantum coherence nuclear Overhauser effect spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A 2D NMR experiment which correlates the chemical shifts of spatially proximate protons with the chemical shifts of all (of one type of) their covalently bound heteronuclei.

Class.label: two-dimensional heteronuclear single quantum coherence-total correlation spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: two-dimensional heteronuclear single quantum coherence nuclear Overhauser effect spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A 2D NMR experiment which correlates the chemical shifts of all the protons in a spin system with the chemical shifts of all (of one type of) their covalently bound heteronuclei.

Class.label: photon cross correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the size distribution of a sample of small particles in concentrated or opaque solutions by illuminating the sample with two laser beams and cross-correlating the time-dependent fluctuations in the intensity of the scattered light caused by Brownian motion.

Class.label: colloid method
Class.IAO_0000115: Any method for the synthesis or processing of colloids (mixtures where one substance is dispersed evenly throughout another).

Class.label: emulsion method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for dispersing two or more immiscible liquids by shaking, stirring or homogenising the mixture.

Class.label: Pickering emulsion method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for dispersing two or more immiscible liquid by shaking, stirring or homogenising the mixture. The emulsion is stablised by adding finely divided insoluble solid particles (e.g. latex or silica).

Class.label: trituration
Class.IAO_0000115: Purification of crude chemical compounds containing solid impurities where a solvent is chosen in which the desired product is insoluble and the undesired by-products are very soluble (or vice versa). The crude material is washed with the solvent and filtered away, leaving the purified product in solid form and any impurities in solution.

Class.label: variable-angle polarised absorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the absorption of linearly (p-) polarised UV-vis light by a poled thin film sample, as it is rotated about the vertical axis, is recorded at incremental angles of incidence.

Class.label: ratio variable-angle polarised absorption spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: ratio variable angle polarised absorption spectroscopy
ratio variable angle polarized absorption spectroscopy
variable angle polarization referenced absorbtion spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Variable-angle polarised absorption spectroscopy where the angle-independent s-polarisation of the light is also measured as a reference.

Class.label: TE buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution where the pH is maintained by Tris [tris(hydroxymethyl)aminomethane] and EDTA (ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid). TE buffer is used to protect DNA or RNA from degradation.

Class.label: near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of intensity vs. energy obtained by measuring the number and energy of X-rays absorbed by the sample within 40 eV of the absorption edge (the part of the spectrum where the incident X-ray energy matches the binding energy of an electron).
hasExactSynonym: X-ray absorption near edge structure (XANES) spectrum
X-ray absorption near edge structure spectra
X-ray absorption near edge structure spectrum
near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure spectra

Class.label: isothermal titration calorimetry curve
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of energy against time obtained from the measurement of the heat evolved during a chemical or biochemical reaction (such as protein-receptor binding).

Class.label: ultraviolet-visible-near infrared spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that consists of: a light source; a holder for the sample; a diffraction grating or monochromator to separate the different wavelengths of light; a detector, and is used to measure spectra in the range ultraviolet to near-infrared (190-2000 nm) resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Class.label: thermogravimetry curve
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of weight% vs. temperature, usually consisting of a series of steps, obtained by measuring the mass of a sample during heating.

Class.label: 79Br nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 79Br nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 29Si cross-polarisation magic angle spinning
hasExactSynonym: 29Si cross polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
29Si cross polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
29Si cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
29Si cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei, which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples, cause significant line broadening in solid state NMR, but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field). Cross polarisation is used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei such as 29Si nuclei.

Class.label: isothermal calorimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters (e.g. enthalpy) at constant temperature during a chemical or biochemical reaction.

Class.label: isobaric calorimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters (e.g. enthalpy)  at constant pressure during a chemical or biochemical reaction.

Class.label: scanning calorimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of thermodynamic parameters (e.g. enthalpy) during a chemical or biochemical reaction by the known variation (step-wise or linear) of one variable, whilst a second is kept constant.

Class.label: adiabatic scanning calorimetry
