Class.IAO_0000115: A mass detection method where the sample (usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule) is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is held in a matrix (such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid) to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules. The ions are then characterised by two time-of-flight mass-to-charge analysers (where the ions are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured) in sequence. The first isolates precursor ions of choice using a velocity filter, and the second detects the fragment ions.

Class.label: lock-in amplifier
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that can increase the power of a signal with a known carrier wave from an extremely noisy environment. A lock-in amplifier uses a frequency mixer to convert the signal's phase and amplitude into a DC voltage signal.

Class.label: high-resolution magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum in which line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field) and using a high-resolution magnetic susceptibility matching probe.

Class.label: high-resolution electrospray ionisation mass spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of relative abundance (%) vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment , where the ions are obtained by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets. When the ions are analysed using their mass-to-charge ratios the exact mass is determined as opposed to the nominal mass (the number of protons and neutrons).

Class.label: relaxometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of relaxation variables in nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy.

Class.label: electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrically-conducting piece of apparatus that exchanges electrons with an electrolyte as part of an electrical circuit.

Class.label: reference electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode through which no appreciable current is allowed to flow and is used to observe or control the potential at a working electrode.

Class.label: indicator electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode at which the potential is measured.

Class.label: gas electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode that participates in a redox couple where the other partner is a gas.

Class.label: hydrogen gas electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: A reference electrode based on the equilibrium between aqueous protons and electrons on one side and hydrogen gas on the other, in solutions saturated with hydrogen gas. Typically it is made of a thin foil of platinum electrolytically coated with a finely divided deposit of platinum or palladium metal.

Class.label: boundary between portions of material
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional surface that separates two portions of material of different compositions.

Class.label: liquid junction
Class.IAO_0000115: A boundary between two electrolyte solutions of different composition, across which arises a potential difference, called the liquid junction potential. In an operational pH cell, the junction is between the test solution and the filling solution or bridge solution of the reference electrode.

Class.label: electrochemical cell
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus in which a current causes chemical reactions or chemical reactions cause a current to flow.

Class.label: operational pH cell
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrochemical cell which is used for practical pH measurements, consisting of a hydrogen ion-responsive electrode and a reference electrode immersed in the test solution.

Class.label: pH glass electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: A hydrogen-ion-responsive electrode consisting of a piece, usually a bulb, of special glass attached to a stem of high-resistance glass complete with internal reference electrode and internal filling solution system.

Class.label: pH measurement
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of pH, the negative logarithm to base ten of the hydrogen ion activity in a solution. Operationally the pH of a solution X, pH(X), is measured relative to that of a standard reference solution, pH(S), and defined as pH(X) = pH(S) - (E(X) - E(S))/(RT/F)ln 10, where E(X) and E(S) are the electromotive forces measured in cells containing the solution X and the reference solution respectively.

Class.label: pH sensor
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which is used to measure pH.

Class.label: silver/silver chloride reference electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: A reference electrode where the electrochemical reaction is between silver metal and silver(I) chloride.

Class.label: saturated calomel electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: A reference electrode where the electrochemical reaction is between mercury metal and mercury(I) chloride.

Class.label: auxiliary electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode that serves merely to carry the current flowing through an electrochemical cell.

Class.label: gradient-selected correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei that are J-coupled (usually \leq 3 bonds apart). A spatially inhomogeneous magnetic field is applied with a defined gradient and used to either select a particular signal or to render unwanted signals undetectable.

Class.label: gradient-selected heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the nuclei to which they are covalently bound. A spatially inhomogeneous magnetic field is applied with a defined gradient and used to either select a particular signal or to render unwanted signals undetectable.

Class.label: nanoelectrospray ionisation mass spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of relative abundance (%) vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment , where the ions are obtained by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small capillary (at a flow rate of nL min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Class.label: Zimm plot
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot obtained from a scattering experiment on large particles which is used to determine the average molecular weight of the (polymer) sample. The plot typically consists of a grid.

Class.label: scattering data
Class.IAO_0000115: Data which is obtained from a scattering experiment.

Class.label: hollow fibre liquid-phase micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from an aqueous phase to an organic phase immobilised within the pores of the wall of a porous hollow fibre (<10 \mum diameter).

Class.label: continuous flow hollow fibre liquid-phase micro-extraction
hasExactSynonym: continuous flow hollow fiber liquid-phase micro-extraction
continuous flow hollow fiber liquid-phase microextraction
continuous flow hollow fibre liquid-phase micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from an aqueous phase to an organic phase immobilised within the pores of the wall of a porous hollow fibre (<10 \mum diameter).  The aqueous phase is allowed to flow continuously through the fibre, allowing mass transfer to occur.

Class.label: continuous-flow liquid-phase micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: A process for transferring a substance from an aqueous phase to an organic phase (or vice versa) by injecting one phase into a glass chamber using a conventional microsyringe and holding the \muL droplet at the outlet tip of a PTFE connecting tube. The other phase then flows continuously over the droplet, allowing mass transfer to occur.

Class.label: liquid-liquid-liquid micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a microlitre amount of an ionisable substance from an aqueous phase to another aqueous phase, via an organic phase, by performing simultaneous extraction and back-extraction between the phases.

Class.label: static liquid-phase micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from an aqueous phase to an organic phase (or vice versa) by suspending a microlitre-sized drop of the organic phase in a large volume of the aqueous phase.

Class.label: dynamic liquid-phase micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from an aqueous phase to an organic phase (or vice versa) by the repeated movement of a microsyringe.

Class.label: headspace liquid-phase micro-extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from an organic phase to an aqueous phase (or vice versa) by heating the organic sample within a confined space in the presence of an aqueous acceptor droplet suspended on the tip of a microsyringe.

Class.label: potentiometric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the potential difference between indicator and reference electrodes under conditions where the current passed is sufficiently small to maintain thermodynamic equilibrium.

Class.label: electronic tongue
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that measures and compares tastes using a number of discrete sensors; usually one for each of the five taste categories; sourness, saltiness, bitterness, sweetness, and umami.

Class.label: surface-enhanced non-resonance Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from a visible laser, by a sample adsorbed onto a metal (Au, Ag or Cu) surface is detected. The energy of the incoming laser is adjusted such that it or the scattered light does not coincide with an electronic transition within the sample.

Class.label: 109Ag nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 109Ag nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 109Ag cross-polarisation magic angle spinning
hasExactSynonym: 109Ag cross polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
109Ag cross polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
109Ag cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
109Ag cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei, which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples, cause significant line broadening in solid state NMR, but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field). Cross polarisation is used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei such as 109Ag nuclei.

Class.label: 1H--109Ag heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 109Ag nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Class.label: 1H--113Cd heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 113Cd nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Class.label: 113Cd--113Cd correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between 113Cd nuclei that are J-coupled (usually \leq 3 bonds apart).

Class.label: 1H--113Cd heteronuclear correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and 113Cd nuclei.

Class.label: 1H--13C heteronuclear correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and 13C nuclei.

Class.label: 1H--31P heteronuclear correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and 31P nuclei.

Class.label: double-quantum-filtered correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei which are J-coupled (usually \leq 3 bonds apart). The response is edited by selecting only two-spin coupled systems, usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase (direction of application) of the pulses in the experiment.

Class.label: 113Cd--113Cd double-quantum-filtered correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between 113Cd nuclei which are J-coupled (usually \leq 3 bonds apart). The response is edited by selecting only two-spin coupled systems, usually achieved by appropriate cycling of the phase (direction of application) of the pulses in the experiment.

Class.label: dielectrometric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the relative permittivity of the solution as a function of the solution volume.

Class.label: mid-infrared microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The collection of spatially resolved mid-infrared spectra (3--8 \mum) of a sample during microscopy.
hasExactSynonym: mid infra red chemical imaging spectrometry
mid infra red chemical imaging spectroscopy

Class.label: dielectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the relative permittivity of a solution as a function of concentration. Measurements are made indirectly across the resistance of the solution with alternating current.

Class.label: chromatogram
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of detector signal (e.g. ion count or  absorbance) vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment. Different peaks in the chromatogram correspond to different components of the separated mixture.

Class.label: ion chromatogram
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of ion current vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment with mass detection.

Class.label: total ion chromatogram
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of the total ion current vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment with mass detection.  selectivity in the data. The total ion current chromatogram monitors a very large window often of several hundred mass-to-charge units.

Class.label: base peak intensity chromatogram
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of ion current vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment with mass detection. The base peak intensity chromatogram represents the intensity of the most intense peak at any one time.

Class.label: selected ion chromatogram
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of ion current vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment with mass detection. A small mass window is monitored such that the mass chromatogram represents detection of a very specific mass-to-charge ratio.

Class.label: electron ionisation mass spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of relative abundance (%) vs. mass-to-charge ratio obtained from a mass spectrometry experiment where the sample is ionised by electrons (energy 70 eV) which have been emitted from a glowing filament and accelerated through an electric field.

Class.label: ion-selective electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode which responds to the activity of a primary ion in presence of various other (interfering) ions in the sample solution. Ion-selective electrodes contain a selective membrane which contains fixed or mobile sites that interact with ions in solution.

Class.label: dropping mercury electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode formed by a sequence of mercury drops falling from a small aperture.

Class.label: hanging mercury drop electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode formed of a partial mercury drop of controlled geometry and surface area at the end of a capillary.

Class.label: electrostatic detection apparatus
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which is used to detect footwear marks and indented impressions of handwriting in paper. The sample sheet of paper is placed on a sintered copper plate, a vacuum is applied and a thin mylar plastic film is rolled over the sample. An electrostatic charge is then applied to the plastic by means of a corona discharge and the subsequent pattern of charging is then visualised using photocopier toner. The toner adheres to those areas corresponding to indentations.

Class.label: solution-state nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the response of nuclei with non-zero spin, in a sample dissolved in a deuterated solvent,  to a perturbing magnetic field is detected. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: 1H--15N heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 15N nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Class.label: 1H--13C heteronuclear multiple quantum coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between protons and the 13C nuclei to which they are covalently bound.

Class.label: 15N--15N correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between 15N nuclei which are J-coupled (usually \leq 3 bonds apart).

Class.label: normal-phase chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where the components are distributed between two phases, one of which is stationary and polar, while the other is non-polar and moves in a definite direction.

Class.label: elution chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A chromatography method where the stationary bed is within a tube and the mobile phase moves continuously through the column and the analyte is detected as it emerges from the column.

Class.label: partition chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Chromatography in which separation is based mainly on differences between the solubility of the sample components in the stationary phase (gas chromatography), or on differences between the solubilities of the components in the mobile and stationary phases (liquid chromatography)

Class.label: deuterium-decoupled nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of NMR spectroscopy where (J/scalar) couplings to 2H nuclei are cancelled by applying radio frequency radiation to saturate or otherwise manipulate the 2H spins such that no evolution of the coupling occurs.

Class.label: competition dialysis
Class.IAO_0000115: The separation of molecules in solution by the difference in their rates of diffusion through a semipermeable membrane. In competition dialysis an array of nucleic acid structures and sequences is dialysed against a common test ligand solution. After equilibration, the amount of ligand bound to each structure or sequence is determined by absorbance or fluorescence measurements. Since all structures and sequences are in equilibrium with the same free ligand concentration, the amount bound is directly proportional to the ligand binding affinity.

Class.label: fluorescence quenching method
Class.IAO_0000115: Any method that involves observing, or measuring the time take for, loss of fluorescence in a sample.

Class.label: citrate--phosphate buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A phosphate buffer, containing citric acid and sodium phosphate, where the pH is maintained by citrate--citric acid and phosphate--hydrogen phosphate equilibria.

Class.label: spectrophotometric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the absorbance of radiation in the range ultraviolet to near-infrared (0.1--2.5 \mum) by the sample.

Class.label: absorption titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the absorbance of radiation by the sample.

Class.label: ultraviolet titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the absorbance of radiation in the ultraviolet range (190--400 nm) by the sample.

Class.label: absorbance titration curve
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of volume of titrant vs. absorbance obtained from an absorbance titration experiment.

Class.label: ultraviolet melting
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of heating a substance by irradiation with ultraviolet light (190--400 nm) to cause the solid--liquid phase change.

Class.label: cryogenic electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where the specimen, which is cooled in liquid ethane to 180 deg. C, is bombarded with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV under vacuum and the interaction of the electrons with the specimen produces transmitted, secondary, backscattered and diffracted electrons and characteristic X-rays which are detected.

Class.label: scattering spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Any method that measures the amount of light that a substance scatters at certain wavelengths, incident angles, and polarization angles.

Class.label: luminescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of luminescence emitted by molecules excited is detected as a function of wavelength or time.

Class.label: phosphorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The detection of luminescence emitted over a long timescale from a sample, as a result of irradiation with light, as a function of wavelength or time.

Class.label: radio frequency spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy using short pulses of radiation from the radio frequency (MHz) range. Radio frequency spectroscopy is used to probe cold gas atoms and single ions.

Class.label: block copolymer micelle nanolithography
Class.IAO_0000115: A synthesis technique involving the transfer of a nanosized pattern to a material using a micelle solution of a block copolymer. A glass or silicon substrate is dipped into the solution, retrieved, and the solvent is allowed to evaporate in air. A plasma treatment (O2, H2 or Ar) is performed to remove the polymer shell leaving a pattern.

Class.label: one-dimensional proton nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for hydrogen-1 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Class.label: two-dimensional 1H--1H nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for hydrogen-1 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field. Signals are defined in terms of two frequencies; by the chemical shift of a particular nucleus in one dimension and, in the other, by the chemical shift of a correlated nucleus.

Class.label: three-dimensional 1H--1H nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A three-dimensional plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for hydrogen-1 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field. Signals are defined in terms of three frequencies; by the chemical shift of a particular nucleus in one dimension and, in the other two, by the chemical shifts of correlated nuclei.

Class.label: nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A spectrum that shows the response of spin-active nuclei to radio frequency radiation in an applied magnetic field. The resonance frequencies of nuclei approximately 6 \AA apart which are correlated by the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect are plotted with intensities proportional to the populations of nuclei.

Class.label: melting curve
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of signal vs. temperature for a sample that is heated to cause the solid--liquid phase change.

Class.label: ultraviolet melting curve
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of absorbance vs. temperature for a sample that is heated by irradiation with a specific wavelength of ultraviolet light (range 190--400 nm) to cause the solid--liquid phase change.

Class.label: sol--gel template synthesis
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of the settling of (nm sized) particles from a colloidal suspension onto a pre-existing surface, resulting in a ceramic thin film. The desired solid particles (e.g. metal alkoxides) are suspended in a liquid, forming the 'sol', which is deposited on a membrane template or mould by spinning, dipping or coating, The particles in the sol are polymerised by partial evaporation of the solvent, or addition of an initiator, forming the 'gel', which is then heated at high temperature to give the final solid product.

Class.label: galvanostat
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that maintains the current through an electrochemical cell at a preset value.

Class.label: potentiostat
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that maintains the potential through an electrochemical cell at a preset value.

Class.label: quasi-reference electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode based on a ferrocene or cobaltocene redox couple internal standard through which no appreciable current is allowed to flow and is used to observe or control the potential at a working electrode.

Class.label: pseudo-reference electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode through which no appreciable current is allowed to flow and is used to observe or control the potential at a working electrode. A pseudo-reference electrode, such as a Ag wire, fulfils the role of a reference electrode but the electrochemical processes allowing it to do so are not well understood, in contrast to a true reference electrode.

Class.label: UV-assisted capillary force lithography
Class.IAO_0000115: A process for shaping pliable thermoplastic polymers. An elastomeric (polyurethane acrylate) mould is placed on a UV-curable polymer that has been spin- or drop-coated onto a substrate and partially cured using UV light (200--400 nm). The system is then further exposed to UV light and capillary force allows the polymer melt to fill up the void space between the polymer and the mould. After cooling to ambient temperature, the mould is removed, generating the negative replica of the mould pattern.

Class.label: two-step UV-assisted capillary force lithography
Class.IAO_0000115: A process for shaping pliable thermoplastic polymers. An elastomeric (polyurethane acrylate) mould is placed on a UV-curable polymer that has been spin- or drop-coated onto a substrate and partially cured using UV light (200--400 nm). Capillary force allows the polymer melt to fill up the void space between the polymer and the mould, generating a negative replica of the mould pattern. The process is repeated with a second mould and exposure to UV light. Two-step UV-assisted capillary force lithography is used to generate micro/nanoscale combined hierarchical structures.

Class.label: oxygen plasma etching
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of removing a thin layer of a sample surface using short pulses of an oxygen plasma (a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals e.g. O, O+ and O2+).

Class.label: interferometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the properties of two or more lasers or waves by studying the pattern of interference created by their superposition.

Class.label: heterodyne detection
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the intensity of the light resulting from the interference of two lasers of different wavelength.

Class.label: homodyne detection
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the intensity of the light resulting from the interference of two lasers of the same wavelength.

Class.label: optical heterodyne detection
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the intensity of the light resulting from the interference of two lasers of different wavelength at the beat frequency.

Class.label: reflection interference contrast microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115:
Microscopy that determines the specimen's shape and distance away
from a nearby, usually flat, reflective surface from the interference pattern
produced by light reflecting from both the object and the surface. A microscope objective focusses a laser on the fluorescent specimen, and the same objective collects fluorescence. The interference between the fluorescence directly emitted by the specimen and the fluorescence reflected by the surface is observed by measuring the intensity of fluorescence passing through a confocal pinhole.

Class.label: Hank's balanced salt solution
Class.IAO_0000115: A solution, containing CaCl2, KCl, KH2PO4, MgCl2, MgSO4, NaCl, NaHCO3, Na2HPO4, D-glucose and phenol red, that resists changes to its pH.

Class.label: Earle's balanced salt solution
Class.IAO_0000115: A solution, containing CaCl2, MgSO4, KCl, NaHCO3, NaCl, NaH2PO4 and phenol red, that resists changes to its pH.

Class.label: tungsten-187 nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of chemical shift vs. intensity for tungsten-187 nuclei obtained by measuring the effect of the absorption of radio frequency radiation on nuclear spin-state transitions in the presence of a magnetic field.

Class.label: one-dimensional 1H nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 1H nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them, and the spectrum is obtained by plotting chemical shift vs. frequency.

Class.label: two-dimensional 1H nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment in which a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between interacting 1H nuclei.

Class.label: microwave oven
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a high- voltage transformer, a cavity magnetron, a waveguide and a sample chamber, that is used to heat samples by irradiation with microwave (2 GHz) radiation.

Class.label: pump-probe spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with an initial laser pulse (the 'pump') followed by a second laser pulse (the 'probe') after a short delay. The pump pulse creates excitations in the sample, which are sensed by the probe pulse.

Class.label: femtosecond pump--probe spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with an initial laser pulse (the 'pump') followed by a second laser pulse (the 'probe') after a fs delay. The pump pulse creates excitations in the sample, which are sensed by the probe pulse.

Class.label: pump--repump--probe spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with an initial laser pulse (the 'pump') followed by a second pump laser pulse, and finally a third laser pulse (the 'probe') after a short delay. The two pump pulses create excitations in the sample, which are sensed by the probe pulse.

Class.label: pump--dump--probe spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with an initial laser pulse (the 'pump') which causes excitations within the sample. This is followed by a second laser pulse which is tuned to the correct frequency to excite transitions resonantly back down to the lower electronic state (the 'dump'). After a short delay a third laser pulse (the 'probe') is used to sense changes in the sample.

Class.label: 1H correlation spectroscopy spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional spectrum in which the position of a peak, in one dimension, corresponds to the chemical shift of a particular hydrogen nucleus and, in the other dimension, to the chemical shift of a hydrogen nucleus which is J-coupled to the first.

Class.label: correlation spectroscopy spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional spectrum in which the position of a peak, in one dimension, corresponds to the chemical shift of a particular nucleus and, in the other dimension, to the chemical shift of a nucleus which is J-coupled to the first.

Class.label: liquid chromatography at the critical condition
Class.IAO_0000115: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid held at or near its critical point. Liquid chromatography at the critical condition is used to determine functionality distributions in polymers.

Class.label: liquid chromatography at the critical condition-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography, where the liquid is held at or near its critical point, before being converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: liquid chromatography at critical conditions-mass spectrometry

Class.label: liquid chromatography at the critical condition-electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: liquid chromatography at critical conditions-electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography, where the liquid is held at or near its critical point, before being ionised by forcing the solution (usually in an organic solvent) through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets.

Class.label: cold-field-emission scanning electron microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of a specimen by scanning a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam produced  by applying a high voltage to a tungsten crystal (cold-field emission) with an acceleration voltage of 50--150 kV across the specimen under vacuum and measuring interaction of the electrons with the specimen.
hasExactSynonym: cold field emission scanning electron microscope

Class.label: 195Pt nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the energy states of 195Pt nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. Each experiment consists of a sequence of radio frequency pulses with delay periods in between them.

Class.label: null ellipsometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure where the sample is illuminated with light and the ellipsometric angles of the reflected light are measured from the configuration of the analyzer and the compensator for which no reflected light is detected.

Class.label: Kelvin probe force microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. The conducting tip forms a capacitor with the surface, over which it is scanned laterally at a constant separation, in order to map the change in work function of the surface. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Class.label: Kelvin probe method
Class.IAO_0000115:
A measurement method for determining the contact potential difference or difference in work functions between the sample and a reference electrode. In this method, the probe, which is made of
a material with a known work function (commonly tungsten or platinum), is arranged close to the sample surface as a parallel-plate capacitor with a small spacing. The probe is vibrated, causing a change in the capacitance between the electrodes, resulting in a small ac current. The work function difference is measured by applying an opposing external bias voltage such that the ac current is zero.

Class.label: Kelvin force spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where an atomic force microscope is used to measure the force experienced by a sample. A probe, which is made of a material with a known work function (commonly tungsten or platinum), is arranged close to the sample surface as a parallel-plate capacitor with a small spacing. The probe is vibrated, causing a change in the capacitance between the electrodes. A voltage is then applied between the probe and sample until the electric field between them vanishes. The force gradient is proportional to the change in amplitude of the vibration. The distance between the probe and sample is kept constant during the measurement using a feedback loop.

Class.label: Kelvin probe force micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by using a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen, line by line, and recording the difference in work function between the tip and sample as a function of position.

Class.label: two-dimensional capillary electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional separation method where the separation processes are both capillary electrophoresis.

Class.label: liquid chromatography-capillary electrophoresis
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional separation method where the sample is first subjected to liquid chromatography followed by capillary electrophoresis.

Class.label: positive electrospray ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where the sample is either forced through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of positively  charged droplets, or solvent droplets subjected to the same process are directed at the sample.

Class.label: negative electrospray ionisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An ionisation method where the sample is either forced through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of negatively charged droplets, or solvent droplets subjected to the same process are directed at the sample.

Class.label: solvent precipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The sedimentation of a solid material (a 'precipitate') from a liquid solution caused by the addition of an additional different solvent.

Class.label: protein precipitation
Class.IAO_0000115: The sedimentation of a solid protein (a 'precipitate') from an aqueous solution caused by the addition of an organic solvent (e.g. methanol), a polyelectrolyte (e.g. alginate) or a salt (e.g. ammonium sulfate) in a process known as 'salting out'.

Class.label: analyte
Class.IAO_0000115: The component of a system to be analysed.

Class.label: column eluent
Class.IAO_0000115: The liquid or gas entering a chromatographic column and used to effect a separation by elution.

Class.label: bright-field transmission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen is bombarded with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV. under vacuum. The beam of electrons passes directly through an aperture before reaching the specimen. The image results from a weakening of the direct beam by its interaction with the sample.

Class.label: dark-field transmission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen is bombarded with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV. under vacuum. The beam of electrons is scattered or diffracted before reaching the specimen, and the image results from a weakening of the beam by its interaction with the sample.

Class.label: dark-field scanning transmission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum. The beam of electrons is scattered or diffracted before reaching the specimen, and the image results from a weakening of the beam by its interaction with the sample.

Class.label: Knudsen cell
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a crucible (made of pyrolytic boron nitride, quartz, tungsten or graphite), heating filaments, a water cooling system, which is used to measure very low vapor pressures by measuring the mass of vapor which escapes when the vessel contains a liquid in equilibrium with its vapor. It is also used as a source evaporator during crystal growth e.g. during molecular-beam epitaxy.

Class.label: magnetic tweezers
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an electromagnet containing a paramagnetic core material with a tip-shaped end, that is used to trap and manipulate magnetic particles.

Class.label: magnetic trapping
Class.IAO_0000115: The trapping of microscopic particles by a localised magnetic field.

Class.label: wire electrical explosion method
Class.IAO_0000115: A synthesis method for metal nanopowders that consists of passing a pulse of a high-density current (10^4 to 10^6 A/mm^2) through a wire causing the explosive disintegration of the metal (accompanied by a bright flash of light, a shock wave, the dispersion of the metal, and the fast expansion of a mixture of boiling metal droplets and vapour to the surrounding medium) and the production of metal , particles with characteristic sizes of tens of  \mum to a few nm.

Class.label: chromatograph
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a mobile phase supply system, an injection or sampling system, a column, detector and a data acquisition/ processing system, that is used to carry out chromatographic separations.

Class.label: gas chromatograph
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a gas supply system, an injection or sampling system, a column, detector and a data acquisition/ processing system, that is used to carry out chromatographic separations.

Class.label: 13C rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 13C nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period, allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and, thus, yielding distance information.

Class.label: 15N rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 15N nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period, allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and, thus, yielding distance information.

Class.label: 31P rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 31P nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period, allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and, thus, yielding distance information.

Class.label: 19F rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 19F nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period, allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and, thus, yielding distance information.

Class.label: 6Li--1H heteronuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed, based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between 6Li and 1H nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart).

Class.label: 19F--1H heteronuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of heteronuclear NMR spectroscopy where a second frequency dimension is employed, based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between 19F and 1H nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart).

Class.label: 2H pulsed field-gradient spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular 2H nuclei resonances. Additionally, attenuation of signals occurs related to molecular diffusion allowing this technique to be used to determine self-diffusion coefficients.

Class.label: 19F pulsed field-gradient spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular 19F nuclei resonances. Additionally, attenuation of signals occurs related to molecular diffusion allowing this technique to be used to determine self-diffusion coefficients.

Class.label: 1H pulsed field-gradient spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular 1H nuclei resonances. Additionally, attenuation of signals occurs related to molecular diffusion allowing this technique to be used to determine self-diffusion coefficients.

Class.label: 7Li pulsed field-gradient spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular 7Li nuclei resonances. Additionally, attenuation of signals occurs related to molecular diffusion allowing this technique to be used to determine self-diffusion coefficients.

Class.label: 13C pulsed field-gradient spin echo nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An NMR experiment in which pulsed field gradients are applied to a spin echo sequence to cleanly and precisely excite particular 13C nuclei resonances. Additionally, attenuation of signals occurs related to molecular diffusion allowing this technique to be used to determine self-diffusion coefficients.

Class.label: 29Si rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 29Si nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period, allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and, thus, yielding distance information.

Class.label: 19F--29Si rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 19F and 29Si nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period, allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and, thus, yielding distance information.

Class.label: 89Y cross-polarisation magic angle spinning
hasExactSynonym: 89Y cross polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
89Y cross polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
89Y cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
89Y cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of NMR spectroscopy using a solid sample. Anisotropic interactions between nuclei, which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples, cause significant line broadening in solid state NMR, but can be averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field). Cross polarisation is used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei such as 89Y nuclei.

Class.label: 63Cu pulsed electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the response of a 63Cu atom to short (ns) pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field is measured.

Class.label: 65Cu pulsed electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the response of a 65Cu atom to short (ns) pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field is measured.

Class.label: fluorescence titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the intensity/wavelength of fluorescence emitted by the sample.

Class.label: fluorescence titration curve
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of volume of titrant vs. fluorescence intensity obtained from a fluorescence titration experiment.

Class.label: ultraviolet curing
Class.IAO_0000115: A chemical process in which a prepolymer is converted into a polymer and then into a network, upon irradiation with light in the range 190--400 nm.

Class.label: spin-trap electron paramagnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the response of an unstable free radical to short (ns) pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field is measured by first  forming a more stable radical adduct (e.g. a nitroxide radical) with a nitrone or nitroso compound (the 'spin trap').

Class.label: electrophoresis anode buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer that serves as an anode in an electrophoresis experiment.

Class.label: electrophoresis cathode buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer that serves as a cathode in an electrophoresis experiment.

Class.label: running buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer that is used to separate proteins in a gel matrix.

Class.label: Tauc plot
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of ehv vs hv where e is the molar extinction coefficient, that is used to determine the optical gap (or 'Tauc gap') in amorphous thin film materials.

Class.label: diode array detector
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a two-dimensional pattern of diodes and a prism, that is used to detect organic compounds. As the sample passes through a cell or cuvette it is illuminated with light in the region 190--1100 nm and any light transmitted through the sample is dispersed by the prism, so that light of different wavelengths falls on different diodes. The output from the array is used to construct an absorption spectrum that can be compared with standard spectra for identification purposes. Alternatively, a single diode can be used to monitor a specific wavelength at which there is maximum absorption.

Class.label: bioelectrochemical analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: The use of an electrochemical cell to measure a qualitative or quantitative response for a biological system.

Class.label: silicon-29 cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
hasExactSynonym: silicon-29 cross-polarisation magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectra
silicon-29 cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectra
silicon-29 cross-polarization magic angle spinning nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A nuclear magnetic resonance spectrum in which the nuclei of interest are silicon-29 nuclei, line broadening has been averaged to zero by spinning the sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg. with respect to the direction of the magnetic field), and cross polarisation has been used to enhance the signal from weakly coupled nuclei.

Class.label: interrogating electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode whose response indicates the change of some analytical variable.

Class.label: isopycnic gradient ultracentrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the components of a sample (e.g. plasma lipoproteins) are separated on the basis of their density in a centrifuge according to the centrifugal force they experience. A density gradient is established via equilibrium sedimentation (e.g. using caesium ions), and then analyte molecules concentrate as bands where the molecule density matches that of the surrounding solution. Samples are spun at speeds of up to 150,000 rpm.

Class.label: flash photolysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong pulse (the 'pump' pulse) of light from a laser or flash lamp. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The absorption of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals (by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse) to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Class.label: laser flash photolysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong pulse (the 'pump' pulse) of light from a laser. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The absorption of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals (by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse) to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Class.label: nanosecond laser flash photolysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong nanosecond pulse (the 'pump' pulse) of light from a laser. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The absorption of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals (by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse) to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Class.label: picosecond laser flash photolysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong picosecond pulse (the 'pump' pulse) of light from a laser. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The absorption of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals (by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse) to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Class.label: femtosecond laser flash photolysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong femtosecond pulse (the 'pump' pulse) of light from a laser. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The absorption of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals (by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse) to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Class.label: diffuse reflectance laser flash photolysis
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique in which a sample is first excited by a strong pulse (the 'pump' pulse) of light from a laser. This first pulse starts a chemical reaction or leads to an increased population of energy levels other than the ground state within the sample. The diffuse reflectance of light by the sample is recorded within a short time intervals (by a 'test' or 'probe' pulse) to monitor relaxation or reaction processes initiated by the pump pulse.

Class.label: laser Raman spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the Raman scattering of monochromatic light, from a laser in the visible, near infrared, or near ultraviolet range by a sample is detected.

Class.label: near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An imaging technique where soft X-rays (100--1000 eV) are directed at the specimen, and the difference in the X-ray absorption coefficient measured within 40 eV of the absorption edge by different elements (mainly O and C) produces an image.
hasExactSynonym: near edge X-ray absorption fine structure (NEXAFS) microscopy
near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure (NEXAFS) microscopy

Class.label: resonant soft X-ray reflectometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by directing a beam of X-rays at a surface (e.g. a thin film) and measuring the complex index of refraction as a function of incident X-ray energy, near the absorption edge.

Class.label: scanning X-ray microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: An imaging technique where soft X-rays (100--1000 eV) are scanned across a specimen, and the difference in absorption of the X-rays by different elements (mainly O and C) produces an image.

Class.label: two-photon laser scanning microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce (emit energy as visible light) by scanning a solid-state (Ti sapphire) laser spot of specific wavelength over its surface to produce multi-photon fluorescence (i.e. the fluorophore simultaneously absorbs two photons, each one half of the energy required for single-photon excitation).

Class.label: single-photon laser scanning microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce (emit energy as visible light) by scanning a solid-state (Ti sapphire) laser spot of specific wavelength over its surface to produce single-photon fluorescence.

Class.label: atomic absorption spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a light source that emits light at element-specific wavelengths, a sample aspirator, a flame or furnace apparatus for volatilising the sample, and a photon detector, that is used to measure the atomic absorption spectrum of a sample. Atoms in the sample of a specific wavelength will absorb light produced by the lamp before it reaches the detector, and the amount of light absorbed depends on the quantity of the element present in the sample.

Class.label: excitation--emission matrix fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115:
A type of fluorescence spectroscopy where a two-dimensional total fluorescence spectrum is recorded at various excitation
wavelengths.

Class.label: vapour-phase extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of transferring a substance from a vapour to a solid phase by passing the vapour sample through a stationary phase (e.g. silica particles) and then desorbing it using a desorbent or carrier gas.

Class.label: dual-phase extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: An extraction method for soil samples that uses a high-vacuum system to remove liquid and gas from low-permeability or heterogeneous soil. By removing water from the sample (liquid-phase extraction) the water table is lowered exposing the solid sample to vapor-phase extraction.

Class.label: excitation--emission fluorescence spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A 3D plot of excitation wavelength vs. emission wavelength vs. intensity obtained from a fluorescence spectroscopy experiment.

Class.label: transmitted polarising light microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where the specimen placed between two orthogonal polarising filters and illuminated with visible light transmitted from a source on the opposite side of the specimen from the objective.

Class.label: polarising microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an eyepiece, an objective lens, object turret, stage, orthogonal polarising filters and light source, which collects electromagnetic radiation in the visible range.

Class.label: transmitting polarising microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an eyepiece, an objective lens, object turret, stage, orthogonal polarising filters and light source, which collects electromagnetic radiation in the visible range. The specimen is illuminated with visible light transmitted from a source on the opposite side of the specimen from the objective.

Class.label: bright-field microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an eyepiece, an objective lens, a condenser lens, stage, and light source, which collects electromagnetic radiation in the visible range. The specimen is illuminated with visible light transmitted from a source on the opposite side of the specimen from the objective.

Class.label: spray coating
Class.IAO_0000115: The application of a thin cover to sample by converting the coating solution to an aerosol then allowing the droplets to settle on the sample surface under the influence of gravity or using an electrostatic field.

Class.label: constant-rate dip coating
Class.IAO_0000115: The application of a thin cover to sample by immersing it (at constant velocity) in a tank containing coating material, allowing it to remain there for a certain 'dwell time', and removing the piece from the tank ('withdrawal') at a constant velocity.

Class.label: Everhart--Thornley detector
Class.IAO_0000115: A detector used in scanning electron microscopy experiments to detect secondary electrons. The detector consists of a scintillator inside a Faraday cage inside the specimen chamber of the microscope. A low positive voltage is applied to the Faraday cage to attract the relatively low-energy (<50 eV) secondary electrons.

Class.label: gel filtration chromatogram
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of detector signal (e.g. ion count or  absorbance) vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment where the separation is caused by differences in molecular size.

Class.label: second harmonic generation circular dichroism spectroscopy
hasExactSynonym: second harmonic generation circular dichroism spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised light by a sample. Laser light of frequency \nu is converted to light of frequency 2\nu by a non-linear interaction with the sample, and the polarisation of this light (the 'second harmonic') is determined.

Class.label: Karl--Fischer titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining trace amounts of water in a sample by the titration of sulphur dioxide in water using iodine.

Class.label: volumetric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured volumes of a titrant (normally via a burette) until the end-point, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached.

Class.label: coulometric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached. In a coulometric titration the titrant is generated electrochemically by passing a constant current through an electrolyte.

Class.label: parallel ICP-MS and EI-MS detection after GC separation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by gas chromatography before part of the sample is ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction, and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance. Another part of the sample is simultaneously ionised by electrons (energy 70 eV) which have been emitted from a glowing filament and accelerated through an electric field. The ions are then characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: low-temperature gas chromatography-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by low-temperature gas chromatography (-78 deg.C) before being ionised in a plasma (a partially ionised gas---such as Ar---containing free electrons) which has been generated by electromagnetic induction, and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: low temperature gas chromatography (LT-GC) coupled on-line with inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS)
low-temperature gas chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry
low-temperature gas chromatography inductively coupled plasma mass spectroscopy

Class.label: programmed temperature vaporisation
Class.IAO_0000115: A sample preparation method for gas chromatography in which the sample is deposited into the inlet of the chromatograph at a low temperature, then the inlet temperature is rapidly raised to vaporise the desired components and cause their transfer onto the column.

Class.label: high-resolution electrospray ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
hasExactSynonym: high-resolution electrospray ionization time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample is ionised by forcing a solution (usually in an organic solvent) of the sample through a small heated capillary (at a flow rate of 1--10 L min-1) into an electric field to produce a very fine mist of charged droplets, and where sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion and the 'exact' mass of the molecular ions in the sample is determined as opposed to the 'nominal' mass (the number of protons and neutrons).

Class.label: gas chromatography electron ionisation mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by gas chromatography before being ionised by electrons (energy 70 eV) which have been emitted from a glowing filament and accelerated through an electric field. The ions are then characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: incredible natural abundance double quantum transfer experiment
Class.IAO_0000115: A 2D NMR technique which correlates (commonly one-bond) J-coupled homonuclei. In one dimension, the signals appear at the chemical shift of a particular nucleus and in the other dimension, at a position which is the sum of the frequencies of that nucleus and its J-coupled partner.

Class.label: 13C incredible natural abundance double quantum transfer experiment
Class.IAO_0000115: A 2D NMR technique which correlates (commonly one-bond) J-coupled 13C nuclei. In one dimension, the signals appear at the chemical shift of a particular nucleus and in the other dimension, at a position which is the sum of the frequencies of that nucleus and its J-coupled partner.

Class.label: statistical total correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy which reveal correlations between all nuclei of a spin-system. This technique exploits the correlations seen between the intensities of spectral features of multiple spectra so as to obtain a statistically derived spectrum. This technique is of particular value for metabolic profiling.

Class.label: Carr-Purcell-Meiboom-Gill spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of the nuclear magnetic resonance frequency vs. intensity composed of a series of peaks (separated by the reciprocal of a user-defined time delay in a CPMG pulse sequence) which describe the envelope of the full, static spectrum.

Class.label: J-spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A two-dimensional NMR spectrum where signals are defined in terms of two frequencies; by the chemical shift of a particular nucleus in one dimension and, in the other, by the J-multiplets of correlated nuclei.

Class.label: polymer preparation method
Class.IAO_0000115: Any experimental method used to prepare polymer samples.

Class.label: miniemulsion polymerisation
Class.IAO_0000115: A polymer preparation technique in which monomer (usually acrylic) 50--500 nm droplets are dispersed in a continuous aqueous phase and are kept colloidally stable through the use of a surfactant and are stablised against Ostwald ripening using a costabiliser such as hexadecane.

Class.label: emulsion polymerisation
Class.IAO_0000115: A polymer preparation technique in which monomer (usually acrylic) droplets are dispersed in a continuous aqueous phase and are kept colloidally stable through the use of a surfactant.

Class.label: microemulsion polymerisation
Class.IAO_0000115: A polymer preparation technique in which monomer (usually acrylic) <100 nm droplets are dispersed in a continuous aqueous phase and are kept colloidally stable through the use of a surfactant and a cosurfactant e.g. hexanol.

Class.label: pulsed laser polymerisation
Class.IAO_0000115: A polymerisation which is initiated by laser pulses at a constant repetition rate.

Class.label: scanning photocurrent microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where a laser is scanned over the surface of the specimen and the photocurrent is recorded as a function of position.

Class.label: reverse micelle polymerisation
Class.IAO_0000115: A polymerisation process where the hydrophilic monomer is solubilised inside surfactant reverse micelle structures.

Class.label: triple-resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115:
MERGED DEFINITION:
TARGET DEFINITION: A type of NMR experiment in which excitation of the spin states of three different types of nuclei (1H, 13C and 15N) is employed.
--------------------
SOURCE DEFINITION: A type of NMR experiment in which excitation of the spin states of three different types of nuclei (usually 1H, 13C and 15N) is employed. The name of the experiment describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.
hasExactSynonym: triple resonance nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy

Class.label: HNCO
Class.IAO_0000115:
MERGED DEFINITION:
TARGET DEFINITION: A triple-resonance NMR experiment used in to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a (isotopically enriched) protein. The chemical shift of the (backbone) amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and the carbonyl carbon of the preceding residue.
--------------------
SOURCE DEFINITION: A triple resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a (isotopically enriched) protein. The chemical shift of the (backbone) amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and the carbonyl carbon of the preceding residue. The name of the method describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.

Class.label: HNCA
Class.IAO_0000115: A triple-resonance NMR experiment used in to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a (isotopically enriched) protein. The chemical shift of the (backbone) amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and the alpha carbons of the same and preceding residues.

Class.label: HNCOCA
Class.IAO_0000115:
MERGED DEFINITION:
TARGET DEFINITION: A triple-resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a (isotopically enriched) protein. The chemical shift of the (backbone) amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and the alpha-carbon of the preceding residue.
--------------------
SOURCE DEFINITION: A triple resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a (isotopically enriched) protein. The chemical shift of the (backbone) amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and the \alpha-carbon of the preceding residue. The name of the method describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.

Class.label: three-dimensional nuclear Overhauser spectroscopy-heteronuclear single quantum coherence
Class.IAO_0000115: A 3D NMR experiment in which the chemical shifts of protons are correlated with the chemical shifts of spatially proximate protons (<6\\A) and with the shifts of the heteronuclei bound to these proximate protons.

Class.label: HCC(CO)NNH
Class.IAO_0000115: A triple-resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a (isotopically enriched) protein. The chemical shift of the (backbone) amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and with both the alpha- and beta-carbons and protons of the preceding residue. The experiment name describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.

Class.label: heteronuclear single quantum coherence-nuclear Overhauser spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A 3D NMR experiment in which the chemical shifts of protons are correlated with the chemical shifts their covalently-bound heteronuclei and with the shifts of spatially proximate protons (<6\\A).

Class.label: nuclear Overhauser effect difference spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A 1D NMR experiment in which a 1D spectrum is subtracted from a spectrum acquired under steady-state NOE conditions.

Class.label: HN(CO)CAHA
Class.IAO_0000115: A triple-resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a (isotopically enriched) protein. The chemical shift of the (backbone) amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and with the alpha-carbon and proton of the preceding residue. The experiment name describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.

Class.label: HCANNH
Class.IAO_0000115: A triple-resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a (isotopically enriched) protein. The chemical shift of the (backbone) amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and with the alpha-carbon and proton of the same residue. The experiment name describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.

Class.label: HNCAHA
Class.IAO_0000115: A triple-resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a (isotopically enriched) protein. The chemical shift of the (backbone) amide proton is correlated with the chemical shift of the covalently bound nitrogen and the alpha-carbon and proton of the same residue. The experiment name describes the path taken by the magnetisation during the experiment.

Class.label: four-dimensional HCCH-total correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A 4D triple-resonance NMR experiment used to determine the chemical shifts of nuclei in a (isotopically enriched) protein. The chemical shifts of the protons of a sidechain are correlated with their covalently bound 13C nuclei and with the other protons of the side-chain.

Class.label: gradient 13C--13C 1H--1H nuclear Overhauser spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A 4D NMR experiment which correlates the chemical shifts of carbon-bound protons with those of their bonded 13C nuclei and with the chemical shifts of spatially proximate carbon-bound protons (<6\\A) and their associated 13C nuclei. Pulsed field gradients are employed to improve the appearance of the spectrum.

Class.label: 13C--13C edited 1H--1H nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A 4D NMR experiment which correlates the chemical shifts of carbon-bound protons with those of their bonded 13C nuclei and with the chemical shifts of spatially proximate carbon-bound protons (<6\\A) and their associated 13C nuclei.

Class.label: 13C--15N edited 1H--1H nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A 4D NMR experiment which correlates the chemical shifts of carbon-bound protons with those of their associated 13C nuclei and with the chemical shift of spatially proximate amide protons (<6\\A) and the 15N nuclei to which these are bound.

Class.label: Sievert's apparatus
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a gas manifold with a series of tubes and valves connecting the sample chamber to one or more pressure reservoirs of known volume, used for measuring the thermodynamics of hydrogen sorption onto metal samples.

Class.label: gel filtration chromatograph
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an eluent supply system, an injection or sampling system, a column containing a swollen gel, a detector and a data acquisition/ processing system, that is used to carry out chromatographic separations.

Class.label: Schlenk tube
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus used as a reaction vessel in air-sensitive chemistry. It is made of glass and has a side arm fitted with a PTFE or ground glass stopcock which allows the vessel to be evacuated or filled with gas (e.g. nitrogen or argon).

Class.label: size-exclusion chromatogram
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of detector signal (e.g. ion count or  absorbance) vs. retention time obtained from a chromatography experiment where the separation is caused by exclusion effects within the stationary phase and where the stationary phase is a swollen gel.

Class.label: polarising light micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by placing the specimen between two orthogonal polarising filters, illuminating it with visible light, and using a system of magnifying lenses.

Class.label: sodium acetate buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution in which the pH is maintained by an acetic acid--sodium acetate equilibrium.

Class.label: emission titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the intensity/wavelength of radiation emitted by the sample.

Class.label: circular dichroism titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by adding measured increments of a titrant until the end-point, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached. The titration is followed by measuring the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised light by the sample.

Class.label: electrospray ionisation source
Class.IAO_0000115: An ion source that consists of a syringe pump, a needle, a power source and a counter electrode (or 'cone') that is used to ionise samples for mass spectrometry.

Class.label: autosampler
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a rotating circular tray containing a number of sealed vials, that is used for the automatic injection of samples during a mass spectrometry experiment.

Class.label: colorimetric test
Class.IAO_0000115: A test which produces colour change in the sample.

Class.label: Fmoc test
Class.IAO_0000115: A colorimetric test which consists of coupling an Fmoc (9H-fluoren-9-yl-methoxycarbonyl )-protected amino acid and measuring the UV absorbance of the sample after deprotection using 20% piperidine in DMF.

Class.label: flash chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of column chromatography where 0.1-10 g of sample mixture is separated in less than 15 min by using pressurised gas to drive the mobile phase through the column.
