Class.label: nitrogen sorption-desorption measurements
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining surface area by measuring the amount of an N2 which adsorbs onto the surface of interest (the 'sorbate'), and the subsequent amount that desorbs at a constant temperature. Regression analysis is then applied to the data, resulting in an isotherm.

Class.label: ultraviolet detector
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a light source, a phototelectric cell, a diffraction grating or monochromator to separate the different wavelengths of light, which is used to detect the absorbance of ultraviolet (190--400 nm) light by molecules in a sample separated by chromatography.

Class.label: refractive index detector
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a light source, a hollow prism and a photoelectric cell that is used to detect non-ultraviolet-absorbing molecules in a sample separated by chromatography. Light from the sample passes through a flow cell with two channels towards the photoelectric cell. One channel holds the eluent from the column, whereas the other holds a control sample (solvent that has not passed through the column).  Detection occurs when the light is bent due to molecules eluting from the column, and this is read as a disparity between the two channels.

Class.label: melt extrusion
Class.IAO_0000115: A process used to create objects of a fixed cross-sectional profile by forcing or drawing a molten polymer through a die.

Class.label: colloidal crystal templating
Class.IAO_0000115: A synthesis method in which polymer spheres are assembled into a colloidal crystal on a substrate by evaporation induced self-assembly. The free spaces between the spheres are subsequently infiltrated with a metal by electrodeposition, and the colloidal particles are selectively removed by dissolution in a solvent (e.g. toluene) leaving behind a periodic arrangement of spherical voids embedded in a solid macroporous matrix.

Class.label: saturated mercury sulfate electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: A reference electrode where the electrochemical reaction is between mercury metal and mercury(II) sulfate.

Class.label: cryogenic scanning electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV is scanned across an electron transparent specimen under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured. Microscopy where a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV is scanned across the specimen, which is cooled in liquid ethane to 180 deg. C, under vacuum and the interaction of the electrons with the specimen is determined.

Class.label: visible spectrophotometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the visible region (380--800 nm) resulting in electronic transitions within the sample.

Class.label: scanning mobility particle sizer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that measures the size distribution of particles in an aerosol by neutralising the particles, passing them through a differential mobility analyser in order to control the size of the particles and then counting the particles of that size with a condensation particle counter.

Class.label: carbon electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode that consists of a sample of granular carbon material that has been bound with pitch and has been fired at high temperature.

Class.label: graphite electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: A carbon electrode that has been fired at a temperature around 2800 K, resulting in a largely graphitic composition.

Class.label: bulb-to-bulb distillation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture under reduced pressure. As a small quantity of the sample mixture is heated using several glass bulbs connected in line, its vapours rise a short distance into a vertical condenser where they are cooled by dry ice in acetone (-78 deg.C).

Class.label: cacodylate buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution in which the pH (6.4--7.4) is maintained by an cacodylic acid--cacodylate equilibrium.

Class.label: sodium cacodylate buffer
Class.IAO_0000115: A buffer solution in which the pH (6.4--7.4) is maintained by an cacodylic acid-- sodium cacodylate [Na(CH3)2 AsO2] equilibrium.

Class.label: negative-staining transmission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen, that has been stained with heavy metals salts (e.g. uranyl acetate), is bombarded with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Class.label: glow discharge synthesis
Class.IAO_0000115: A synthesis method where an electrical discharge is passed under reduced pressure between two electrodes.

Class.label: double-cathode glow discharge synthesis
Class.IAO_0000115: A synthesis method where an electrical discharge is passed under reduced pressure between two cathodes. One cathode is the source (or target) composed of the elements required to prepare the sample via sputtering, and the other cathode is the substrate material. When two different (negative) voltages are applied to the two cathodes, glow discharge occurs, causing a build up of the sample on the substrate cathode.

Class.label: amplitude-modulation atomic force microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. The tip oscillates, intermittently touching or tapping the surface. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen, line by line, and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between oscillation amplitude or phase of the tip and the surface during scanning, which is performed under ultra-high vacuum conditions.

Class.label: confocal laser scanning micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by scanning a gas (Ar or Kr) laser spot of specific wavelength over the specimen and collecting the light emitted by chromophores in the specimen (fluorescence) using a system of magnifying lenses. The fluorescence passes through a pinhole before it reaches the lenses, allowing only light from the focal point to pass to the detector, reducing background interference.

Class.label: photocurrent spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where light energy absorbed by the sample results in the production of a current (the 'photocurrent') which is measured at different spectral intervals.

Class.label: intensity-modulated photocurrent spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where light energy (from a fluctuating light source) absorbed by the sample results in the production of a current (the 'photocurrent') which is measured at different spectral intervals as a function of the modulation frequency of the light source.

Class.label: photovoltage spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where light energy absorbed by the sample results in the production of a potential difference (the 'photovoltage') which is measured at different spectral intervals.

Class.label: intensity-modulated photovoltage spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where light energy (from a fluctuating light source) absorbed by the sample results in the production of a potential difference (the 'photovoltage') which is measured at different spectral intervals as a function of the modulation frequency of the light source.

Class.label: suspension polymerisation
Class.IAO_0000115: Any experimental method used to prepare polymer samples where the monomer is suspended as liquid droplets in a continuous water phase by means of strong agitation and the presence of a suspending agent.

Class.label: micromanipulator
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which is used to physically interact with a sample under a microscope.

Class.label: piezo-driven micromanipulator
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which is used to physically interact with a sample under a microscope, and is driven by the application of an alternating current to a piezoelectric material.

Class.label: graphitisation
Class.IAO_0000115: The conversion of an organic material in an inert atmosphere at temperatures in excess of 1800 deg. C to produce a graphite crystal structure.

Class.label: transmission electron microscope grid
Class.IAO_0000115: A thin film of micrometre thickness which is used as a support for specimens during transmission electron microscopy.

Class.label: field-emission transmission electron microscopy
hasExactSynonym: field emission gun transmission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen is bombarded with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam produced by thermionic emission heating (field emission) and with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Class.label: fluorescence-detected circular dichrosim spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of ellipticity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised luminescence.

Class.label: aberration-corrected transmission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured. The electron beam is focused using a set of magnetic lenses which removes spherical aberration (an effect where the electron beam is deflected too strongly, described by the spherical aberration coefficient 'Cs', which results in a blurred image).

Class.label: weak-beam dark-field electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where the specimen is bombarded with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV under vacuum. The interaction of the electrons with the specimen produces transmitted, secondary, backscattered and diffracted electrons and characteristic X-rays which are detected. A diffracted beam harmonic  (a 'weak beam') is used rather than the diffracted beam itself, allowing much higher resolution to be obtained.
hasExactSynonym: weak beam dark field electron microscopy

Class.label: weak-beam dark-field transmission electron microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where an electron-transparent specimen is bombarded with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage 50--150 kV under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured. A diffracted beam harmonic (a 'weak beam') is used rather than the diffracted beam itself, allowing much higher resolution to be obtained.
hasExactSynonym: weak beam dark field transmission electron microscopy

Class.label: weak-beam dark-field transmission electron micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the transmitted electrons. A diffracted beam harmonic (a 'weak beam') is used rather than the diffracted beam itself, allowing much higher resolution to be obtained.
hasExactSynonym: weak beam dark field electron micrograph

Class.label: X-ray photon correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining the size distribution of a sample of small particles in solution by bombarding the sample with coherent X-rays and measuring the time-dependent fluctuations in the intensity of the scattered X-rays caused by Brownian motion.

Class.label: aberration-corrected transmission electron micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the transmitted electrons. The electron beam is focused using a set of magnetic lenses which removes spherical aberration (an effect where the electron beam is deflected too strongly, described by the spherical aberration coefficient 'Cs', which results in a blurred image).

Class.label: high-angular annular dark-field scanning transmission electron micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by scanning the specimen with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the transmitted electrons. The beam of electrons is scattered or diffracted at high angles before reaching the specimen, and the image results from a weakening of the beam by its interaction with the sample. An annular aperture is used to select electrons that have passed through given symmetric zones within the objective lens of the microscope.
hasExactSynonym: high angle annular dark field scanning transmission electron micrograph
high angular annular dark-field scanning transmission electron micrograph
high-angle annular dark-field scanning transmission electron micrograph

Class.label: high-resolution scanning electron micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by scanning a finely  focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam across the specimen under vacuum. The specimen is tilted such that a low-order zone axis is closely parallel to the incident beam, and columns of atoms are viewed end-on by the beam.

Class.label: diffuse reflectance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of reflectance (%) vs. wavenumber obtained by measuring the amount of radiation reflected from an uneven surface at a number of angles by the sample.

Class.label: X-band electron spin resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to short (ns) pulses of microwave radiation in a magnetic field is measured. The microwave radiation used has an approximate frequency of 9 GHz, known as the 'X-band'.

Class.label: X-band electron spin resonance spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of intensity vs. magnetic field strength obtained by measuring the absorption of radiation due to spin-state transitions of unpaired electrons against a perturbing magnetic field, in the presence of fixed-frequency microwave radiation of approximate frequency 9 GHz (known as the 'X-band').

Class.label: particle-beam/hollow-cathode atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a glow discharge (a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas) is used to excite the sample. A nebuliser is used to generate a finely dispersed aerosol containing the sample, which is desolvated, and a momentum separator is used to inject dry particles of the analyte (the 'particle beam') into the plasma source (which consists of a hollow cylindrical metal cathode containing the metal for excitation, and an anode).
hasExactSynonym: particle beam/hollow cathode atomic emission spectroscopy
particle beam/hollow cathode optical emission spectroscopy

Class.label: hollow-cathode atomic emission spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of atomic emission spectrometry where a glow discharge (a potential difference applied across two electrodes immersed in the sample gas) is used to excite the sample. The plasma source contains a hollow cylindrical metal cathode containing the metal for excitation, and an anode.
hasExactSynonym: hollow cathode glow discharge atomic emission spectrometry
hollow cathode glow discharge atomic emission spectroscopy
hollow cathode glow discharge optical emission spectrometry
hollow-cathode glow discharge atomic emission spectrometry
hollow-cathode glow discharge atomic emission spectroscopy
hollow-cathode glow discharge optical emission spectroscopy

Class.label: infrared--visible sum-frequency generation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for generating surface-specific vibrational spectra by mixing two light beams (visible and IR) at a surface and detecting the output beam, which has frequency equal to the sum of the two input frequencies.

Class.label: sum-frequency generation spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of sum-frequency intensity vs. wavelength (or wavenumber) obtained by mixing two light beams at a surface and detecting the output beam, which has frequency equal to the sum of the two input frequencies.

Class.label: Brust method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for synthesising gold nanoparticles from HAuCl4 in non-aqueous solution (e.g. toluene) using tetraoctylammonium bromide as a phase-transfer catalyst and sodium borohydride to reduce Au(III) to Au(0).

Class.label: anomalous wide-angle X-ray scattering
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining structure by measuring the change in direction or energy of X-rays scattered by a sample at wide angles (>10 deg.). The wavelength of the X-rays used is scanned over an absorption edge which changes the scattering in a known way (the 'anomalous dispersion effect').

Class.label: rotating-disk voltammetry
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrochemical technique where the cell current is measured as a function of time and as a function of the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes. The indicator electrode (e.g. a Pt disc of 1.0 mm diameter sealed in a Teflon carrier ) spins at high speed during the experiment, and the rotational motion sets up a well-defined flow of analyte towards its surface.
hasExactSynonym: voltammetry with a rotating disk electrode

Class.label: rotating-disk electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of working electrode which usually consists of a Pt disc (diameter 1.0 mm) sealed in a Teflon carrier which rotates a high speed during the experiment. Rotating-disk electrodes are used to investigate reaction mechanisms.

Class.label: hydrodynamic voltammogram
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of cell current vs. the potential between the indicator and reference electrodes obtained from a voltammetry experiment during which convective mass transfer (the movement of material by the action of a fluid) occurs.

Class.label: azeotropic distillation
Class.IAO_0000115: A method of separating mixtures based on differences in their volatilities in a boiling liquid mixture. An azeotrope (a mixture of two or more liquids which produces vapor with the same ratio of constituents as the original mixture) cannot be separated by normal distillation, therefore an additional third component (known as an 'entrainer') is added to the mixture. This has the effect of changing the volatility of one of liquids in the azeotrope to a greater extent than the other, allowing separation to occur.

Class.label: magnetometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus used to measure the strength and/or direction of a magnetic field.

Class.label: superconducting quantum interference device
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of superconducting loops containing Josephson junctions, which is used to measure the strength and/or direction of an extremely weak magnetic field (10-18 T).

Class.label: surface-initiated polymerisation
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental method used to prepare polymer samples (e.g. polymer brushes) using a surface-imobilised monomer.

Class.label: electrostatic force microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. A bias voltage is applied between the tip and sample, forming a capacitor with the sample surface, over which it is scanned laterally at a constant separation. The electrostatic force (measured as the change in resonant frequency of the cantilever) is probed as a function of position by changing the applied voltage.

Class.label: micro-Raman spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of intensity vs. Raman shift (cm-1) obtained by measuring the Raman scattering of monochromatic light from a micrometre-sized area of a sample, located using an optical microscope.

Class.label: thermal desorption-gas chromatography mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first adsorbed onto packed tubes (e.g. Tenax) then moved into a desorption oven and heated (100--280 deg. C for 5--20 min) to promote thermal desorption of the mixture into the headspace of the tube. The headspace is sampled and used for gas chromatography and the eluent is then ionised and characterised according to mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: thermal desorption gas chromatography mass spectrometry

Class.label: electrostatic force microscopy image
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by using a conducting sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen, line by line, and recording the drop in amplitude of the oscillating cantilever caused by the electrostatic force it experiences while the tip is biased with a voltage of a few volts, as a function of position.

Class.label: dilatometry
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement and study of dimensional changes in polymers as a function of temperature, fluid absorption, mechanical stress or chemical reaction.

Class.label: Ragone plot
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of specific energy of an electrochemical cell vs. its specific power.

Class.label: dispersion polymerisation
Class.IAO_0000115: A polymer preparation technique in which an insoluble polymer is dispersed in a continuous organic phase.

Class.label: distillation precipitation copolymerisation
Class.IAO_0000115: A polymer preparation technique in which two different types of monomer are dissolved in an organic solvent and distilled until a precipitate of the corresponding copolymer is formed.

Class.label: Walden plot
Class.IAO_0000115: A log--log plot of molar conductivity (\Lambda) vs. viscosity (\eta) which indicates the degree of ionicity of an ionic liquid. Plots are compared to the 'ideal' case of 0.01M KCl which exists as dissociated ions.

Class.label: X-ray spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus used to measure the absorption or emission of X-rays.

Class.label: X-ray photoelectron spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an X-ray source, an analyser and a detector, which is used to measure the photoelectron emission of samples bombarded with X-rays.

Class.label: scanning transmission electron microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A transmission electron microscope where the electron beam is scanned across an electron-transparent specimen under vacuum and the intensities of the transmitted electrons are measured.

Class.label: positive ion matrix-assisted laser desorption--ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the sample (usually a large organic molecule or biomolecule) is vaporised and ionised using a high-energy pulsed laser. The sample is held in a matrix (such as crystallised dihydrobenzoic acid) to protect it from direct laser illumination and to separate the sample molecules. The positive sample ions are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured. This time is dependent on the mass-to-charge ratio of the ion.
hasExactSynonym: positive ion matrix assisted laser desorption ionisation time of flight mass spectrometry
positive ion matrix assisted laser desorption ionisation time of flight mass spectroscopy
positive ion matrix assisted laser desorption ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
positive ion matrix assisted laser desorption ionization time of flight mass spectrometry
positive ion matrix assisted laser desorption ionization time of flight mass spectroscopy
positive ion matrix assisted laser desorption/ionisation time of flight mass spectrometry
positive ion matrix assisted laser desorption/ionisation time of flight mass spectroscopy
positive ion matrix assisted laser desorption/ionization time of flight mass spectrometry
positive ion matrix assisted laser desorption/ionization time of flight mass spectroscopy
positive ion matrix-assisted laser desorption ionization (MALDI-TOF) mass spectrometry (MS)
positive ion matrix-assisted laser desorption-ionisation time-of-flight mass spectrometry
positive ion matrix-associated laser desorption/ionization-time of flight mass spectrometry

Class.label: thermogravimetry-differential thermal analysis
hasExactSynonym: differential thermal analysis and thermal gravimetry analysis
thermogravimetry coupled to differential thermal analysis
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the temperature difference between the sample and a reference material during the measurement of the mass of the sample as a function of temperature.

Class.label: chemical vapour transport
Class.IAO_0000115: A crystal growth method for metal dichalcogenides in which the starting materials (high purity metal and chalcogen) are placed in a quartz ampoule together with a transport agent (e.g. iodine) and heated in a furnace under a temperature gradient.

Class.label: surface-assisted chemical vapour transport
Class.IAO_0000115: A crystal growth method for metal dichalcogenides in which the starting materials (high-purity metal and chalcogen powders) are placed in one half of a quartz ampoule together with a transport agent (e.g. iodine) and heated in a furnace under a temperature gradient. The product crystals are grown on the surface of a sheet of high-purity metal in the other half of the ampoule.

Class.label: bright-field transmission electron micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the directly transmitted electrons.

Class.label: dark-field transmission electron micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by bombarding the specimen with a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam under vacuum and measuring the intensities of the scattered transmitted electrons.

Class.label: environmental scanning electron microscope
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus which is used to produce an enlarged image of a specimen by scanning a finely focused (<10 nm diameter) electron beam with an acceleration voltage of 50--150 kV across the specimen in a gaseous environment and measuring interaction of the electrons with the specimen.

Class.label: ion trap mass spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that consists of an ion source, a mass-to-charge analyser, a detector and a vacuum system and is used to measure mass spectra. The detector is an ion trap mass-to-charge analyser, which holds the ions in a stable orbit by an electric field.

Class.label: linear quadrupole ion trap Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that consists of an ion source, a mass-to-charge analyser, a detector and a vacuum system and is used to measure mass spectra. The analyser consists of a linear quadrupole mass-to-charge analyser, which holds the ions in a stable orbit using an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes, and an ion cyclotron resonance cell (a piece of apparatus that measures the frequency at which ions precesses in a fixed magnetic field and subjects the frequency output to a Fourier transform).

Class.label: linear quadrupole mass spectrometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A mass spectrometer that uses an orthogonal-acceleration ion source. The detector is a quadrupole mass-to-charge analyser, which holds the ions in a stable orbit using an electric field generated by four linear parallel electrodes.
Class.hasExactSynonym: linear quadrupole ion trap mass spectrometer

Class.label: chemical force microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy which uses a chemically functionalised sharp spike (e.g. with thiols) mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen, line by line, and recording the chemical interactions between the tip and surface (e.g. gold) as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Class.label: atomic force infrared microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The simultaneous collection of AFM topography data and spatially-resolved IR spectra by measuring the IR absorption via transient deformation of the AFM cantilever induced by an infrared pulsed laser (tuned to a wavelength that corresponds to a vibrational absorbing wavelength in the specimen) as a function of AFM tip position.

Class.label: scattering near-field optical microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where a probe consisting of a laser transmitted through a tapered optical fibre is positioned very close to (<10 nm from) the surface of the specimen and focused to a diffraction-limited spot size. A vibrating metallic AFM cantilever tip periodically and locally modifies the electromagnetic field distribution of the excitation laser. An image is produced by scanning the probe over the specimen and detecting the scattered light from the tip as a function of position. A force feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Class.label: infrared scattering near-field optical microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where a probe consisting of an infrared laser transmitted through a tapered optical fibre is positioned very close to (<10 nm from) the surface of the specimen and focused to a diffraction-limited spot size. A vibrating metallic AFM cantilever tip periodically and locally modifies the electromagnetic field distribution of the excitation laser. An image is produced by scanning the probe over the specimen and detecting the scattered light from the tip as a function of position. A force feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Class.label: backscattering near-field optical microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where a laser is focused to a diffraction-limited spot size onto an oscillating AFM tip close to the surface of the specimen. An image is produced by scanning the probe over the specimen and detecting the backscattered light from the tip as a function of position. A force feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the probe and surface during scanning.

Class.label: photothermal infrared microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of the photothermal response (temperature fluctuations) of a specimen exposed to the beam of a Fourier transform infrared spectrometer, using an atomic force microscope tip as the thermal probe.

Class.label: standard atomic force infrared microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The simultaneous collection of AFM topography data and spatially-resolved infrared spectra by measuring the infrared absorption via transient deformation of the AFM cantilever induced by an infrared pulsed laser (tuned to a wavelength that corresponds to a vibrational absorbing wavelength in the specimen) as a function of AFM tip position. The specimen is deposited on an ATR-compatible ZnSe prism and infrared light is introduced into the prism at an angle exceeding the critical angle for internal reflection. This produces an evanescent wave at the reflecting surface.
hasExactSynonym: standard atomic force microscopy infrared microscopy

Class.label: surface atomic force infrared microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: The simultaneous collection of AFM topography data and spatially-resolved infrared spectra by measuring the infrared absorption via transient deformation of the AFM cantilever induced by an infrared pulsed laser (tuned to a wavelength that corresponds to a vibrational absorbing wavelength in the specimen) as a function of AFM tip position. Mid-IR radiation, generated using a periodically poled LiNbO3 crystal emitting tuneable laser is focussed directly on the specimen surface.
hasExactSynonym: surface atomic force microscopy infrared microscopy

Class.label: atomic force microscopy infrared image
Class.IAO_0000115: A data set derived from AFMIR consisting of a three-dimensional image where two axes describe the x and y spatial dimensions and the third dimension represents the infrared wavelength.
hasExactSynonym: atomic force microscopy infrared chemical map

Class.label: contact mode atomic force microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy which uses a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. An image of the surface is obtained by mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan of the specimen, line by line, and recording the deflection of the tip, which is in contact with the specimen surface, as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Class.label: scanning spreading resistance microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy which uses a sharp conductive spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen. A two-dimensional map of the carrier concentration profile (resistance) of the semiconducting specimen is obtained by applying a DC bias between the probe and specimen and mechanically moving the probe in a raster scan line-by-line, and recording the current as a function of position. A feedback loop is used to maintain a fixed relationship between the tip and surface during scanning.

Class.label: inverse gas chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A surface characterisation technique in which a pulse or constant concentration of a known gas or vapour (probe molecule) is injected into a column packed with the solid sample at a fixed carrier gas flow rate. The retention time of the probe molecule is then measured using a  traditional gas chromatography detector.

Class.label: desorption measurements
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for determining surface area by measuring the amount of an inert gasesous or liquid substance (the 'sorbent', usually H2 or N2) which desorbs from the surface of interest (the 'sorbate'). Regression analysis is then applied to the data, resulting in an isotherm.

Class.label: thermal desorption spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method of observing desorbed molecules from a surface when the surface temperature is increased. The sample is heated slowly in a vacuum and residual gas in the vacuum is detected as a change in pressure.

Class.label: thermal desorption spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of intensity or rate vs. temperature obtained by heating the sample slowly in a vacuum and measuring the change in pressure as molecules desorb from the surface of the sample.

Class.label: electronic sum-frequency generation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for generating surface-specific electronic spectra by mixing two light beams at a surface and detecting the output beam, which has frequency equal to the sum of the two input frequencies.

Class.label: alternating current force spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where an atomic force microscope is used to measure the force experienced by a sample. The method involves the application of a small sinusoidal oscillating force to the tip via a magnetic field created by a conducting coil which interacts with a magnetic particle glued on the backside of the cantilever and measuring the change in amplitude during the approach and retraction of the sample.

Class.label: coulometer
Class.IAO_0000115: Any piece of apparatus used to measure electric charge.

Class.label: Karl-Fischer coulometric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining trace amounts of water in a sample by the titration of sulphur dioxide in water using iodine. In this method the I2 is generated electrochemically from I- and titrated with sulphur dioxide.

Class.label: Karl--Fischer coulometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an electrolytic cell with an anodic compartment containing sulfur dioxide (SO2), iodide (Iï¿½) and a cathodic compartment containing the sample, which is used to determine trace amounts of water in a sample by measuring the time and current flow required to reach the titration end-point.

Class.label: electrochemical coulometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an electrolytic cell, that is used to determine electric charge by measuring the amount of an element deposited or released at the cathode during a specified time.

Class.label: Karl--Fischer volumetric titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining trace amounts of water in a sample by the titration of sulphur dioxide in water using iodine. In this method the titrant is added directly to the sample using a burette.

Class.label: ellipsometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a laser, a polariser, a compensator (which elliptically polarises the light) and a detector, which is used to measure the intensity and change in polarisation of light reflected by a sample. This information in turn can be used to determine refractive index and thin film thickness.

Class.label: spectroscopic ellipsometer
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a light source, a polariser, a compensator (which elliptically polarises the light) and a detector, which is used to measure the intensity and change in polarisation of light reflected by a sample as a function of wavelength. This information in turn can be used to determine refractive index and thin film thickness.

Class.label: dynamic force micrograph
Class.IAO_0000115: An image obtained by using a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen, line by line, and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position. The tip oscillates, intermittently touching or tapping the surface.

Class.label: atomic force microscopy height profile
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of vertical displacement vs. distance obtained by using a sharp spike (known as a 'tip') mounted on the end of a cantilever to scan the surface of the specimen, line by line, and recording the force experienced by the tip as a function of position.

Class.label: photodetachment photoelectron spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample is illuminated with a fixed-energy light source resulting in the detachment of electrons, the energies of which are measured.

Class.label: attenuated total reflectance Fourier transform infrared spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of absorbance or emission vs. wavelength/wavenumber/frequency obtained through a Fourier transform of the times series of the absorption or emission of a sample that has been excited by an infrared-frequency pulse. The infrared light is introduced into a prism at an angle exceeding the critical angle for internal reflection. This produces an evanescent wave at the reflecting surface (a surface which is transparent to infrared such as thallium bromide) on which the sample is supported. The distortion of the evanescent wave by the sample is measured.
hasExactSynonym: Fourier transform infrared attenuated total reflectance (FTIR-ATR) spectra
Fourier transform infrared attenuated total reflectance (FTIR-ATR) spectrum
Fourier transform infrared attenuated total reflectance spectra
Fourier transform infrared attenuated total reflectance spectrum
Fourier transform infrared attenuated total reflection (FTIR-ATR) spectra
Fourier transform infrared attenuated total reflection (FTIR-ATR) spectrum
attenuated total reflectance Fourier transform infra-red spectra
attenuated total reflectance Fourier transform infra-red spectrum
attenuated total reflectance Fourier transform infrared spectra
attenuated total reflectance Fourier transform infrared spectrum
attenuated total reflection-Fourier transform infrared (ATR-FTIR) spectra
attenuated total reflection-Fourier transform infrared (ATR-FTIR) spectrum

Class.label: gas chromatogram
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of detector signal (e.g. ion count or  absorbance) vs. retention time obtained from a column chromatography experiment where the mobile phase is a gas.

Class.label: Nyquist plot
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of complex impedance vs. frequency that reflects the change in impedance (the resistance of alternating current) of an electrochemical cell.

Class.label: synchrotron circular dichroism spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy based on the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised synchrotron radiation (radiation produced by the movement of charged particles in a magnetic field).

Class.label: synchrotron circular dichroism spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of ellipticity vs. wavelength obtained by measuring the differential absorption of left- and right-handed circularly polarised synchrotron radiation as a function of wavelength.

Class.label: two-photon emission spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A photoluminescence spectrum where the excitation process involves two-photon absorption.

Class.label: two-photon excited fluorescence spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A fluorescence spectrum where the excitation process involves two-photon absorption.

Class.label: fluorescence image
Class.IAO_0000115: A 2D image obtained by measuring fluorescence.

Class.label: two-photon fluorescence image
Class.IAO_0000115: A fluorescence image obtained through a two-photon excitation process.

Class.label: photoelectron spectroscopy of adsorbed xenon
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where Xe atoms adsorbed on the surface of a sample are illuminated with photons causing ionisation and the emission of photoelectrons which are detected. The binding energy of the core or valence levels of Xe weakly bound to the surface, relative to the Fermi level of the substrate, depends on the local work function of its adsorption site.

Class.label: chiral supercritical-fluid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where the components (in this case stereoisomers) are distributed between two chiral phases, one of which is stationary, while the other moves in a definite direction (the 'mobile phase'). In this method the mobile phase is a fluid above and relatively close to its critical temperature and pressure.

Class.label: chiral chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: A separation method where the components (in this case stereoisomers) are distributed between two chiral phases, one of which is stationary, while the other moves in a definite direction.

Class.label: 1H--13C heteronuclear multiple bond coherence spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A heteronuclear NMR spectrum where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between 1H and 13C nuclei which are 2--3 bonds removed.

Class.label: 1H--15N heteronuclear multiple bond coherence spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A heteronuclear NMR spectrum where a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between 1H and 15N nuclei which are 2--3 bonds removed.

Class.label: Fourier transform far-infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation in the far infrared region (15--1000 \mum) and the spectrum obtained is subject to a Fourier transform.

Class.label: Fourier transform far-infrared spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of absorbance or emission vs. wavelength/wavenumber/frequency obtained through a Fourier transform of the times series of the absorption of a sample that has been excited by an far-infrared-frequency pulse.

Class.label: fluorescence speckle microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy where a very low concentration of fluorescent subunits in a polymer or peptide reveals the assembly dynamics, movement and turnover of assemblies throughout the image.

Class.label: force spectroscopy mapping
Class.IAO_0000115: The measurement of spatially resolved force--distance curves using an atomic force microscope to produce a chemical profile image.

Class.label: Bonnemann method
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for producing metal nanoparticles by the reduction of metal salts with tetraalkylammonium hydrotriorganoborates. The resulting colloids are highly active hydrogenation catalysts.

Class.label: liquid-phase nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy in the liquid phase where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation.
hasExactSynonym: liquid phase nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy

Class.label: gas-phase nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy in the gas phase where the energy states of spin-active nuclei placed in a static magnetic field are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation.
hasExactSynonym: gas phase nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy

Class.label: liquid chromatography nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before the energy states of spin-active nuclei in the sample, placed in a static magnetic field, are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation.
hasExactSynonym: liquid chromatography nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy

Class.label: liquid chromatography-nuclear magnetic resonance-mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before the energy states of spin-active nuclei in the sample, placed in a static magnetic field, are interrogated by inducing transitions between the states via radio frequency irradiation. The sample is then converted into ions which are characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
hasExactSynonym: liquid chromatography nuclear magnetic resonance mass spectrometry

Class.label: two-dimensional infrared spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the sample absorbs radiation from the infrared region (0.78--1000 \mum) over two frequency axes. Cross peaks in the spectrum encode the couplings and orientation between vibrations.

Class.label: 13C--15N rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 13C and 15N nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period, allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and, thus, yielding distance information.

Class.label: scanning vibrating electrode technique
Class.IAO_0000115: A technique that operates by mechanically vibrating a probe at a fixed amplitude, frequency and height over an electrochemically active sample in solution measuring and mapping the electric field generated by the sample. This technique is used to probe the nature of corrosion processes.

Class.label: magnetic resonance force microscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Microscopy which uses a cantilever tipped with a ferromagnetic (iron cobalt) particle to directly detect a modulated spin gradient force between sample spins and the tip to scan the surface of a magnetic specimen. As the ferromagnetic tip moves close to the sample, the nuclear spins become attracted to it and generate a small force on the cantilever. The spins are then repeatedly flipped, causing the cantilever to gently sway back and forth in a synchronous motion. That displacement is measured with an interferometer to create a series of 2D images of the sample.

Class.label: steady-state fluorescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where the intensity of the fluorescence emitted by molecules excited by constant illumination of ultraviolet light is detected as a function of wavelength.

Class.label: 31P--13C rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 31P and 13C nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period, allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and, thus, yielding distance information.

Class.label: 31P--15N rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 31P and 15N nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period, allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and, thus, yielding distance information.

Class.label: 31P--19F rotational-echo double-resonance spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A magic angle spinning NMR experiment in which the evolution of dipolar couplings between 31P and 19F nuclei is controlled by applying pulses at appropriate points in the rotational period, allowing the determination of the size of the coupling and, thus, yielding distance information.

Class.label: size-exclusion chromatography-flame atomic absorption spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method where the sample mixture is first separated by size-exclusion chromatography and then aspirated, aerosolised, and mixed with combustible gases, such as acetylene and air or acetylene and nitrous oxide. The mixture is then ignited and atomised in a flame whose temperature ranges from 2100--2800 \degC. During combustion, atoms of the element of interest in the sample absorb light at characteristic wavelengths.
hasExactSynonym: size-exclusion chromatography flame atomic absorption spectrometry
size-exclusion chromatography flame atomic absorption spectroscopy

Class.label: quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Mass spectrometry where the mass-to-charge ratio of the sample ions is measured whilst the ions are held in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes. The sample ions with different masses are accelerated to the same (known) kinetic energy and the time taken for each ion to reach a detector at a known distance is measured.

Class.label: microwave induced plasma atomic emission detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A detection method that is sensitive to individual elements. The sample is both atomised and excited by a microwave-induced plasma (a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals). The characteristic radiation emitted by the atoms in the sample is then detected using a photodiode array.

Class.label: gas chromatography-microwave-induced plasma atomic emission detection
Class.IAO_0000115: A gas chromatography method that is sensitive to individual elements. The eluent is both atomised and excited by a microwave-induced plasma (a partially ionised gas containing free electrons and radicals). The characteristic radiation emitted by the atoms in the sample is then detected using a photodiode array.
hasExactSynonym: gas chromatography microwave-induced plasma atomic emission detection

Class.label: chemiluminescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where luminesence (the emission of visible light) from molecules as a result of a chemical reaction) is detected as a function of wavelength.

Class.label: thermoluminescence spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectroscopy where thermoluminescence (visible light emitted by certain crystalline materials when previously absorbed energy from electromagnetic radiation or other ionizing radiation is re-emitted as light upon heating of the material) is detected as a function of wavelength.

Class.label: isomorphous replacement
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for providing phasing necessary for X-ray crystallography information by introducing heavy atoms into isomorphous crystals.

Class.label: single isomorphous replacement
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for providing phasing necessary for X-ray crystallography information by growing a crystal of the sample substituted with heavy metal atoms and analysing the X-ray data for both the original crystal and the isomorph.

Class.label: multiple isomorphous replacement
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for providing phasing necessary for X-ray crystallography information by growing a number of crystals of the sample substituted with different heavy metal atoms and analysing the X-ray data for each crystal.

Class.label: multiple isomorphous replacement with anomalous scattering
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for providing phasing necessary for X-ray crystallography information by growing a number of crystals of the sample substituted with different heavy metal atoms and analysing the X-ray data for each crystal. When the absorption edge of an atom in the crystals is close to the wavelength of the incident radiation the atom becomes an anomalous scatterer. Anomalous scattering can be used for phase determination and also for determining the absolute configuration.

Class.label: single isomorphous replacement with anomalous scattering
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for providing phasing necessary for X-ray crystallography information by growing a crystal of the sample substituted with heavy metal atoms and analysing the X-ray data for both the original crystal and the isomorph. When the absorption edge of an atom in the crystals is close to the wavelength of the incident radiation the atom becomes an anomalous scatterer. Anomalous scattering can be used for phase determination and also for determining the absolute configuration.

Class.label: paper spray mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Spectrometry where the sample spotted onto paper then solvent is applied and an electrically charged solvent is generated upon application of a high voltage. The ions are then characterised by their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.

Class.label: chemical cytometry
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for analysing cells suspended in a stream of fluid. Cells are loaded with fluorescent substrates (reporters) followed by laser-based lysis of a single cell and loading of its contents into an overlying capillary where chemical separation is accomplished via capillary electrophoresis.

Class.label: oxidation--reduction titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by monitoring a redox process until the endpoint, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached.

Class.label: electron paramagnetic resonance monitored oxidation--reduction titration
hasExactSynonym: electron paramagnetic resonance monitored redox titration
electron spin resonance monitored oxidation--reduction titration
electron spin resonance monitored redox titration
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of determining the quantity of a sample by monitoring a redox process until the endpoint, at which essentially all of the sample has reacted, is reached. The titration is followed by monitoring the amplitude of an EPR signal (the response of an atom with an unpaired electron to a perturbing magnetic field) from one of the reactants.

Class.label: paramagnetic signals enhancement
Class.IAO_0000115: A method for NMR spectra acquisition of paramagnetic proteins, based on the use of homonuclear broadband decoupling of the diamagnetic region.

Class.label: nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy-correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear three-dimensional NMR experiment in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart). These signals are then correlated with those protons to which they are J-coupled (usually \leq 3 bonds apart).

Class.label: correlation spectroscopy-nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear three-dimensional NMR experiment in which a second frequency dimension is employed to disperse the signals and reveal correlations between nuclei which are J-coupled (usually \leq 3 bonds apart). These signals are then correlated to nuclei that are spatially proximate within the molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart).

Class.label: total correlation spectroscopy-nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear three-dimensional NMR experiment spectroscopy which reveals correlations between all nuclei of a spin-system. These signals are then correlated to nuclei that are spatially proximate within the molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart).

Class.label: nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy-total correlation spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy which reveal correlations between all nuclei of a spin-system. These signals are then correlated to nuclei that are spatially proximate within the molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart).

Class.label: nuclear Overhauser enhancement spectroscopy with paramagnetic signals enhancement
Class.IAO_0000115: A type of homonuclear NMR spectroscopy based on the nuclear Overhauser enhancement effect in which correlations are seen between nuclei that are spatially proximate within a molecule (\leq 6 \AA apart). Spectra recorded with suppression of the diamagnetic window by the PASE pulse sequence.

Class.label: quantitative determination method
Class.IAO_0000115: A measurement method which obtains the concentration or quantity of a specified substance in an analyte.

Class.label: analyte role
Class.IAO_0000115: The role inhering in that portion of a sample which is measured by an experiment.

Class.label: eluent function
Class.IAO_0000115: A function which is realized as elution.

Class.label: elution
Class.IAO_0000115: A process wherein one material is extracted from another by interaction with a solvent.

Class.label: matrix
Class.IAO_0000115: Those components of a sample that are not measured by an experiment.

Class.label: matrix role
Class.IAO_0000115: The role inhering in that portion of a sample which is not measured by an experiment.

Class.label: experimental sample function
Class.IAO_0000115: The function inhering in a portion of material that is the subject of an experiment.

Class.label: experimental sample
Class.IAO_0000115: A portion of material that is the subject of an experiment.

Class.label: determination of copper
Class.IAO_0000115: A quantitative determination method where the analyte is copper.

Class.label: retention index
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental method output that consists of a number relating the adjusted retention volume or retention factor of the sample component to the adjusted retention volumes or retention factors of standards eluted before and after the peak of the sample component.

Class.label: ion source temperature setting
Class.IAO_0000115: The operating temperature to which an ion source is set.

Class.label: carrier gas flow rate
Class.IAO_0000115: The volume of carrier gas passing through a chromatography column in unit time.

Class.label: chromatography column length
Class.IAO_0000115: The length specified for a chromatography column.

Class.label: chromatography column inner diameter
Class.IAO_0000115: The inner diameter specified for a chromatography column.

Class.label: chromatography temperature program
Class.IAO_0000115: The plan specification for the temperatures in different places and times in a chromatography experiment.

Class.label: two-dimensional high performance liquid chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: High performance liquid chromatography where initial separation proceeds in a primary column and parts of the eleuent from this column are into a secondary column.

Class.label: cell membrane chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Affinity chromatography where a cell membrane has been immobilized on a silica carrier.

Class.label: methoxyamination derivatisation
Class.IAO_0000115: Derivatisation of a metabolite by addition of pyridinic methoxyamine to stabilise carbonyl moieties.
Class.comment: this typically happens prior to GC-MS, but not LC-MS

Class.label: trimethylsilyl derivatisation
Class.IAO_0000115: Derivatisation of a metabolite by addition of a trimethylsilyl reagent to protect functional groups such as hydroxy, carboxylic acid, thio and amine groups.
Class.comment: this typically happens prior to GC-MS, but not LC-MS

Class.label: water:chloroform 2:1 extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: Extraction of plant metabolites using a 2:1 v/v mixture of water and chloroform.

Class.label: water:methanol:chloroform 1:3:1 extraction
Class.IAO_0000115: Extraction of plant metabolites using a 1:3:1 v/v mixture of water, methanol and chloroform.

Class.label: equipment specification datum
Class.IAO_0000115: A data item that describes a non-adjustable specification of a piece of equipment.
Class.comment: Example: the length of a chromatography column as ordered from a supplier or indeed a glassblower. To be distinguished from a 'setting datum', IAO:0000140, which I take to be an adjustable parameter. Placeholder for now.

Class.label: negative mode atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry where the sample is ionized by interaction with negative ions.

Class.label: positive mode atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry
Class.IAO_0000115: Atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry where the sample is ionized by interaction with positive ions.

Class.label: APCI+ MS spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A mass spectrum obtained from positive mode atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry.

Class.label: APCI- MS spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A mass spectrum obtained from negative mode atmospheric pressure chemical ionization mass spectrometry.

Class.label: heteronuclear correlation spectrum
Class.IAO_0000115: A spectrum obtained from a heteronuclear correlation experiment.

Class.label: C18 column
Class.IAO_0000115: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is an octadecyl-bonded silica.

Class.label: gas chromatograph-mass spectrometer transfer line
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus connecting a gas chromatograph to a mass spectrometer.

Class.label: gas chromatograph-mass spectrometer transfer line temperature setting
Class.IAO_0000115: The specified temperature for a gas chromatograph-mass spectrometer transfer line.

Class.label: sample heating
Class.IAO_0000115: A sample preparation step involving the increase in temperature of a sample.
Class.comment: ought to be in OBI. Will put here pro tem.

Class.label: concentrating
Class.IAO_0000115: A preparative step where the concentration of one component is increased.

Class.label: degassing
Class.IAO_0000115: A preparative step involving the removal of dissolved gases from a sample.

Class.label: dissolving
Class.IAO_0000115: A mixing step where a soluble component is mixed with a liquid component.

Class.label: stirring
Class.IAO_0000115: Mixing involving the agitation of a solution through circular motion.

Class.label: magnetic stirring
Class.IAO_0000115: Stirring achieved by rotating a magnetic stir bar in a solution.

Class.label: Kugelrohr condenser
Class.IAO_0000115: A short-path vacuum distillation apparatus consisting of an electric heater and two or more glass bulbs. The compound to be distilled is placed in the last bulb.

Class.label: copper K-alpha source
Class.IAO_0000115: An X-ray source where copper atoms emit X-rays through a 1s from 2p transition.

Class.label: molybdenum K-alpha source
Class.IAO_0000115: An X-ray source where molybdenum atoms emit X-rays through a 1s from 2p transition.

Class.label: cobalt K-alpha source
Class.IAO_0000115: An X-ray source where cobalt atoms emit X-rays through a 1s from 2p transition.

Class.label: aluminium K-alpha source
Class.IAO_0000115: An X-ray source where aluminium atoms emit X-rays through a 1s from 2p transition.

Class.label: silica gel
Class.IAO_0000115: Vitreous silica in granular form for experimental purposes.

Class.label: laboratory atmosphere
Class.IAO_0000115: A gaseous environment in which an experiment takes place. This may be unreactive in order to prevent unintended reactions or reactive (for example gaseous hydrogen) to promote reactions.
Class.comment: Not to be confused with OBI's "atmosphere", OBI:0001498, which is biological.

Class.label: argon atmosphere
Class.IAO_0000115: A laboratory atmosphere consisting of argon.

Class.label: nitrogen atmosphere
Class.IAO_0000115: A laboratory atmosphere consisting of gaseous diatomic nitrogen.

Class.label: filter cake
Class.IAO_0000115: The material left behind in the filter as a result of filtration.

Class.label: syringe pump
Class.IAO_0000115: A syringe which has the function of pumping material into an experiment.

Class.label: hydrogen atmosphere
Class.IAO_0000115: A laboratory atmosphere consisting of gaseous diatomic hydrogen.

Class.label: hydrogenator
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus for carrying out hydrogenation reactions, usually under high pressure.
Class.comment: See for example http://www.parrinst.com/products/hydrogenation/3926-hydrogenator/

Class.label: fragmentor voltage
Class.IAO_0000115: A setting datum that specifies the potential difference in a mass spectrometer where labile ions may dissociate.

Class.label: skimmer voltage
Class.IAO_0000115: A setting datum that specifies the potential difference across a skimmer.

Class.label: capillary voltage
Class.IAO_0000115: A setting datum that specifies the potential difference across the tip of the capillary in electrospray ionisation.

Class.label: sensor
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that is used to measure a physical quantity.

Class.label: chemosensor
Class.IAO_0000115: A sensor that recognises the analyte under study by interaction with a given chemical motif.

Class.label: biosensor
Class.IAO_0000115: A sensor that recognises the analyte under study by interaction with a given biological system.

Class.label: dosimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: Measurement of the dose of a substance taken up by an object.

Class.label: dosimeter
Class.IAO_0000115: A sensor that is used to measure the dose of a substance taken by up an object.

Class.label: chemodosimetry
Class.IAO_0000115: Measurement of the dose of ions or small molecules taken up by an object.

Class.label: chemodosimeter
Class.IAO_0000115: A sensor that is used to measure the dose of ions or small molecules taken by up an object.

Class.label: muffle furnace
Class.IAO_0000115: A device for heating substances to high temperatures where the material is kept separate from the fuel.

Class.label: limit of detection
Class.IAO_0000115: The smallest measure that can be detected with reasonable certainty for a given analytical procedure.
Class.comment: xL = <x> + ks where <x> is the mean of the blank measures, s is the standard deviation and k is a numerical factor chosen according to the desired confidence level.

Class.label: limit of quantification
Class.IAO_0000115: The smallest measure that can be quantified with reasonable certainty for a given analytical procedure.

Class.label: figure of merit
Class.IAO_0000115: A data item that describes a non-adjustable specification of a method.
Class.comment: Example: limit of detection of a technique.

Class.label: blank value
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental method output originating from the matrix, reagents and any residual bias in the measurement device or process, which contributes to the value obtained for the quantity in the analytical procedure.

Class.label: working range
Class.IAO_0000115: The range of measures which can be quantified with reasonable certainty for a given analytical procedure.

Class.label: microextraction
Class.IAO_0000115: The transfer of a microlitre amount of solute from a liquid phase to another immiscible or partially-miscible liquid phase in contact with it.

Class.label: linear range
Class.IAO_0000115: The working range over which the response is linearly proportional to the measure.

Class.label: gas chromatography oven
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of heating apparatus used to convert the sample into a gaseous mobile phase.

Class.label: piece of heating apparatus
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that is used to raise the temperature of a sample.

Class.label: flame ionisation detector
Class.IAO_0000115: A piece of apparatus that consists of an oven, and apparatus to mix carrier gas containing the sample with hydrogen and air, then ignite it and collect the resulting positively-charged radicals at a cathode.

Class.label: magnesium K-alpha source
Class.IAO_0000115: An X-ray source where magnesium atoms emit X-rays through a 1s from 2p transition.

Class.label: glass-like carbon electrode
Class.IAO_0000115: An electrode consisting of agranular non-graphitizable carbon with high isotropy and low permeability for liquids and gases.

Class.label: in situ diffuse reflectance infrared Fourier transform spectroscopy
Class.IAO_0000115: Diffuse reflectance infrared Fourier transform spectroscopy of a sample that is carried out in the environment where the sample might be used.
Class.comment: For example, the sample might be a catalyst, so during those catalytic processes.

Class.label: measurement of concentration
Class.IAO_0000115: A measurement method that determines the concentration of a constituent in some solution.

Class.label: solubility
Class.IAO_0000115: The concentration of a solute in a saturated solution.
Class.comment: We will probably need to add solubility expressed as a mass concentration and so forth for the different cases.

Class.label: measurement of solubility in water
Class.IAO_0000115: Measurement of concentration of a solute in water.

Class.label: optical activity
Class.IAO_0000115: The disposition of a sample to rotate the plane of polarization of a beam of transmitted plane-polarized light.

Class.label: angle of optical rotation
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental method output that consists of the angle through which plane polarized light is rotated clockwise, as seen when facing the light source, in passing through an optically active medium.

Class.label: temperature-programmed absorption
Class.IAO_0000115: A sample preparation method where a sample is heated slowly in a gas.

Class.label: concentration
Class.IAO_0000115: Experimental method output expressing the contribution of one constituent to the composition of a mixture.
Class.comment: based heavily on doi:10.1351/goldbook.C01222

Class.label: mass concentration
Class.IAO_0000115: Experimental method output expressing a concentration in terms of the mass of a constituent divided by the volume of the mixture.
Class.comment: based heavily on doi:10.1351/goldbook.M03713

Class.label: amount concentration
Class.IAO_0000115: Experimental method output expressing a concentration in terms of the amount of a constituent divided by the volume of the mixture.
Class.comment: based heavily on doi:10.1351/goldbook.A00295

Class.label: volume concentration
Class.IAO_0000115: Experimental method output expressing a concentration in terms of the volume of a constituent divided by the volume of the mixture.
Class.comment: based heavily on doi:10.1351/goldbook.C01222

Class.label: number concentration
Class.IAO_0000115: Experimental method output expressing a concentration in terms of the number of entities of a constituent divided by the volume of the mixture.
Class.comment: based heavily on doi:10.1351/goldbook.N04260

Class.label: solubility in water
Class.IAO_0000115: The concentration of a solute in a saturated solution of water and the solute.

Class.label: weighing
Class.IAO_0000115: Determination of the mass of a sample.

Class.label: experimental planning process
Class.IAO_0000115: A process that contributes to producing a plan for an experiment.

Class.label: storage in dimethyl sulfoxide
Class.comment: CHEBI:28262 here is a placeholder - really there should be a portion of material descendant like 'buffer solution'
Class.IAO_0000115: Storage of a sample that has been dissolved in dimethyl sulfoxide.

Class.label: experimental plan revision
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental planning process in which a plan specification is modified, resulting in a new plan specification.

Class.label: material acquisition
Class.IAO_0000115: A planned process in which materials for an experiment are acquired from an external supplier.

Class.label: material disposal
Class.IAO_0000115: A planned process in which materials for an experiment are removed permanently from the laboratory.
Class.comment: makes no judgement about whether this is a good way to do it, or a bad way such as tipping down the sink.

Class.label: experimental plan creation
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental planning process in which a plan specification is created de novo.

Class.label: polymerisation propagation rate coefficient determination
Class.IAO_0000115: An assay to determine the propagation rate coefficient of a polymerisation process.

Class.label: Stöber process
Class.IAO_0000115: A material processing process that produces monodisperse particles of silica by adding tetraethyl silicate to an excess of water containing a low-molar-mass alcohol and stirring.

Class.label: nanoparticle synthesis
Class.IAO_0000115: A material processing process that is intended to produce nanoparticles.

Class.label: nanostructure synthesis
Class.IAO_0000115: A material processing process that is intended to produce nanostructures.

Class.label: planned process setup
Class.IAO_0000115: A planned process involving setting up the equipment for another planned process.

Class.label: planned process startup
Class.IAO_0000115: Part of a planned process where the equipment has been set up and human intervention is required to set the subprocesses going.

Class.label: planned process adjustment
Class.IAO_0000115: A process that involves adjusting a planned process in some respect. This may either be to adjust a parameter not fully specified in the plan or to adjust a parameter that was already specified in the plan.

Class.label: stopped process adjustment
Class.IAO_0000115: A planned process adjustment that takes place when the subprocesses of the planned process have been suspended.

Class.label: ongoing process adjustment
Class.IAO_0000115: A planned process adjustment that takes place while at least one subprocess is taking place.
Class.comment: needs a bit of tweakage, I expect. What about "waiting"?

Class.label: hazard reduction
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental plan revision that involves creating a new experimental plan that has a lessened hazard compared to its predecessor.
Class.comment: was hazard replacement

Class.label: waste management
Class.IAO_0000115: A planned process that involves all aspects of dealing with the waste produced in experiments.

Class.label: autoclaving
Class.IAO_0000115: A material processing step that involves heating apparatus in an autoclave.
Class.comment: does every autoclaving happen as part of waste management?

Class.label: limit of linearity
Class.IAO_0000115: The largest measure at which the sensitivity of the detector is constant to within a specified variation.

Class.label: dynamic range
Class.comment: The dynamic range is greater than the linear range.
Class.IAO_0000115: The working range over which an incremental change in concentration or mass flow rate produces an incremental change in response.

Class.label: repeatability standard deviation
Class.comment: Same operator, same apparatus, same laboratory, after short intervals of time.
Class.IAO_0000115: The standard deviation of independent measurements obtained with the same method on identical test material under the same conditions.

Class.label: reproducibility standard deviation
Class.IAO_0000115: The standard deviation of independent measurements obtained with the same method on identical test material under different conditions.
Class.comment: different operator, different apparatus, different laboratory, and/or after different intervals of time.

Class.label: spiked sample
Class.IAO_0000115: An experimental sample that is produced by spiking test material that is essentially free of a given analyte.

Class.label: spiking
Class.IAO_0000115: A material processing step that involves taking a test material with an adequately low background level of the intended analyte and mixing it with a known amount of analyte.

Class.label: fraction extracted
Class.IAO_0000115: The fraction of the total quantity of a substance extracted in a separation experiment under specified conditions.

Class.label: sample throughput
Class.IAO_0000115: The quantity of gas, in pressure-volume units, at a specified temperature, flowing per unit time across a specified open cross section.

Class.label: percentage yield
Class.IAO_0000115: The mass of the product of a synthesis expressed as a percentage of the theoretical maximum mass given the masses of the reactants.

Class.label: enantiomer excess
Class.IAO_0000115: The absolute value of the mole fraction for one enantiomer in a mixture minus the mole fraction for the other enantiomer.
Class.comment: most people quote percentage enantiomer excess, CHMO:2857

Class.label: percentage enantiomer excess
Class.IAO_0000115: The absolute value of the mole fraction for one enantiomer in a mixture minus the mole fraction for the other enantiomer multiplied by 100%.

Class.label: diastereomeric ratio
Class.IAO_0000115: The ratio of the percentage of one diastereomer in a mixture to that of the other.

Class.label: enantiomeric ratio
Class.IAO_0000115: The ratio of the percentage of one enantiomer in a mixture to that of the other.

Class.label: diastereomeric excess
Class.IAO_0000115: The absolute value of the mole fraction for one diastereomer in a mixture minus the mole fraction for the other.

Class.label: percentage diastereomeric excess
Class.IAO_0000115: The absolute value of the mole fraction for one diastereomer in a mixture minus the mole fraction for the other multiplied by 100%.

Class.label: high performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry
certified reference material
Class.IAO_0000115: A reference material that has been certified by an appropriate authority.
Class.comment: For example NIST in the USA or the Community Bureau of Reference.

Class.label: minicolumn
Class.IAO_0000115: A chromatography column that is small enough to use in a 96-plate microarray.

Class.label: anisotropic nucleus-nucleus interaction line broadening minimization objective
Class.IAO_0000115: An objective to minimize line broadening in solid state NMR that is caused by anisotropic interactions between nuclei.
Class.comment: Usually solved by magic-angle spinning.

Class.label: slotted disc
Class.IAO_0000115: A disc with a slot in it.
Class.comment: This is used in photoacoustic spectroscopy to break a continuous laser beam into a pulsed one.

Class.label: two-dimensional gas chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Chromatography where the mobile phase is a gas, initial separation proceeds in a primary column and parts of the eluent from this column are directed into a secondary column.

Class.label: immunoaffinity microextraction
Class.IAO_0000115: Microextraction using an antibody where the specificity is related to the specificity of the antibody to the compound of interest.

Class.label: immunoaffinity chromatography
Class.IAO_0000115: Affinity chromatography where the separation is caused by differing antibody-ligand interactions.

Class.label: excitation laser function
Class.IAO_0000115: Function of a laser realized by it exciting some internal state of a sample.

Class.label: probe laser function
Class.IAO_0000115: Function of a laser realized by its interactions with internal state of a sample being measured.

Class.label: excitation laser
Class.IAO_0000115: A laser that has the function of exciting some internal state of a sample.

Class.label: probe laser
