Class.IAO_0000115: A laser that has the function of probing some internal state of a sample.

Class.label: magnetron
Class.IAO_0000115: A device that uses electrical and magnetic fields to generate heat.

Class.label: polarimeter
Class.IAO_0000115: A device that measures the angle of optical rotation of a sample.

Class.label: polarimetry of sample dissolved in chloroform
Class.IAO_0000115: Polarimetry of a sample that has been dissolved in chloroform.

Class.label: polarimetry of sample dissolved in dimethyl sulfoxide
Class.IAO_0000115: Polarimetry of a sample that has been dissolved in dimethyl sulfoxide.

Class.label: angle of optical rotation in chloroform
Class.IAO_0000115: Angle of optical rotation of a substance that has been obtained with it dissolved in chloroform.

Class.label: angle of optical rotation in dimethyl sulfoxide
Class.IAO_0000115: Angle of optical rotation of a substance that has been obtained with it dissolved in dimethyl sulfoxide.

Class.label: Faraday efficiency
Class.IAO_0000115: A measure of the efficiency by which charge is transferred in a chemical reaction.

Class.label: cycling stability
Class.IAO_0000115: A measure of how the discharge capacity of a battery is maintained over a given number of cycles.

Class.label: CTAB-assisted hydrothermal synthesis
Class.comment: For example for making ZnO nanorods.
Class.IAO_0000115: Hydrothermal synthesis that uses cetyltrimethylammonium bromide to guide the morphology of the product.

Class.label: microwave-assisted hydrothermal synthesis
Class.IAO_0000115: Hydrothermal synthesis that makes use of microwave radiation to affect the course of reaction.

Class.label: temperature-programmed oxidation
Class.IAO_0000115: Thermal analysis of a system where the consumption of dioxygen in moles per second per gram of material is measured against temperature.

Class.label: temperature-programmed reduction
Class.IAO_0000115: Thermal analysis of a system where the consumption of reducing agent in moles per second per gram of material is measured against temperature.

Class.label: temperature-programmed oxidation profile
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of the consumption of dioxygen in moles per second per gram of material against temperature obtained from a temperature-programmed oxidation experiment.

Class.label: temperature-programmed reduction profile
Class.IAO_0000115: A plot of the consumption of a reducing agent in moles per second per gram of material against temperature obtained from a temperature-programmed reduction experiment.

Class.label: magic angle spinning
Class.IAO_0000115: Spinning a sample very rapidly at the magic angle (54.74 deg with respect to the direction of the magnetic field) in order to average anisotropic interactions between nuclei, which are usually averaged by Brownian motion in liquid samples, to zero.

Class.label: figure-of-merit determination
Class.IAO_0000115: An assay that determines a figure of merit for a given technique, analyte and matrix. This will consist of multiple assays of a reference material.

Class.label: reference material
Class.IAO_0000115: A substance or mixture of substances, the composition of which is known within specified limits, and one or more of the properties of which is sufficiently well established to be used for the calibration of an apparatus, the assessment of a measuring method or for assigning values to materials.

Class.label: absorption of material
Class.comment: Gold Book, somewhat modified. It goes on "The process of one material (absorbate) being retained by another (absorbent); this may be the physical solution of a gas, liquid, or solid in a liquid, attachment of molecules of a gas, vapour, liquid, or dissolved substance to a solid surface by physical forces, etc."
Class.IAO_0000115: The process of one material (absorbate) being retained by another (absorption).

Class.label: absorption of radiation
Class.IAO_0000115: A phenomenon in which radiation transfers to matter which it traverses some or all of its energy.

Class.label: protective equipment
Class.IAO_0000115: Equipment that is used in a laboratory context to prevent or mitigate adverse laboratory events.

Class.label: emergency response equipment
Class.IAO_0000115: Equipment that is used in a laboratory context to mitigate adverse laboratory events.

Class.label: adverse laboratory event
Class.IAO_0000115: An event that takes place in a laboratory that may unintentionally harm an organism or piece of apparatus.

Class.label: laboratory uncontrolled explosion
Class.comment: A controlled explosion might be, for example, in a bomb calorimeter.
Class.IAO_0000115: An explosion that takes place in a laboratory and is not controlled by the experimenter.

Class.label: personal protective equipment
Class.IAO_0000115: Laboratory safety equipment that prevents or mitigates adverse laboratory events happening to an experimenter.

Class.label: nitrile gloves
Class.IAO_0000115: Gloves consisting of a nitrile polymer.

Class.label: penetration of personal protective equipment
Class.IAO_0000115: An event where a poisonous substance penetrates personal protective equipment, endangering the experimenter.

Class.label: laboratory safety function
Class.IAO_0000115: The function ascribed to laboratory equipment to prevent or mitigate adverse laboratory events.

Class.label: blast screen
Class.IAO_0000115: A screen that blocks debris from an explosion.

Class.label: inhalation of poisonous fumes
Class.IAO_0000115: An adverse laboratory event where an experimenter inhales poisonous fumes.

Class.label: evolution of poisonous fumes
Class.IAO_0000115: An adverse laboratory event where a reacting species gives off a gas poisonous to the experimenter.

Class.label: fume hood
Class.IAO_0000115: A hood in which to conduct experiments that give off poisonous fumes that vents them to a non-enclosed environment.

Class.label: injury by flying debris
Class.IAO_0000115: An adverse laboratory event in which an organism comes into contact with the debris from an explosion at high speed.

Class.label: electrospray ionization
Class.IAO_0000115: A process in which ionized species in the gas phase are produced from an analyte-containing solution via highly charged fine droplets, by means of spraying the solution from a narrow-bore needle tip at atmospheric pressure in the presence of a high electric field. When a pressurized gas is used to aid in the formation of a stable spray, the term pneumatically assisted electrospray ionization is used. The term ion spray is not recommended.

Class.label: sensitivity
Class.IAO_0000115: A data item that measures the proportion of actual positives which are correctly identified as such (e.g. the percentage of sick people who are correctly identified as having the condition).

Class.label: specificity
Class.IAO_0000115: A data item that refers to the proportion of negatives in a binary classification test which are correctly identified.

Class.label: assay
Class.IAO_0000115: A planned process with the objective to produce information about the material entity that is the evaluant, by physically examining it or its proxies.

Class.label: material processing
Class.IAO_0000115: A planned process which results in physical changes in a specified input material.

Class.label: imaging assay
Class.IAO_0000115: An imaging assay is an assay to produce a picture of an entity.

Class.label: analyte assay
Class.IAO_0000115: An assay with the objective to capture information about the presence, concentration or amount of an analyte in the evaluant.

Class.label: ELISA
Class.IAO_0000115: ELISA is an assay where an enzyme linked antibody is used to detect a plate bound material in a liquid (the evaluant) utilizing a chemiluminescent reaction. The detected signal is proxy for the concentration of an analyte in the evaluant.

Class.label: purification objective
Class.IAO_0000115: The objective to separate a material entity into different compositions of which one or more have are purified fractions that contain higher concentration of a desired component, while others contain impurities and are not of interest.

Class.label: material maintenance
Class.IAO_0000115: A process with that achieves the objective to maintain some or all of the characteristics of an input material over time.

Class.label: device
Class.IAO_0000115: A material entity that is designed to perform a function in a scientific investigation, but is not a reagent.

Class.label: light emission device
Class.IAO_0000115: A device which has a function to emit light.

Class.label: pump function
Class.IAO_0000115: A transfer function where the transfer requires work to move the entity, often against a gradient.

Class.label: microwave synthesis system
Class.IAO_0000115: A device that is used to apply microwave irradiation to chemical reactions.

Class.label: X-ray source
Class.IAO_0000115: A device that is used to generate X-rays.

Class.label: principal components analysis dimensionality reduction
Class.IAO_0000115: A principal components analysis dimensionality reduction is a dimensionality reduction achieved by applying principal components analysis and by keeping low-order principal components and excluding higher-order ones.

Class.label: centrifugation
Class.IAO_0000115: A process separating molecules by size or density using centrifugal forces generated by a spinning rotor. G-forces of several hundred thousand times gravity are generated in ultracentrifugation.

Class.label: washing
Class.IAO_0000115: Washing is a process by which a material entity acting as contaminant (e.g. excess staining reagent) is removed by application of one or more cycles of solution in flow.

Class.label: storage
Class.IAO_0000115: A maintenance process by which material entities that are not actively metabolizing are placed in well identified location and possibly under controlled environment in ad-hoc devices/structures in order to preserve and protect them from decay/alteration and maintain availability.

Class.label: electroporation
Class.IAO_0000115: A process in which a significant increase in the electrical conductivity and permeability of the cell plasma membrane caused by an externally applied electrical field. It is usually used in molecular biology as a way of introducing some substance into a cell, such as loading it with a molecular probe, a drug that can change the cell's function, or a piece of coding DNA.

Class.label: laser
Class.IAO_0000115: A laser (acronym for light amplification by the stimulated emission of radiation) is a light source that emits photons of the same characteristics in a coherent beam. A laser uses a solid, liquid or gaseous lasing medium, that contains molecules, of which some atoms have electrons that emit photons of the same frequency when falling back to their normal orbital after excitation (pumping) by external means A laser is the most common way to irradiate a cell in a flow cytometer.

Class.label: light source
Class.IAO_0000115: A light source is an optical subsystem that provides light for use in a distant area using a delivery system (e.g., fiber optics). Light sources may include one of a variety of lamps (e.g., xenon, halogen, mercury). Most light sources are operated from line power, but some may be powered from batteries. They are mostly used in endoscopic, microscopic, and other examination and/or in surgical procedures. The light source is part of the optical subsystem. In a flow cytometer the light source directs high intensity light at particles at the interrogation point. The light source in a flow cytometer is usually a laser.

Class.label: material component separation
Class.IAO_0000115: A material processing in which components of an input material become segregated in space.
